title: Great hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text:
The Iroquois New York is very centrally located in Midtown Manhattan. It had an excellent breakfast. I traveled with my family (spouse and two teenaged children - ages 15 and 13 years old) and stayed for three nights. Our room on the fourth floor was surprisingly spacious. The beds are comfortable. The staff are friendly.  

We joined two Streetwise New York/Triumph Tours of: (1) NoMad and Flatiron District' (with guide Andrew); and (2) 'Grand Central, NY Public Library and Architectural Highlights' (with guide Sonya). The tours were very enjoyable. 

We would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

title: The Iroquois New York
text:
We had an amazing experience🤩
 Everyone was so nice and welcoming . 
The room was beautiful. 

It is located  only few blocks from times square and grand central . There are several cafe and restaurants with walking distance. I really enjoyed my time there and definitely go back.

Also, they have a beautiful speakeasy bar located in the main lobby with amazing cocktails selection and bites.

title: Go there, you won't regret it
text:
Located in a logistically strategic position to be a 5 minute walk from everything (5th Av, Times Square, Bryant Park, NYPL, Summit, various metro etc), this hotel fully met my expectations. Comfortable mattresses, room size compliant with the NYC average, the only flaw was that our bathroom was a little small and blind and there was no real wardrobe.
Good quality breakfast, with a basic range of options, but suitable to satisfy all palates.
Free bottles of water upon arrival, at breakfast and on request even before going to bed.
Top cleanliness and exquisite attention to details and furnishings.
The real plus of this hotel, however, remains the staff, attentive, prepared, always kind and smiling. A huge thank you to Marie, Kamille, Carlos and the colleagues whose names I couldn't read, when we return to NYC we will definitely be your guests again.

title: Iroquois Stay
text:
The Iroquois is a Lovely hotel in the centre of New York - the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful 
I Would definitely recommend to stay here if you are planning a visit to New York

title: Amazing staff, amazing hotel!
text:
First time staying at this hotel. Great location, super friendly staff, and great food in the bar lounge!
Definitely will stay here again! I loved the art deco design and historic vibe of the hotel. Breakfast was fantastic!

title: Great hotel at a great location
text: Would only recommend this hotel, not only due to its location but also for the quality of service. Room was clean where we came and kept clean and tidy during our stay. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Midtown
text: Great hotel in the heart of Midtown, cozy rooms, but not cramped or claustrophobic. The rooms are quiet and you will sleep soundly. Great staff! Nice breakfast and good coffee in the mornings. Very close to Times Square, Broadway, the library on Bryant, 5th Ave, Grand Central, etc.

title: Boutique stay in midtown
text:
This was a family trip with teen boys. It was close to Central Park for morning runs, and 5th ave for shopping. We utilized the NYC transit system a lot and this hotel was central to that as well.
Hotel staff were friendly, rooms were clean and charactered.

title: sleepless in nyc
text: The hotel is lovely, and clean, and the people are kind. I, however, could not sleep. Something about the orientation of the bed facing the door weirded me out. Not the hotel's fault! But for three nights in a row I woke up at 2:30am and unable to go back to sleep.

title: Excellent NY stay!
text: Nothing but good things to say. Staff is wonderful and room is lovely.  Bar is fabulous. Can’t beat the location if you are sightseeing or going to the theater . Walkable to so much and convenient to the trains to go anywhere.

title: Lovely Iroquois
text: The Iroquois is my go to hotel in NYC.  The location is convenient to Times Square and yet away from it.  It is a lovely luxury boutique hotel.  Service and staff members are superb.  Breakfast is really nice with many choices and the bar warm and friendly.

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: Such a great location in the heart of NYC! One reason we chose this hotel was previous reviews with how quiet it is on this street and it truly was very quiet. Not my experience staying at other hotels in NYC. We would stay here again!

title: Pretty good experience
text:
Had a pretty good time except for a few weird interactions with one specific person, a lady at the front desk. She was not very helpful or showed intentions to be helpful - reluctant to provide a cup of tea, kept telling me tea is served only during breakfast hours, when I asked what about outside of breakfast hours, she said we don't. I said "so there's no way I can get a cup of tea in the evening at this hotel?" To this she said I need to go to the adjacent bar (Lantern's Keep) and check if they had tea, yes, I need to go and check to the bar that is accessible via hotel lobby. She also said I probably need to pay for the tea. Thankfully the bartenders had better etiquette and served me a cup of tea with a smile and when I asked "how much", they said "on the house"! The same lady at the front desk asked me weird questions (in condescending tones) like "did you touch anything from the minibar?", yes, touch, not open, touch, or "did you pick up anything from the nightstand?", not open, but pick up! Not my favorite interaction and I felt that I am being treated badly! After the whole tea debacle I paid close attention and noticed that I was not being treated warmly (by her only). To be 100% certain, next evening there was a different person (another and a nicer lady) at the front desk and I asked for a cup of tea. She didn't say there are fixed hours for serving tea at the hotel, didn't ask me to go the bar and check, instead she got other members of the staff involved and the tea was brought to me :-)
My interactions with the rest of the staff was fantastic, they were all very welcoming and helpful.

title: Mr
text: I didn't have a good experience staying with you, today I went to have breakfast, there was no breakfast, I went to take a shower, the water doesn't heat up, your gym doesn't match what you can in Buquim, so I would like to report that my experience with you it wasn't good

title: Another great stay at the Iroquois
text: Have stayed here 3-4 times and each time is better and better. Clean, renovated lobby, wonderful restaurant. It is a surpursiingly quiet sleep as well, given the location, near times square. The staff is impeccable. Reminds me of a wonderful hotel in Paris I have stayed in.  Will return!

title: I highly recommend the Iroquois.
text: The hotel is beautiful, and the staff couldn’t be any nicer.  Anthony and Josh were the best.  The lobby and rooms were immaculate, with housekeeping daily.  The breakfast was great.  I read reviews that said it was only yogurt and muffins in a box to go, but that was not the case.  The dining room was adorable, and there was a good assortment of items - hot egg and cheese sandwiches (can add bacon), warmed regular and chocolate croissants, yogurt parfait cups, fruit cups, toast, English muffins and cereal.  There is also a coffee and juice bar.  All items can be eaten in the dining room or packaged to go.  The hotel also had unlimited water bottles, which is huge with all the walking we did.  We took advantage of the wine hour, but not the walking tours. The hotels location is great. It’s quiet, but close to Times Square - about a five minute walk. An 8 minute walk to Rockefeller Plaza, and 8-10 from Broadway.  There are multiple subway stations within a few minutes walk.  I can’t say anything bad about this hotel (and I am super picky). I would definitely stay there again.

title: A Great Start to a Great Weekend in NYC
text: This was our first time staying at the Iroquois Hotel and we loved it.  The location was great as it was located to many attractions (Times Square, Empire State Bldg, Radi City…), eateries, and various modes of transportation.  The daily breakfast was very good and consisted of bacon egg & cheese or egg & cheese sandwiches. Greek yoghurt with fruit & granola, cold cereal, croissants with butter and jams, fruit cups, coffee, apple and orange juices, and water and it was all you could eat from 8 to 11 am, or you could grab and go.  The staff were professional and very friendly, and willing to help.

title: Loved the Iroquois!
text: Excellent quaint hotel tucked away on a quiet street but very central to most tourist attractions. Ask for a courtyard room for extra silence. Room was small but very clean and had enough storage space. Free breakfast was a great perk as was the happy hour in the lobby. Excellent service from all the staff members who responded to emails very fast prior to arrival and any requests once there. They will also help arrange private transportation which we used. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again in the future.

title: Great Property!
text: You can't beat the convenience of this gem. The staff were all pleasant, the rooms well appointed, and the property well maintained. The included was a satisfying perk. I would happily stay here again.

title: great location
text:
We spent 5 nights in this hotel.
The location was perfect for us, as we planned our day trips on foot and by subway.
The staff at the reception were courteous and helpful, but we would have liked a little more attention at breakfast.
The breakfast was buffet style and included croissants, yogurt with muesli, fruit... you could also order scrambled eggs on buns or toasted bread and porridge.
Unfortunately, scrambled eggs without anything else was not possible.
It was fine for us for the time we stayed, but I would have liked more variety if we had stayed longer.
The room was big enough for us, as we only visited it in the evenings anyway because of the many activities.
If we plan another city trip to NY, we would choose this hotel again.

title: Would definitely go back
text: From the doorman  to the front desk staff,  the customer service was great.  Friendly and welcoming,  the hotel offers free bottled water  and clementines in the lobby.  The rooms were spotless ,  small but comfortable with bathrooms that look new.  The breakfast that was included was limited,  but good quality.

title: Holiday in New York
text: Boutique Hotel located in a fairly quiet street of this beautiful metropolis. Near Broadway and Time Square, it is a hotel that offers excellent service, excellent hospitality and highly trained staff. Rooms adequate to standards. Breakfast to be improved in the variety of products offered. Excellent breakfast service

title: A nice place for a staycation
text:
I live in Queens but had to work late one night stayed here. I've been to Lantern's Keep pretty often and have always loved the vibe there so I was excited to try the hotel. The room is cozy and perfect for one person or two. The best was comfortable and the bathroom had a nice shower and good amenities. It was a great stay.

The only downside I have is that the breakfast leaves something to be desired especially if you have dietary restrictions, but it's free and you can't beat that.

title: Excellent hotel right in Midtown
text: I recently stayed at this lovely hotel for a 3 days business trip and found it to be perfect for my needs. It is a great location, very clean and the staff went above and beyond to assist my needs. Shout out to Kamille, Cameron and Orlando for all their help in getting me situated. I will def stay here again.

title: Great things come in small packages
text: Centrally located with a small quaint feel this place was truly a gem. The staff were friendly and caring. The hotel bar was a great quiet sport for an intimate drink, while the hotel offered an easy approach to breakfast that was convenient and delicious. For staying in NYC this place felt like it was tucked away from the noise and bustle but in the heart of it all.

title: Nice small well-located  midtown hotel near grand central , the theater district , and central park.
text:
Nice small, well managed, hotel between 5th and 6th avenues , on a quieter street ( same street as Harvard club, and Algonquin and Sofitel hotels ) well located hotel for theater, and to trains at Grand central. Checkin easy. 

Had booked a slightly higher priced “ Superior” King bed room on a higher floor. Room was not large , but adequate space, decent sized bathroom with glass enclosure shower. All was quite clean. Well maintained. Carpet Floors, bathroom , sheets bed etc. very clean. 

We Had No road noise  on Thursday/ Friday nights. 

Also they do provide a decent  breakfast ….was “included” in our room price. ( yogurt, croissants, jam, granola or fruit on top of yoghurt, coffee tea…Nice well
Lit breakfast room. Self serve. Though they will bring you a hot baked egg/cheese sandwich or oatmeal , if you do ask for it 

I assume the extra $35 pp “ resort fee” they hit you with on the final bill ….note this is def not a resort ….may pay for the breakfast cost ??  Cannot eliminate this charge however.  Why do they charge this fee?? Because they can!! 

The 2 different elevators are synchronized so we never waited for them either at ground level or on floor 8. 

They have blackout shades/blinds to block any  light from street or morning light too. 

They will hold your bags on checkout too, so you can retrieve them later. They Have a friendly , service-oriented young doorman! 

Total Cost about 300 per day, with the NYC/ny state taxes and their added fees included. 

Will stay here again. 

But All in all …a nice stay. 

The bed was comfortable.

title: Best place for multiple bedrooms!
text:
Small, comfortable, lovely hotel in a premium Midtown location.  West 44th is home to the Yacht Club and Harvard Club to give you an idea.  A short stroll to either Times Square (but a world away in terms of ambiance) or Grand Central. 

We had a 3 bedroom executive suite which also included a living room and 3 full bathrooms.  Perfect for a family who loves to spread out a bit.  Street facing bedrooms were so quiet for NYC, furnishings are an understated elegance and bathrooms are clean, clean, clean.

Housekeeping daily.  Free breakfast in what must be a newly renovated breakfast room (coffee, tea, OJ, milk, cereal, oranges, croissants and a variety of made to order breakfast sandwiches were offered). 

Free water and newspapers and happy hours and street tours.  We were also welcomed with freshly baked cookies and 2 bottles of complimentary wine in our suite.

title: A cozy and classy historic hotel in Midtown
text: This was my first trip to New York. The hotel options ranged from deceptively inexpensive to ostentatiously overpriced. The Iroquois offered a quiet, clean, classy, and cozy stay and a premium experience in the heart of Manhattan for a reasonable rate. The staff were polite, professional, and always ready to answer any question (shout-out to Marie!). They allowed me to store my bags prior to check-in (which they expedited) and after check-out. I registered a good sleep score on the Fitbit, so the bed was comfy and the ambient noise was virtually non-existent. Many thanks to The Iroquois team for running such a great hotel.

title: Lovely hotel, with personal touch
text:
Great hotel with the personal touch. Not a giant chain, you really feel like a guest of honor.

Great location, very clean and excellent free WiFi.

Breakfast was great each morning, with the option to also take out.

Without a doubt, I would stay here or one of the sister hotels in the future.

title: Great central hotel with nice extras offered and a great staff - don’t hesitate to say here
text:
Great small hotel. Front desk staff is  wonderful - friendly and so helpful. Housekeeping is also top-notch. Everyone made our stay very comfortable. 
Breakfast was filling. Good selection  of grab and go items but also tables to sit and eat if you prefer.
Room was pleasant.
Hotel is located in central manhattan near the Broadway theatres and many restaurant choices, as well as ample transportation options.
The hotel offers happy hour across its various properties between 5p-6p, which is a nice touch.
Another lovely feature - they offer 90 min. walking tours through Streetwise New York tours of the local neighborhood. Our guide, Dan, was very knowledgeable about the area and its architecture. Streetwise also provides other tours not affiliated with the hotel, so check them out.
We will definitely return to the Iroquois.

title: Location Location Location
text: I travel.annually to New York and always stay at the Iroquois. The rooms are comfortable, spotlessly clean, and well maintained. The staff is gracious and welcoming. The hotel location is ideal, close to the theaters, restaurants, museums, and shopping.

title: Excellent Hotel!!!!
text: Amazing reception and they also let us do our check in super early!!! I just loved this hotel and I will be staying there every time that I am NY! Super clean and great location! I truly recommend this hotel!

title: Great location, Good looking hotel
text:
Very nice Boutique hotel. The rooms were decent size and clean. 
It is located in a great location. We were able to walk to all our meetings and locations we needed to. 
The staff was very friendly and welcoming at all times. 
We loved winding down at the 'speakeasy' bar.

title: Stay at the Iroquois
text: I’m really tempted not to give a great review because now everybody will find out about this gem of a hotel in Midtown! I was really trying to find a reasonably priced hotel without sacrificing quality so I was a little skeptical that the Iroquois could deliver, but being part of SH gave me the confidence and boy was I rewarded! Location is fantastic as half a block off fifth Avenue, Staff very helpful, the breakfast in the morning provided is just perfect and so easy, the rooms are probably average size but for this price point they are enormous. This is my new place when I don’t want to break the bank,

title: The Iroquois NYC
text: We had an excellent stay at the Iroquois !  The location is the best and  the room was wonderful.  The most enjoyable aspect of our stay was the warm and friendly staff!  We were part of a large group and they could not have been any nicer- they worked hard to make sure we were comfortable and gave us endless bottles of free water!

title: A surprise stay for my wife's birthday
text: An excellent stay. Comfortable room, no nonsense check-in, kudos to Anthony, Isa, and Rondell who made us feel at home. Free Cable(HBO too!), toiletries, sauna/gym, wifi, daily newspaper, umbrellas if it rains, as well as bottled water if requested. Room service available. Quaint bar on main floor, Lantern's Keep. It offers an array of appetizers and very well made cocktails, of which I would recommend the 'Strawberry Fields', as well as various beers and wines. This hotel was close to Grand Central Station, about a 5 minute walk, and was close to the entire Times Square area, Radio City Music Hall, Bryant Park, as well as Rockefeller Center. We would SURELY stay here again.

title: Great location, great NYC hotel
text: Such a great hotel! Our room was very spacious. I love the accents in the room, and the location is great! 😍 I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I will be back soon! There are lot of restaurants and things to do nearby. It's also very close to Grand Central which is super convenient!

title: I will definitely come back
text: The Hotel was super clean, nice breakfast, big rooms and in a really strategic place! In 5 minutes by walking you are in Times Square but I promise that you won’t hear a noise from it. The receptionist Isa is just the best, super nice and helps you with anything! She helped me with a problem about the check-in for my airplane and was super efficient.

title: Amazing Great Service & Amenities
text: My experience at The Iroquois was nothing short from perfect! The staff were some of the best in the business, the location was extremely convenient to Grand Central Station, Times Square and Bryant Park and the amenities were above and beyond what I was expecting. The complimentary breakfast was amazing and included hot oatmeal and breakfast sandwiches. My clients loved this hotel so much that they asked for a corporate rate for their travelers.

title: The best to do it!
text: The perfect location... just a couple blocks from time square. You will still be with the crowd but sleep peacefully at night. Rooms are clean, beds are comfy. If that's not enough, top notch customer service provided by Ms. Isa and Mr. Rondell. They both went above and beyond to assist us, made suggestions and gave us directions. They were very kind and understanding. Everytime we saw them, they greeted us with a smile. We appreciate our stay and will be back!

title: Lovely Hotel
text: I chose the Iroquois because it was well located for my meetings, was well reviewed, and was well priced. The stay got off to a great start, as Anthony at the front desk upgraded my room. It was the largest I've ever booked in New York City. More importantly, it was clean, quiet, and dark with the blinds closed. The hotel gym and breakfast met my needs. My only complaint was that there was no coffee in the room and no coffee available in the lobby area until 7:00 am. The hotel does offer a coffee machine in the room upon request, which I made sure to have in place for the second morning. The hotel was great, the staff was terrific, and I would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent value for the location
text:
Got upgraded to a larger room when we asked to move because we didn't want an interconnecting door. It was all done with minimal fuss.

Room was excellent, loads of room, a nice if small bathroom. Couldn't be happier. Road outside was relatively quiet for NY. Situated very close to Time Square this was a very welcome surprise. 

Check-in was a little slow due to a particularly slow woman in front of us, but the member of staff was doing his best and was super friendly. 

Bar downstairs was cozy and serve nice cocktails. The same place was used for breakfast, but it was only offering a poor selection at that time. I think they may be in the process of improving this if they haven't already.  Semi decent diner just down the street.

Would happily return.

title: Классное расположение, удобный и просторный номер, приятный обслуживающий персонал,
text:
Потрясающее расположение! Рядом Таймс Сквер, Брайант Парк. До смотровой площадки Top of the Rock идти несколько минут. Магазины, кафе всё есть рядом. Номер очень комфортный, просторный. В номере есть полотенца, гигиенические средства, халаты, утюг и гладильная доска, очень хороший мощный фен! 
Матрас удобный для сна. После десятков тысяч шагов по городу, невероятно приятно плюхнуться в кровать и сладко уснуть. Также понравились завтраки в отеле - советую брать бургер со скрэмблом - вкуснота! Еще в отеле вечером работает ресторан. Большие порции, классные цены и вкусное вино!

title: The Best!
text:
What an amazing hotel experience! 
The staff was incredible. Professional and courteous.  A special thank you to Anthony, Kamille, Isa, and Marie. What great people.
The rooms were well decorated, quiet, and provided with the basics. Great location, especially for theater attendees.
I will be back!

title: Beautiful property with excellent staff and centrally located.
text:
This is our second stay in a Triumph Hotel. Last year we stayed at the Evelyn and had an excellent time.  This year we picked the Iroquois Hotel. 

The Hotel is beautiful with old wood and excellent interior design details.  We enjoyed the Lantern's Keep Speakeasy/cocktail bar on several occasions and invited some of our business friends to enjoy drinks. The bartenders made delicious drinks both from the menu and off menu requests.  The front desk staff were welcoming and always greeted us with a smile. The door man was helpful with luggage and storing luggage before check-in and after checkout. Both the door man and front desk staff made several excellent recommendations for local restaurants. 

We participated in the NOMAD walking tour last year at the Evelyn and Bryant Park/Library/Grand Central walking tour this year at the Iroquois.  The guides were friendly and knowledgeable. The tours are free and a great way to get to know NYC better.

We will definitely return to try another Triumph Hotel in the future.

We highly recommend the Iroquis Hotel and the Evelyn Hotel!

title: Great night’s sleep in prime location
text: Small hotel with awesome staff, quiet rooms, and comfy beds. Stayed one night. Room was adequate size but not huge, but beds and pillows were very comfortable and room was very dark and quiet. Excellent night’s sleep. Great location as it’s a short walk from Penn and to theater. Tasty free breakfast offerings of pastries, yogurt, or egg sandwiches plus coffee, tea, and juice. Decent spa and sauna. Tiny but lovely bar with unique specialty drinks. Offered us super early check when we asked if they could hold our bags. Free water at check in. No coffee maker in rooms and an underwhelming lobby but don’t let that keep you from staying.

title: Great business hotel in the heart of Manhattan!!
text: Perfect base for me the entire week I was working in the Tristate area. I had meetings in Manhattan, NJ & CT and with Grand Central station close by, it was ideal. The speed and ease of the breakfast area was perfect for business users like me and for those that want to spend more time outside in the city.

title: Quiet, comfy, and clean
text: Surprisingly quiet, only a few blocks from many attractions (Rockefeller Center, Radio City, Times Square). Beds and pillows very comfy, room decent sized. Bathroom was huge. Extremely clean. Grab and Go breakfast tasty and fresh… breakfast sandwich choice, oatmeal, coffee etc. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again or check out the sister properties around the city.

title: A solid choice.
text: If midtown or times square is where you need to be - the Iroquis is a dependable choice. Rooms are well kept with bathrooms that I would consider large for NY. The bar is exceptional and open again after a covid hiatus. A great spot to get a craft cocktail after a long day. Believe the full restaurant will be open in the coming months which will have all cylinders of the Iroquis humming. Highly recommend for a consistent stay, with freindly staff and a charming place to unwind after the hustle of a long NY day.

title: Quality hotel in a great location
text:
The hotel has a high end feel to it. We stayed in a double/double room and the room was well appointed and very quiet.
We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the helpful staff.
We found all the staff very friendly, happy and professional.
We love our stay at Iroquoi

title: Horrible Experience
text: Arrived 30 min prior to check-in time and the person at the guest said the room was almost ready and asked if they could hold my bags while I went on a short walk. When I returned, my yeti water bottle was missing from my bag. The people at the front desk said there was a shift change and there was nothing they could do about it. Each night I was there, all throughout the night when anyone on the floor opened their own hotel room door, my door & door handle shook like someone was trying to pick the lock so I was waking up all night thining someone was trying to break in. A few days after checking out I received a bill for $270 (about $30/day for a 9-day stay). When I called to ask what it was for, they explained that there's a daily charge to cover the amenities, i.e. gym, sauna & grab & go breakfast regardless of whether they were used. This should be clearly stated on the hotels website when booking a room. If I knew it was going to cost me an additional $270 for the week, I would have booked it somewhere else that didn't have hidden fees. This was by far the worst experience I've ever had with a hotel.

title: Weekend Vaction
text: This hotel was so cool.   Staff was friendly and rooms were clean.  They made us feel welcomed and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed.  Its close enough to Times Square  and everything else.  This was a last minute weekend trip for my daughter and I and she also thought that it was the coolest place!

title: Theatre weekend perfection
text: Great location for theatre attendance.  With a tasty breakfast included and restaurants galore, everything is available.  Room very comfortable with great shower water pressure, robe and slippers to use, fluffy pillows, closet with a safe and lots of outlets and USB ports for charging devices.  I have stayed at this hotel before- so feel good about returning. It is among my favorites.

title: Week trip to NYC
text: Gem of a hotel, location, rooms were great. Staff were attentive and always willing to go the extra yard. Hotel has a homely feel. Breakfast included is a great benefit and again the team are happy to make sure all works for you. Highly recommend if you are looking for a high standard hotel with great down to earth service. Old school New York hospitality

title: HOTEL IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION
text: We stayed here because of The Iroquois being listed on the Small Leading Hotels website.  I have stayed at many SLH's over the years.  This hotel is beautiful but SLH's all have top level service and it is about the experience.  This is a boutique hotel in Manhattan. So the lobby is tiny.  Yet they are open for business as they try to do a complete renovation of a restaurant that is right off the lobby as well as the ceiling of the lobby.  I would avoid any Triumph hotel based on how this property was managed.  The staff was polite but seemed overworked at check in.  Housekeeping did not come one of the days when we were out of the room the entire day.  This hotel is stunning and well kept, but we will never stay again based on how it is managed.

title: Perfect Stay
text: The Iroquois provided a perfect stay for my daughter & I in NYC. The staff was exceptional, the entire hotel was beautiful and so well kept. The location was perfect. We walked to restaurants, shopping, shows, and museums. We will definitely stay again!

title: Ok but not at all
text: The building was nice, but not at all.  the room, too small. And terrible breakfast, that’s not international. There wasn’t choices. Onky two burgers or a terrible croissant or a yogurt. It’s 4 stars hotel in new york!!

title: Ok hotel but not a Five Star experience
text: Had higher hopes for this hotel stay, given it’s five stars rating and reviews about extraordinary staff. I would give it a 3+. Breakfast was very thin and our for boys left the hotel hungry every morning. Staff in the breakfast room seemed bored and everything was served in cardboard or plastic. Good location.

title: 1 night stay
text: Stayed one night in NYC, location, rooms are great. Hotel does have a rustic NYC Victorian Colonial feel versus the modern hotels which makes it nice. Restaurant and lobby bar are under Reno but overall it’s a great place. Grab and go breakfast is also great.

title: Very happy
text: Great location close to Times Square and Bryant park. Free breakfast that was great to grab and bring up to our room while we were getting ready. Wonderful staff all around. Lobby was partially under construction so a bit small as a result - but looks like it will be beautiful when it’s done. Very comfortable beds - no view from the window but very quiet. Would definitely come back.

title: Always a favorite
text: Luxury and location all in one. The suites at the Iroquois are top notch and provide comfort and space in the heart of midtown. And the heated bathroom floors are such an awesome extra. We are never disappointed with a stay at this hotel.

title: Everything you need
text:
This cute luxury boutique hotel is located in the heart of Times Square. It is very close to all of the Broadway theaters and really anything that you would need to do or see. The staff is exceptionally friendly and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are small and the view can be an inspiring but they are very clean and well decorated, and it is an extremely comfortable place to stay at a reasonable value given its location in Manhattan. The free Wi-Fi works quite well, and there is minimal noise in the hotel. There is a complementary grab and go breakfast daily that you may either eat on site there at their little restaurant called the Lantern's Keep or take back to your room. There are several  choices and friendly staff to serve it to you. There is a dry sauna and gym on the third floor which I did not use but it's nice to know is available. This hotel clearly concentrates on customer service because it is excellent. You be welcomed warmly upon arrival, given a bottle of water and you will proceed to enjoy your very comfortable accommodations. This was my first time there and I will definitely be  
a repeat customer.

title: X-mas in the big apple
text:
The hotel a cozy place and idealy located between 5th and 6th Av.Shops and Central park and Grand central are at walking distance 
10+ for the friendlyness and services of the hotel staff we will definitely come back to this place.

title: Great location.
text: Easy to get about from here Hotel a good standard breakfast was a bonus! Our room was small but that's New York, but it had everything you wanted, really clean & soundproofed. Great dinner reasonably priced  next to hotel

title: Boutique at its Best
text: I stayed here for my 60th birthday with my 3 daughters and granddaughter and husbands/boyfriends. It was simply a clean, safe haven in the middle of midtown with a boutique feel. This was my third stay in as many years and Anthony greeted us with prosecco in the cozy lobby and a welcome birthday wine and cookie basket greeted us in the room and the rest of the stay was as equally heavenly. The entire team couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome! Can't wait to return

title: Christmas vacation
text: Wonderful stay at the Iroquois New York. Perfect location for anything and everything you would like to do! Staff was absolutely fabulous. We are from out of state and will be returning on our next trip! Highly recommended.

title: Highly recommend
text: We had a great stay at the Iroquois. Very nice rooms, friendly service and great location. The beds were comfortable and we appreciated the heated bathroom floors. Close to everywhere we wanted to go. We highly recommend and will return.

title: Christmas in NY
text: Niche Hotel right in the middle of Times Square and walkable to every nearby point of interest. The breakfast-grab-and-go is an excellent offer for those interested in an early start. Rooms are sound proof, clean with nice decor and bathroom amenities are great! Recommend it highly.

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel Located in Mid-town Manhattan.
text: Very nice boutique hotel in a great location in Mid-town Manhattan. All of the Staff, especially  Anthony- Assistant Manager were very nice and very attentive.  We have stayed at the Iroquois Hotel twice and can highly recommend this hotel!

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Our family loved the executive suite with the two connecting rooms with the gathering room in the middle. The staff were extremely polite, helpful and always smiling.  We look forward to our next trip and staying here again!

title: Special Boutique Hotel
text: We have stayed at The Iroquois many times over the past 15 years and have no reasons to stay anywhere else. The hotel is quaint, the staff professional, efficient and accommodating. The stay includes a very nice ‘grab and go’ breakfast. We will stay there again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Spot on.
text:
Superb location, adequate rooms (given the location). Center of everything. True NY experience. 
But what distinguishes this boutique hotel is the superb staff.Polite, helpful and always smiling.  Take a bow Orlando and Yolinda. Keep it up guys!

title: Splendid Stay in NYC
text: This is a cozy, friendly, well located boutique hotel.  We enjoyed our room, friendly staff, and the easy to everything location.  My favorite thing, no noise.  Our room was so quiet.  Perfect. This hotel is within walking distance to most tourist locations.  Convenient to Time Square, Central Park, restaurants, etc.

title: Splendid Stay in New York
text: Best location ever.  Our room was comfortable, the staff friendly, perfect location for Radio City Music Hall, and all things Christmas in New York City.  I highly recommend this perfect boutique hotel.

title: great value
text: hotel door and desk staff are great.  breakfast food is okay; you won't fill up,  our room was very small, which is not unusual in NYC, especially this location, which is great.  however, the room is also very dark, again not unusual in NYC. The lobby and lobby bar are very nice and a nice place to relax after a day of walking around or waiting for a ride.

title: Wonderful!
text: Everybody at the hotel was wonderful. Anything we needed they were there they will help you get taxis to get around town and to the airport. Anything you could possibly want or need. They were very pleasant always a smile on their face and willing to help. if you’re looking for a hotel to stay at in New York City, I would definitely recommend this one.

title: Recommended
text:
Family x 4
Birthday surprise for mum and number 2 son.
6 day trip

Very central in midtown but not too close to Times Square.

First time we’ve taken the kids to NYC and this was a great choice as a hotel.

Pros:

Large (for New York) suite
Spotlessly clean
Friendly and responsive front desk

Cons;
None

title: Amazing!
text: This was truly an amazing experience. The staff were all friendly and courteous and made us feel very welcome. From the initial check in until checkout the staff went out of their way to ensure our stay was perfect.

title: Some Good.  Some not so good.
text: Stayed 3 nights at the Iroquois during December.  Normally stay at the Sheraton Times Square, but decided to try somewhere new as the Sheraton has gone downhill.  Obviously the Iroquois location is good.  We booked a Supreme King room which faced 44th St.  Thought the room was small even for NY standards, but it is an old hotel, so that goes with the territory.  Only one small desk chair, which means one of two people have to sit on the bed.  The remodel is well done, but the windows are terrible!  Some of the worst street noise ever.  Sounded like we were sleeping with the windows open and felt like it with the amount of breeze that blew in through the gaps.  I would guess any positive reviews on quiet rooms were those in the back.  The only other real negative is the tub grout was moldy and no counter space in the bathroom (photos).  The rest of the housekeeping was good and the room was clean, the bed, lighting and a/c all good.  Most of the staff was friendly and helpful, other than the initial encounter at check-in.  The breakfast is nice, but very strict on only allowing you to have one breakfast item.  The bar was closed on Sunday, but packed on Monday and Tuesday.  Good atmosphere.  Be careful with all of the taxes and fees as they never provide the entire cost until checkout.  With the reservation, they list a lot of tax rates and a $32/night "facility fee", but it still cost almost $100 more than I self-calculated.  All said, we would stay here again, but it would have to be cost competitive.

title: Charming “Old School” in a great location
text: The Iroquois is located a mere two blocks from the bustle of Times Square, but it feels a world away. The rooms are typically small like most older hotels in NYC, but they are clean, comfortable and well maintained. The Front Desk staff are superb…particularly Marie who has a winning personality and an obvious commitment to great guest services.

title: Worth it
text: Great location; the rooms were comfortable, and we loved the nod to Old New York. Five Wits toiletries were incredible, and so was breakfast in the am. Over the holidays, we recommend the Festive Package too : )

title: Nice place with nice rooms.
text:
Nice hotel in nice location. Expensive for what it is especially when they add the facilities charge of $32 per night. 

Rooms need a coffee maker. 

Staff was ok. Some were rude but we got in ok and had the room we requested.

title: A Chic and Luxury Boutique hotel.
text:
Fabulous chic hotel in the heart of NYC. The decor and atmosphere of this hotel is top notch. The Iroquois team will greet you at the door and continue to welcome and assist you through their check in process. 

Situated on 44th about a block and a half from Times Square, you are far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to all the major attractions. 

Staying here will make you feel like a New Yorker - immersed in their city life culture - and feel like James Dean (who once lived here for 3years). 

The rooms are quiet and quaint. We slept like a dream each night of our stay. 

The breakfast was delightful - a grab and go type selection of hot egg sandwiches, oatmeal or yogurt to pick from plus delicious coffee, tea or orange juice to quench your thirst.  

Staying here will only add to your NYC experience. I highly recommend it.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Great hotel with excellent staff. 
Location is superb and in easy reach of all the major attractions and travel hubs.
Staff are really helpful and provide wonderful service. 
Would highly recommend and i will be returning again in the new year.
The Iroquois is my NY Hotel of choice.

title: Second time staying here
text: We have stayed here twice and absolutely love the location. The hotel rooms are clean and just the right size, we don't spend much time in there anyway. The quick grab and go breakfast is a nice option as well.

title: Small rooms, great staff
text:
We stayed at the Iroquois because it is very close to my husbands office, and it’s a convenient location to many restaurants, the park, etc. it’s a historic hotel which does mean historic rooms, ie small. The room was small, but lots of plugs on each side of the bed and at the desk. The bathroom was tiny. Like barely close the door while it in. But the shower was good sized. Good water pressure and nice towels. The walls are thin or something because I could hear everything from the girls next door to the cleaning crew.  Bed was comfortable. 

The staff there is so nice! Especially the lady from Dallas that worked the front desk. She is wonderful! I love the breakfast that’s included. Yogurt or bodega style egg sandwiches (with runny yolk even, impressive) with OJ, water, coffee, tea. Very tasty and so convenient. I also took advantage of the free walking tour of the area that you can do. Informative and a nice perk.  

The Iroquois is close to many restaurants, Starbucks, subway stations. and stores. About a 20 min walk to Central Park and same to either river. 

Overall it’s a good hotel in a nice location. Great friendly staff!

title: Room was ok.
text: Wife's birthday getaway. Room was nice, but the view I paid extra for was much less then impressive.  There was no microwave or fridge for guests. I had expired food and drinks in the mini fridge. Also the heat/ac didn't seem to be working. The TV service is really bad. No guide or information.  Felt like I was watching cable in the 1990's.

title: Loved this hotel
text: Stayed from a Saturday to a Tuesday to see the sights at holiday time.  Staff was courteous, friendly and went out of their way to make us comfortable and enjoy our stay.  The grab and go breakfast was very convenient and you have the option to eat it there or take it with you.  We highly recommend it.

title: Great stay!
text: We chose this hotel because of its location and price.  My favorite part of the room was the heated bathroom floors (hate being cold getting out of a shower!).  The staff was always friendly and very accommodating.  The breakfast was delicious with options of hot breakfast sandwiches, parfaits, and croissants as well as various beverages.  Loved our stay!

title: Great boutique hotel!
text: My family really enjoyed our stay at The Iroquois NY! The front desk staff and  friendly and very welcoming! The hotel is immaculately clean and so was our room. The rooms are updated and ours was very spacious. The Lantern’s Keep is a little hidden gem. It was nice to be able to grab a drink after a long day of shopping! I do like that they offer a grab and go breakfast. You can tell the staff really cares about their guests.

title: Excellent Place
text: I loved to stay here always warm welcomed every time , the small breakfast is an add on but very tasty and good quality , the location is superb and the amazing staff made our trip outstanding always interacting with us and our kids ! We stayed at 10th floor super quiet and we had no issues at all !

title: An eceptional service
text: We appreciated the courteous and professional staff. Travel is a stressful exercise, returning to a welcoming hotel with a clean room and most importantly very quiet, made our stay at The Iroquois really pleasant. Overall a really great experience.

title: Great hotel
text: We were there for the parade. Luxurious hotel without the pretentiousness. Staff were always welcoming and friendly. Love the heated floors and the sauna. Grab and go breakfast was great!  We’ll be back!

title: Nice romantic weekend spot.
text: The room was very comfy for me and my wife's romantic getaway. The location was perfect walking distance to the restaurants we had reservations for, Broadway, Rockafeller Center, and Times Square. I will stay here again. The elevator is a little small you can't get more than 4 people in at a time but that's not a big deal as they move rather quickly so not a long wait. There is not much of a view of the city but you don't go to NYC to stay in your room.

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed at the Iroquois during a recent trip to NYC. This is a great hotel, very clean and comfortable. Our stay included vouchers for a quick breakfast each morning, and the staff members were very helpful. I would definitely return.

title: Great location, great staff, great rooms
text: The staff is so helpful and friendly. From check in to recommendations to check out everyone was very helpful. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Love the breakfast. You can't beat the location.

title: Exceptional little boutique hotel
text: We rae very happy we discovered The Iroquois. We like smaller boutique hotel and had a lot of disapointment with these in New York City. The Iroquois on the other hand did not disapoint. At first we were worried because the entrance was dodgy, but it turned out it was only because of the scaffolding (which was explained in a separate note in the room and which is apparently now gone). The check in was easy and very friendly. The room was in good state and clean, we liked the decor. We appreciated the flexibility and thoroughness of the cleaning staff! A very special treat is the Lantern's Keep bar which is cosy, comfortable and the staff here is also top notch. Great cocktails and excellent food. You can even have cocktails sent up to your room! All in all this hotel is a gem.

title: Iroquois will always be our place to stay in NYC
text: I can’t say enough wonderful things about The Iroquois New York. The staff made us feel like Royalty the entire time we were there. Can’t wait to go back. We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite for our family of 7 and it all exceeded our expectations! Thank you for a wonderful experience.

title: Iroquis Hotel is always a best bet
text: Great boutique hotel in the middle of Manhatten. Terrific staff who seems to care about you as an individual. Nicely appointed rooms and the heated floors in the bathrooms are awesome as well as the Frette linens, towels, and bathrobe.

title: Quick getaway
text: Great location.  Very professional and friendly staff. Booked a premier room. Very nice! Have stayed here several times. Bryant Park is very close. Sax Fifth Avenue and Main New York library are within walking distance.

title: this place is really great!
text: this place is special - everything feels brand new. Any hotel associate I interacted was very pleasant and seemed genuinely happy to see me.  they even do a breakfast in the morning.  I wish there was extra bedding and coffee in the room - but otherwise - a near PERFECT stay.

title: Our most recent NYC visit
text: We have stayed at the Iroquois multiple times over the last 14 years . The fro t desk , concierge and valet weee also very friendly and helpful . We love the location since we come to NYC to see Broadway shows . We appreciated the addition of complimentary breakfast this visit .

title: Delightful stay!
text: Highly recommend the experience at The Iroquois New York. The front desk had very good recommendations for meals. Breakfast was surprisingly good considering items were pre-made. Staff is very friendly.

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text: Perfect gem hidden in the city.  We really enjoyed our stay there and would highly recommend. Retro and unique. Staff was great, pleasant and helpful. Quick walk to Times Square. Quiet amid the chaos of the city. Definitely will stay there again.

title: A very good hotel in New York
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the Iroquois hotel.
The hotel is beautiful and the staff members are very friendly and attentive.
The rooms are clean, good food quality and very nice complementary city tours given by the hotel.
Location location location - Very close to Times Square but far enough to be in a quiet and clean area at 44th street.

Don't listen to any comments regarding a low water pressure - The shower was just fine!

title: Loved the Iroquois
text: Good location, nice room, comfortable bed and small but well-designed bathroom, not many rooms on each floor, so felt more quiet and private. Nice staff and good service from all the staff at the Iroquois.

title: Great midtown spot.
text: Really comfortable stay with outstanding staff.  Very friendly and attentive.  It almost seemed like we never opened the door in and out of the hotel, as there was always someone to do it for us.  The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the shower was very nice.  Enjoyed our stay.

title: Convenient, attentive staff
text: Our overnight stay was a wonderful experience. The location of this hotel is perfect for all typical New York activities. Our room was very comfortable and very quiet! We were allowed to check in when we arrived at 11:30 AM, which was so convenient for getting our day started. Every staff person was an delight and really made us feel welcome.

title: Best Stay Ever
text: Each employee is nicer than the next. They truly pride themselves in making the guest experience the best that it can be. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival just out of the goodness of their hearts. It made for the most amazing stay in New York City.

title: Most disappointingn
text: Very disappointing. Have stayed here many times before but I won’t return. The breakfast provided is pre-cooked and the small bar where it is provided is very crowded. Internet is unstable so you have to log back in every few minutes. Even in an upgraded room there is no place to sit other than the bed or an uncomfortable desk chair. There is no valet parking and we had to ask for valet assistance when we pulled up. At this price you can do much better.

title: Great location
text: A nice location close to times square, Bryant park, moma and many other nice places. The rooms were nice. Not acceptable that we did not hear about the construction of a new lounge area. It did smell in the reception area. The grab and go break fast was not well controlled, so options became unavailable.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text:
The Iroquois hotel is an excellent location to see all the sites of New York. 

The staff were friendly and helpful.

It was nice to have a grab and go breakfast to start the day

The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.

title: In NYC for a Wedding
text: My friend and I came to New York City for a wedding. The bride and groom had reserved a block of rooms at the Iroquois. It was the perfect location for us as there were several wedding activities in the neighborhood. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but very comfortable. We were not far from Times Square but on a quieter street. The doormen were always happy to get us a cab when needed. Lovely place!

title: Great Place
text: Large spacious room with plenty of easy storage. Safe was easy to use and the access to the WIFI was just a simple password. Bathroom was very large. Nearly 8x12. Elevators quick and quiet. There was a bar on the property but I did not visit. Staff very friendly.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
I had to book a last minute room but wanted stay somewhere nice. This was perfect. Would definitely stay here again. 

Charming, old NY luxury feel with a great attentive staff and comfortable room. Also the location was perfect to get to several restaurants, and attractions in the area quickly.

title: Great night sleep
text: A bit boutique (which I don't normally like as they can be style over substance) but they have got this one right. Staff friendly but not intrusive. Room very clean and good size. Bed very comfortable and no street noise

title: Yes. Iroquois is great!
text: I’ve been coming to this hotel for years. The reason? Its staff are helpful beyond belief, the little boutique hotel has a long history and is lovely right in the heart of Broadway, LaGuardia airport is a reasonable fare and the beds are comfortable. One year I went uptown to another Triumph Hotel, but missed the Iroquois. They have coffee, serious egg and bacon buns and a smile in the morning from the desk staff. They have the New York Times and a great Door Man who gets you a taxi with a smile. Just left yesterday for home and will see them all next year!

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text:
Honestly, such a great stay in NYC. It was my first time in New York and the hotel made it such a memorable experience. Marie Owens was perfect! She had helped me organise a birthday surprise for my partner which included cake, bubbles, flowers and an amazing balloon display.

The room was amazing, beds were comfy and it had everything we needed! Not to mention how great the location was. 

I am already planning my returns!

title: GREAT MATTRESS
text: ONE OF THE MOST COMFORTABLE BEDS I HAVE EVER SLEPT ON. I wish I knew the brand. The room was spacious and tasteful. the staff were friendly . I have found my new favorite hotel. They will see use every time we are in the city

title: great location
text:
WE STAYED AT THE Iroquois last week and we could not fault it, the room was comfortable clean, and what we expected, on reading the reviews about the take away breakfast I was not expecting much , however we were pleasantly surprised it, was plenty full and hot every morning, space to sit is an issue so get down early if you want a seat, 
the staff were friendly and the best bit of this hotel is the location, it's minutes from timesquare , rockafella , and other main attractions .

We booked our transfer  William through the hotel from JFK , he was prompt and picked us us as requested , however we were told by the hotel the transfer would cost 127 dollars, William in fact charged us 145 dollars for the trip  , for this reason we did not rebook for our return to the airport, we got an uber for 95 dollars a big difference. 

if you are thinking of staying here I would recommend it for location and cleanliness , the beds are very comfortable and breakfast fine.

title: old world charm
text: location, location, the rooms are very small and my window faced a wall, but thats nyc. , The breakfast can be improved. But you are close to MOMA and not too close to Times Square. I would recommend, if you can afford

title: Visit Post Covid
text: I've stayed at Iroquois many many times, but it was the first time I'd visited since COVID.  It was as I remembered and was a lovely stay.  Carlos, one of the door men was over and beyond great.  He was very helpful with the nuances of getting around the city, getting to the airport, etc.  Cleaning staff everyday did a thorough job cleaning the bedroom.  I would still recommend this hotel if you're ever visiting NYC.

title: Surprising and special stay
text: Definitely the best suite I've been at, the room was really comfortable with a big space to work, sleep and enjoy the hotel. The team is really great and helpful, and the location could not be better, near times square but also very peaceful. I am absolutely glad with my stay at the Iroquois.

title: Great spot.
text: Very clean and quiet rooms, excellent breakfast, helpful staff. Location is quite touristy, but convenient for getting around. So close to Bryant Park, a huge plus though! I do not recommend staying here for work—the WiFi was not very good.

title: Well located
text: This hotel is renovated and has all the looks of being all starts. The staff is very polite and helpful. It is very well located if you want to stay in Times Square, Radio Music Hall and Rockefeller Center. Rooms are incredibly small, really small; our room looked over a wall. We had vouchers for drinks, but the bar/lounge was never open when we were there. The breakfast could be improved by just using regular, normal utensils instead of serving everything in paper boxes and plastic cups.

title: It's a really nice hotel with a boutique feel.
text: Really good if you want to be in the middle of it all. A shame that the restaurant was under renovation. Also the Dental kits need to be asked for at reception. Also not a fan of grab and go breakfast.

title: Great Central stay
text: Great location in mid town, everything is a short walk away. If not, there are subway stations close by. Being close to the park and the action was perfect for us. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable with an expensive minibar. Breakfast was Ok, little choice if you had dietary requirements with no selecton of fruits.

title: Friendly and helpful staff, spotless and comfortable rooms, well located
text: I love this hotel! In addition to being extremely well located, every staff person we interacted with was helpful and friendly - often going beyond our expectations. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very comfortable, although they are small. I really appreciated the blackout shade and blinds. After a day and evening in the city, it's nice to come home to a quiet, cozy, clean and comfortable space. This was my second stay at the Iroquois and I'll be returning.

title: very nice
text:
I will stay next time as well and look forward to experiencing renewal restaurant.  
little old atmosphere was nice too.  
one thing I feel shame was shower tap was not in good condition. 
all of staffs are very kind

title: Lovely midtown hotel that meets expectations - but with some disappointments
text:
Our experience at the Iroquois was a good one that mirrored most other Trip Advisor reviewers. 

However, we were disappointed in the way the “facilities fee” was charged.

At checkout, I was asked to authorise payment on a terminal that didn’t show the amount. 

I asked for a receipt and the receptionist told me it would be emailed. It hadn’t arrived after several hours so when we returned to collect our luggage I asked for a hard copy. This revealed the facilities fee of $27 per night plus state and city taxes.

I appreciate that facilities fees are often charged by accommodation establishments but I believe it wooing have been more professional for this to be advised at check in time at least. 

The other disappointments were there were no coffee making facilities either in the lobby or room (other than in the breakfast room when it was open). There were no glasses in the room either. It was later explained to me both were for “COVID reasons”. 

Others have

title: A Gem hidden in plain sight
text: Our new favorite. My only regret is that we had not stayed there in the past. Amazing staff, spacious rooms, very quiet and safe, clean. I could go on and on. We will recommend to everyone. Please give this property a chance. You will be hooked too!!!

title: Luxury, charm, and sophistication amidst the chaos of NYC
text: If you're looking for a small luxury hotel in the midst of the chaos of NYC, you needn't look any further than the Iroquois Hotel in mid-town Manhattan.  Fantastic location, wonderful amenities, beautifully appointed rooms, and an incredible staff.  I prefer intimate boutique hotels to the larger properties, and I was extremely pleased with my selection of the Iroquois.  I am always looking for accommodations that are centrally located and within walking distance of many of the city's attractions, exude a calming and peaceful environment when you walk through the front doors after you return from a day of exhausting sightseeing, provide fantastic service, and have a small bar or restaurant within the hotel for those times you would rather have a drink and a light meal in your hotel. The Iroquois checks all the boxes. The Lantern's Keep is intimate with pleasing decor.  Breakfast is included in your stay.  The staff is extremely personable and helpful.  Everyone we encountered was warm, welcoming, and very attentive.  The room was impeccably clean and beautifully furnished.  They also have an in-house fitness center and sauna if you have the time.  This was our first stay at the Iroquois Hotel, but it certainly won't be out last.

title: Excellent location and staff
text: Great location for many attractions. We were primarily visiting for a Broadway show and couldn't have asked for a better hotel! Breakfast was great, clementines and water always available in the lobby turned out to be a nice surprise. Would stay here again in an instant!

title: Our NYC stay
text:
Excellent welcome, with great customer service and very pleasant staff. 

Our hotel room was clean and comfortable.

Thank you to Josh and all the team.
We would recommend this hotel for future visitors and in the heart of NYC.
We love NYC & all it stands for ❤️

title: Lovely boutique style hotel, good location.
text:
The staff were excellent, extremely helpful and friendly. The decor in our room was lovely, the room wasn't huge but well laid out and everything we needed. I travelled with my grown-up daughter so we shared a room with two queen beds and it worked perfectly. Very quiet at night too which was a bonus. The only slight negative was the restaurant being closed for renovations but breakfast was provided with a limited choice. Again, perfectly adequate, but unfortunately I am unable to eat gluten as I am Celiac and there was very little I could eat. We did take advantage of the lounge one evening which is fairly small but cosy and again excellent service.
The location is very good indeed, very close to Times Square but far enough away to not have to deal with the crowds. Good value for money. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Iroquois New York.

title: Great experience
text: Had a wonderful time at the hotel. For a first time New York experience it was great as it was close to many attractions I wanted to see.  The room was very clean and spacious. The customer service was great and the complementary breakfast served every morning was delicious. I definitely would stay here again and recommend to family & friends.

title: Classy, Cozy and Convenient
text:
The location of this hotel is amazing. You’re very close to subways, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square. As soon as you walk in you can see the value and care that their staff has. Very friendly and caring. The hotel is very nice and roomy. Definitely worth it! The amenities, free breakfast and water is amazing. This is not your typical continental breakfast, very yummy. I’m
Planning on returning to NY again and I will surely book this hotel again.

title: Welcoming, safe, and comfortable.
text: Beds were extremely comfortable, all staff were polite and friendly. Marie at reception was exceptional, as well Camron, the door man was very knowledgeable with recommendations, Pablo the bartender was very skilled. We felt very welcomed, and safe.

title: Excellent stay at The Iroquois!
text: Enjoyed a wonderful weekend at the Iroquois. The rooms were spacious, well appointed, and clean. The beds were super comfy as were the pillows! The blackout shades made the room like a cave, and we slept great both nights there. Overall had a wonderful experience at this hotel.

title: Great place to stay
text: It's always nice to come back to the Iroquois Hotel. The staff are so welcoming and helpful. It feels like coming home when we see Carlos at the door! We especially enjoyed the New York state wine on Tuesday and Thursday. And the hotel's location near both Times Square and Bryant Park couldn't be better.

title: Best Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: I don’t know if Risko stayed at the same hotel I did!  My experience was the complete opposite.  5 stars across the board!  The staff, from the bellman to Marie, the concierge/receptionist coukd not have been more attentive or friendlier!  The bed was extremely comfortable, breakfast that was included had good selections (OJ was fresh squeezed!). Excellent location with two great restaurants a few steps away.  I’ll be back!

title: Zuvorkommender Service, Mini-Zimmer, Frühstück aus Plastikschalen...
text:
Ansich ein süßes Hotel mit netten Menschen, die dort arbeiten.
Aber mein Wohnzimmer ist größer als der Frühstücksbereich - Kaffee aus der Thermoskanne, zu Essen 2,3 Mikrowellenprodukte und Yogurth. Das hatte Jugendherbergen-Niveau.
Die Zimmer extrem klein - kein richtiger Kleiderschrank. konnte nicht mal den Koffer auspacken...

title: Zero value for exorbitant money.
text: Exorbitantly expensive, worst breakfast ever, dry staff, poor hospitality, average rooms and in general worst ever value for money. Although I went in busy New York week, I was shocked to see the quality of service. I had no feeling of warmth especially from staff.  A tiny for breakfast  with all processed food. In my three days stay I only ate plastic packaged granola. I paid hopping USD 900 per day for an average room that did not have even a water boiler for tea. I will not stay in this hotel ever.

title: Perefct location but noisy
text:
Location is a perfect strating point to visit Manhattan... but rooms on street side are very noisy.
Breakfasts are poor and the dinning room is really small.
Rooms are really great and service is excellent!

title: Nice central hotel but small and not many facilities
text:
We stayed as a family of three at the Iroquois in July as the first stop of our US holiday.

As positives, the hotel is very centrally located so easy to explore most parts of Manhattan on foot and the metro is also very close.  The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and available at all times.  The rooms were also very clean and tidy.

As negatives, our room was very small.  We had a room with two double beds in for two adults and a teenager.   You could just about get round either side/between both beds and that was about it.  Bathroom was compact.  I am sure this is standard for many New York hotels, but we did find it tight.

The hotel is not that big so there are limited things to do there.  Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for refurbishment while we were staying so breakfast was served from the small bar at the rear of the hotel.  Because of this, it was very limited (same small choice each day).  However, it was included in the price so that's something to be grateful for as food is very expensive in NYC.

title: Great Stay
text: Friendly staff, upscale and comfortable room.  Small but well equipped gym with a sauna.    Great location for business on 6th Ave, restaurants and shows.   Complimentary grab and go breakfast was not expected and a nice touch.  Wish I had time to take the complimentary walking tour of the area offered by the hotel.

title: I Love the Iroquois!
text: I love staying here. It’s personal service and location can’t be beat. It’s charming and the employees are so extremely nice. The rooms are elegant and comfortable. The amenities offer everything you need. Love it.

title: New York
text: Overall  four night stay was wonderful. The hotel was easy walking distance to restaurants and broadway shows. The breakfast selections were excellent and at night we enjoyed a drink in the lounge! Would definitely stay here again!

title: Good but not great, dated property, staff excellent and a pleasure
text: This was a last-minute booking due to a canceled flight so I didn’t get to experience all of the hotels amenities. The room was clean and very nice and the only concern I had about the room was a slow shower drain, not good. The front desk staff were excellent and welcoming. They offered me toiletries and anything else I needed as I had no luggage with me. Overall, it’s a nice property, but a little dated. The breakfast room was subpar compared to other hotels. Location is great so still a reasonable value in a number of ways. I’m not sure why I was charged a $30 resort fee as there was really anything I could attribute to it other than a Hotel had a gym.

title: Good value for money, excellent location.
text:
We liked the hotel and its location was excellent.
The closet in the room helped us with our luggage.
The bed was comfortable.
The bath towels were too small.
The desk chair was uncomfortable.
The breakfast did the hotel a disservice, in our opinion it would have been better not to offer it at all, as it was of very poor quality, with hardly any choice, and served in a way that was worse than fast food.
It's not a breakfast worthy of a 3-star hotel.

title: Ideal location for first time visitor, great find
text: Love, love our stay at the Iroquois Hotel.  Great service and very confortable rooms.  Our room was always clean and cool upon our return from our daily outings (90+ degree weather).  So yes it was a welcome relief not to have to wait for the room to cool.  Many thanks to all at the Iroquois who made us feel welcome.  Will return here again.

title: Worth a visit but could be kinder to our planet!
text: Older hotel, but very clean. Perfect location with access to Bryant Part, theatres, Times Square. My only complaint was the amount of disposable plastic being used, stacked so high for the breakfast, and even for the wine and cheese happy hour. I didn’t see evidence of recycling either. At least use compostable containers! If not for this I would have given 5 stars.

title: Loved the professional and friendly staff at this excellent midtown hotel. Would stay again for sure.
text: We recently needed to book a meeting space in the city. Ann and Xochitl were extremely helpful in answering our many questions about the space and arranging to have the room set up exactly as we needed. The entire staff, including the bellmen, were so incredibly helpful. We also booked a room to stay over after our work day ended. Marie and the front desk staff were so accommodating and pleasant to deal with. They even upgraded us to a suite! We finished up the evening in the dreamy hotel bar with superb cocktails. We had complimentary coffee and a light breakfast before checking out. Another plus is parking in the clean and well-run garage directly across the street. All in all an excellent stay at the Iroquois. We highly recommend it for business or pleasure.

title: Wonderful quiet spot near Time Square
text: Great location we walked to all our chosen galleries and theatres.  We’ve stayed in a number of hotels near Time Square and the Iroquois is our favourite.  (Don’t use the concierge to book theatre tickets, we paid about double what we needed to pay had we used TKTS.)

title: A great surprise in a city so many options
text: With so much to choose from in NYC, The Iroquois was a perfect choice for attending the US Open, as it is 2 blocks from the 7 subway line. And a yummy breakfast included was a great perk to start the day. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was .. well, roomy for NYC. Plenty of good dining options nearby and close to the theaters. Very walkable location.

title: an oasis of quiet in busy NYC - great spot!
text: just loved this boutique hotel- the staff was fantastic - sooo nice -  we just loved it all- the bar was really cute too- the breakfast was ok- not alot of choices but fine for us- if they used greek yogurt in the parfait it would have tasted much better- just a little sour for our taste- coffee etc was great.  the location was the best- walking to all we wanted to do- except to soho- which we had a driver for that since we had a child with us- much better- the beds were great- bathrooms clean- and there was a tub- how great if needed- quiet area too- a great way to escape the noise- we will be back for sure- thanks to all the staff- you all were sooo great!

title: Excellent find in midtown
text: I associate midtown hotels with either bland chain offerings or mega fancy luxury hotels. Somehow the Iroquois lands right in the middle in the best possible way. Rooms are, yes, small, but very tasteful and thoughtful, modern and ultra clean. WiFi was a tad spotty but who cares. Lantern’s Keep, the cocktail bar, is also one of the best watering holes in the neighborhood. For a comfy and welcoming base of operations for 3 days of meetings in town, this was a solid A find.

title: New York 🇺🇸 ❤️ ✈️
text:
Localizzazione dell’Hotel ottima, soprattutto per la posizione centralissima a due passi dalla 5th Avenue🔝
Ovviamente il rapporto qualità/prezzo decisamente caro, ma giustificato dal fatto che siamo a New York (qualsiasi cosa la paghi il doppio 🥺)
Camera non molto spaziosa ma dotata del necessario per trascorrere il soggiorno tranquillamente.
Il personale disponibile e gentile ci ha reso la permanenza sicuramente più gradevole 🤩🤩🤩

title: Great hotel.
text: Very helpful and friendly staff. Beautiful and clean.  Close to everything.  We would definitely stay there again. Take and go breakfast was perfect.  I would have  liked 24 hour coffee ,but there was one just down the street.

title: Exemplary!!!
text: Do not hesitate to book your stay at the Iroquois. Friendly staff, fantastic complimentary breakfast to start your day, fresh fruit at front desk, complementary wine hour, and so much more… The Iroquois made our vacation happy.

title: Not really 4 star
text: No restaurant (closed for refurbishment) and grab and go breakfast was awful (microwaved bacon and egg roll🤮). No tea/coffee making facilities in room. Reception staff had no knowledge of current shows or even of subway routes.

title: Very nice hotel in the city center
text: The hotel is located in the center, yet in a quiet location, which we greatly appreciated. The room was smaller but clean and nicely furnished. The air conditioning worked well. The breakfast was not very varied, but it was sufficient.

title: Great location, Friendly Staff and YUMMY breakfast!!!
text:
Top Notch staff, super friendly and helpful.
Loved water was available upon request.
Great hot breakfast and fresh juice, comfy robes, and sleepers. 
Comfy beds, and no noise. Thank you for accommodating a higher floor!

title: Correct
text: Top localisation, chambres confortables bien que petites, petit déjeuner insuffisant en choix et avec un espace trop réduit. Le rapport qualité / prix est acceptable lorsque l’on réserve tôt. Le wifi mériterait d’être plus performant !

title: A hidden pearl
text: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise! In the middle of Manhattan, close to almost everything and with both ambiance and familiarity and still professional. In short, the place to chose for both business and pleasure!

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: Great location and friendly, wonderful staff. Enjoyed that this hotel was on the smaller, quaint side. It’s on a quiet street, right in the middle of the action of the city. Room was comfortable, clean and cozy. Good daily breakfast, enough to start your day. They also offered bottles of water. Walked to many areas of interest from the hotel and close to transportation. There are so many eateries in the immediate area. The Iroquois is great place to stay in NYC. Shoutout to Anthony and Kamille!

title: Average Stay in NY
text: Location of hotel is excellent. Desk personnel were friendly however there was no suggested upgrade. The room lacked proper glasses for the purchase of wine if you wished to and there were no replacement of the plastic glasses in the room during room service. The water pressure in the shower was poor. The ironing board was useless since it was broken and wouldn’t stay up. The Bell Hop “John” was very courteous, helpful and polite during our stay.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This is our first time staying at this hotel, but we will definitely be back!  We have stayed at many places in NYC and so we have a lot to compare it to.   Everything was excellent:  the beds, the location, the breakfast, the lighting in the rooms, the toiletries, the cleanliness, the quiet, etc.  In addition, the staff, including  the doorman each time we came in and out, were extremely friendly.

title: Great location, excellent staff
text: The hotel is in an excellent location. The staff are really friendly and welcoming. The hotel and rooms are nicely decorated, well maintained and clean. Has an upscale boutique feel. Rooms are a little small, but I think that is common in New York city.

title: Midtown Gem.
text: A midtown gem.  Large enough to have what you need, but small enough to feel like home.  Ideal location on W44th street.  Close to subways, Time Square, and Bryant Park.  Subway access from either end of the block.  We were able to walk to all of our theatre shows in under ten minutes. One subway to catch a Mets Game.

title: Oasis in the big apple
text:
Great location to explore the city for the first time . The staff were all friendly and helpful but also not over bearing.
The quiet rooms were a welcome respite from the busy , noisy , amazing city 
I would highly recommend this boutique hotel

title: Your Best Choice for Mid-Town Manhattan
text: We usually stay at some of the nationally branded hotels but were glad that we chose the Iroquois. From the moment you check in  at the hotel you will know you made the right choice. The warm and sincere welcome at the front desk, the well appointed rooms, the complimentary goodies (breakfast and wine tasting), the location all come together to create a memorable experience. The staff understand how to deliver exceptional hospitality and customer service.

title: Good location, small rooms
text:
Very small rooms, no place to open the baggage and no place for anything do it looks mess all the time. poor breakfast, food and place very small.
nothing to do at the hotel. No lobby, bar etc
Location is good

title: Amazing Hotel
text: The staff are super friendly and helpful, the rooms are nice and clean and quiet. The wifi is slow but everything else more than enough makes up for it. I really enjoyed my stay here and with it being so close to the times square you barely have to walk much to get to the subway.

title: The perfect hotel to be to visit NYC
