text: The Iroquois is a very good hotel to visit New York. It has a great location, close to every thing: Time square, New York Public Library, Bryant Park, Central Park, public transportation, everything you ll need you ll find it close by. The staff was soooo nice, a big up to all of you guys: frond desk, cleaning ladies, doormen, waiters for breakfast…. You were all amazing, and made our stay wonderful. I highly recommend it

title: 3 days at the Iroquois
text: Very pleasant time at the Iroquois, a tipycal small luxury hotel in Manhatan. Very clean and confortable bedroom. People at the hôtel were very welcoming and helpfull. The situation in the heart of midtown is a real bonus. I recommend.

title: Great stay
text: Friendly staff and good breakfast. It’s way more than just your typical continental breakfast. Location was close to everything. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Offered recommendations and answered all our questions

title: Amazing, staff, service and location.
text: We travel twice a year to NYC and stay at various locations.  This was one of our best ! amazing service, place was clean, location was outstanding, breaky was quick and yummy.  We will certainly be returning.

title: Great Location
text: Great location; quiet place to stay with a delicious grab and go breakfast included.  Staff was very helpful with organizing transportation and making suggestions for things to do.  Rooms were comfortable.  Nice bathroom.

title: Very centrally located hotel just a short walk from Times Square
text: I stayed at the Iroquoise for a week during a business trip. The staff is really professional and efficient at check-in and check-out. The location is the best thing about the hotel - very central in the Midtown with excellent access to the other neighborhoods.

title: Highly recommend this boutique hotel. Very well located but not noisy. Rooms and bathrooms updated and well equipped.
text:
Highly recommend this boutique hotel. 
Well situated but not noisy. Rooms and bathrooms updated. Robes  were appreciated. 
Staff friendly and very helpful. 
Grab and go breakfast convenient for a fast
option.
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Summer in NYC 2023
text: Wanting to experience New York City by staying at a boutique hotel, we chose The Iroquois in the heart of the city. When I first placed the reservation with Anthony, I knew I had found the right boutique hotel to stay in with my family. He was very informative, very knowledgable and very customer service oriented when finally arriving and seeing the hotel for the first time and the ambience, it was breathtakingly beautiful upon check-in I was greeted by more wonderful people who checked us in very quickly and gave us our room on time. If you were looking for a pretty hotel with great service and great amenities and a great location to everything you need in New York City. I highly recommend this property , thank you once again to all the staff, especially Anthony for making this family vacation. A very memorable one for us all. We will be back.

title: Good location
text: Stayed there for 3 nights when visiting NY, not a lot of space to have breakfast in the restaurant, terrible smell in a bathroom, to keep the smell away air conditioning on all the time, if you light sleeper is very noisy!

title: A gem in Midtown NY
text: I feel the Iroquois is a real gem in Mid-town. An island of peace and quiet with very supportive staff, beautiful decor and a wonderful overall feel. I spent 4 nights here and I will definitely come back. The fact that breakfast is included is a nice touch. The room was very quiet which is rare in NYC. It is an ideal location close to 5th avenue and Times Square but in a quiet location. I would highly recommend it.

title: At the heart of action
text: Excellent location, professional staff, small rooms, poor breakfast, with poor variety of choices. Clean hotel however and secure. Few meters from subway and Times Square. Stable internet, free of charge.

title: A Jewel in Midtown
text: As repeat customers, I was reminded on our last visit why the Iroquois is truly special.  The staff is diligent, friendly and extraordinarily proactive.  Marie at the concierge desk saved our weekend by volunteering to retrieve my lost phone from the theater and overnight mailing it to my home....Can't thank her enough!!

title: GREAT!
text: great location near all fantastic locations of midtown manhattan, wonderful staff, very polite staff, great attention to customer needs, excellent cleaning of the rooms, a little gem in manhattan, nice experience!

title: Excellent place to stay!
text: Very well located, close to everything. I stayed at the Iroquois last year for a whole week with my mother (82) and this year I returned with niece (16) and we stayed 10 days. We all loved the hotel, the rooms, breakfast, and the staff. Everybody extremely nice and helpful. The Gym is excellent too, and the hotel is close to Central Park so it is easy to go for an early morning run. Perhaps wifi could be improved. I will definitely come back next year.

title: Amazing hotel hidden away in a quiet street
text: This hotel was truly amazing. We wanted to find a quieter hotel off the hectic streets of Times Square and we hit the jackpot. Amazing staff , delicious breakfast included in price , clean rooms , comfy beds and just a great hotel😃

title: Good comfortable stay at Iroquois Hotel New York Times Square
text:
Very clean hotel, good front desk with Orlando
Clean and big rooms, nice small bar
Great location near Times Square and lovely and very friendly hotel staff
We have received excellent recommendation in terms of local restaurants, great airport service with Ramon

title: Comfortable and Friendly
text: The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our room was very comfortable and peaceful. We also enjoyed the beverages and friendly staff in the lounge, and of course the location is fantastic.

title: Excellent Place to Stay
text: This was a trip for my mom's 80th birthday. Accommodations were great. Staff was amazing. Check out Bryant Park (a quick walk from the hotel). Were able to walk to our Broadway show. Easy to get a taxi to go to other locations in the city.

title: Very poor standard. Rooms are too small and breakfast is very poor. Need to improve the services. Toilet seat is too sma
text: Very poor standard. Rooms are too small and breakfast is very poor. Need to improve the services. Toilet seat is too small. No view. The whole thing need improvement. It is not a five star hotel. May be two star

title: Great location to Broadway
text: This hotel was in a great location to Broadway. Great restaurants were also close. We took the train in from Philadelphia and took the 15 minute walk to the hotel. It was easy to find. This will definitely be a hotel we come back to. The staff was great and welcoming. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was a great bonus.

title: Ótima localização, bom quarto e boa limpeza.
text:
Tivemos um check in desastroso as 3:00 am com informação errada de cancelamento da reserva.
Quarto pequeno mas ok, limpeza boa, localização ótima, café incluso mas ruim.
Destaque para a simpática gerente e o atendente do café brasileiro os outros funcionários não cumprimentam.

title: 3star not 5 star
text:
Cramped and cleaned minimalistic 
Toiletries not replenished often got into the shower to find there was no body wash. Breakfast was a microwaved roll each and every morning!  Air con did not work and therefore there was a unit installed which cramped the room even more than the tiny room and was like sleeping next to a plane engine - 4 nights no sleep out of 8! Charged us for the water which was in the room no complimentary water. Only one gown and one pair of slippers- expected to share !!!

title: Thank you!
text: So happy we chose The Iroquois hotel for our NYC trip. Location, staff, grab & go breakfast, everything was great, nothing to complain about. Would definitely choose this hotel again and can recommend.

title: Lovely place, great location, friendly staff
text: New York was not the dream trip we had imagined. Dirty crazy and noisey. But thankfully the hotel was everything we hoped for it was an oasis of calm in a crazy city. Very clean, lovely staff, comfy beds.

title: I did not enjoy staying here
text:
So, first the good points – the hotel is in a decent midtown location which is near to everything, and the room was clean. Most of the staff seemed pleasant, particularly the guys on the door.

But unfortunately, that's where the compliments stop because I did not enjoy my two night stay. The room was small, and the décor was not to my taste – 1970s shades of brown with an awful patterned carpet (you say 'traditional' I say 'dated'). The bathroom was the size of a postage stamp with the toilet wedged between a wall and the sink, leaving zero space to move. There was nowhere to put toiletries, and the make-up mirror was awkwardly placed above the toilet making it difficult to use. There's a mini-bar fridge but it's the automatic kind with no space for your own items. The 'view' from my window was of construction scaffolding, and beyond that the wall of another building, making the room itself really dark and gloomy. The construction work meant that the carpet outside my room was covered in plastic, not great for the price point and star level. The room had AC, but it made a lot of noise. 

I did ask to move rooms, but was told that hotel was full and this would not be possible. Luckily I was busy with work and socialising, and spent little time in the hotel. I will definitely not be returning and would not recommend.

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Titre: Une nuit exceptionnelle au Iroquois Hotel - Emplacement parfait et délicieux petit-déjeuner

★★★★★

J'ai passé une excellente nuit au Iroquois Hotel à New York et je ne pourrais être plus satisfait de mon séjour ! Dès mon arrivée, j'ai été accueilli chaleureusement par le personnel, qui s'est montré attentif et professionnel tout au long de mon séjour.

L'emplacement de l'hôtel est tout simplement parfait. Situé au cœur de la ville, j'ai pu facilement accéder aux principales attractions de New York à pied. Times Square, le Rockefeller Center, Broadway... tout était à portée de main, ce qui a rendu mon séjour d'autant plus agréable et pratique.

La chambre était spacieuse, propre et offrait un confort absolu. Le lit était incroyablement confortable, me permettant de passer une nuit de sommeil réparatrice après une longue journée  de transport.
!

Je recommande vivement cet hôtel à tous les voyageurs en quête d'une expérience inoubliable à New York. Je reviendrai certainement lors de mon prochain voyage dans cette ville extraordinaire !

Merci à toute l'équipe du Iroquois Hotel pour ce séjour !

title: Decent Overall
text: Front desk staff was nice and accommodating. The room was cleaned daily and the hotel was within walking distance of the subway and Times Square. While there was no microwave a mini fridge was available upon request.

title: Great Time at NYC
text: Great location, good and attentioned staff, clean and comfortable rooms, excelent shower, good breakfast. Next yo N events that you can reach by foot, spareing time to do more at thisbcity that doesn't sleep. 100% recommended.

title: Luxury finds a home in this intimate boutique hotel
text: Steps away from Broadway is a hotel we return to time and again. We love the quiet, comfortable upscale rooms and service from attentive staff. Rooms are stylishly appointed with a modern, city vibe. The beds have luxurious linens for a deep, restful sleep after a busy day and night on the town.  In the morning, breakfast is ready when you are. When in the NYC area there are many choices, but for a couples getaway, this is our happy place!

title: Near time Square with breakfast
text: Great place to stay near timesqure and saved us lots of money for breakfast all staff are nice and friendly. We love the hotel and would recommend any of my friends who want to stay at timesqure and it on the quite street not too noisy

title: MATRIMONIO A NEW YORK
text:
Hotel centralissimo e comodissimo per Time Square utilizzabile per qualsiasi spostamento.
Siamo stati in famiglia (2 camere) a giugno 23, il motivo del viaggio era il matrimonio con mia moglie!
Le camere sono piccole ma ben arredate, personale gentile e disponibile.
Ascensori veloci e facilmente prenota oki, un po’ rumoroso ma nulla da eccepire. Prenotato come 5* in realtà è un 4*.
Unica pecca la colazione va però detto che avevano il ristorante in ristrutturazione e quindi alla colazione era adibita una piccola sala.
Il personale come già detto è molto attento e disponibile, oltre al matrimonio coincideva anche con il compleanno di mia moglie e ci hanno fatto trovare una bottiglia in camera.

Consigliato!

title: Best small luxury hotel in Times Square
text: If you visit NYC for Broadway, dining and shopping this is my choice for the best place to stay. Staff is always attentive, the location is minutes away from the arts, shopping, Restaurant Row,  everything you could possible want. Neighbors on the street include the Harvard Club, the NY Yacht Club, the Penn Club, the NY Bar Assn and the Cornell Club. From Museum Mile to the Village, this hotel is a big part of why "I love New York!"

title: Nice hotel close to theaters and Times Square
text:
My wife and I prefer boutique hotels and the Iroquois fit the bill. The rooms are normal NY cozy but very comfortable. The suite on the 12th floor was quite spacious. 

The staff understands hospitality very well and anticipate your needs. Everything was very clean. 

The location is close to the theater district and Times Square, and a block away from Bryant park. A great spot in midtown.

title: 2023 NYC
text: Great central and safe location for visiting NYC.  Walkable  to theater, dining and midtown attractions.  For visits to other parts of the city  there are good transportation options.  The Iroquois has the usual  amenities one expects from a hotel but being a smaller hotel offers a more intimate stay.

title: Très bon choix d hôtel pour des vacances en famille
text: Hotel idéalement situé. Accueil très chaleureux.  Merci à l ensemble du personnel. Nous avons pu nous déplacer rapidement dans NYC depuis l hôtel . Choix de restaurant tout proche. Agréable séjour à NYC

title: Totally recommended
text: I love the location. Just 2 minutes to Times Square. Room was clean and staff were nice and caring. The only thing is that the restaurant/bar was very small and breakfast options were limited to five choices.

title: The Calm Amid the Storm (of Times Square)
text: I love the location of this hotel… close to the theater district, but in a quieter location off Times Square. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well-appointed. I wish the rooms were a little more spacious, though. Very small for two people.

title: Iroquois’s hotel falls short of expectations!
text: My partner, and I were so excited to stay at this historic hotel, which we were told about by a friend, the staff was very nice and accommodating, unfortunately, we were put into a room 409, which was near a room that was being refurbished/under construction every morning there was loud construction noise, if we were told this upfront, we would’ve stayed elsewhere, rooms are very small and dated, on a positive note, the rooms were always very clean, the breakfast was small, but OK, great location, not a bad small boutique hotel just lacking.

title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME ..Best Experience
text:
I had a vacation family trip for a week with last stop in Iroquois in New York, My first 2 hotel stay experience was not great and I was more worried on my New York stay and also car parking etc...

When I reached there, I was pleasantly surprised by their services and I started getting hint things will go well ....very courteous bell boy who greeted me and got all my luggage out and got it to room , told me I can settle well and he will keep watching my car at curb side ..After that he helped me standing at middle of road guiding me to park it right across the Hotel  ...So One worry was taken care perfectly, THANK YOU Cameron you are awesome.
Once I reached at the reception ..Anthony and Emilio were courteous beyond comparison their feeling on customer service was so genuine that I felt I am at home and I can get help on anything I want ..Hotel is Super clean well maintained and it has a sense of personal care and touch with great amenities which you may get if you pay elsewhere but you will not get Home feeling which i got at this Hotel

John , you were awesome in helping me all the way for checking out luggage storage , easy of roaming around downtown all the tips you gave

Very highly recommend.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
We went as a family of 4 with boys ages 14 and 11. We needed extra space as my kids are getting big. 
We booked the suite which is two kings with an adjoining room. This was huge by NY standards and really felt like an oasis after a day of wandering the city. Not many hotels have king beds and adjoin either. I know because I did a lot of research!  
What a great experience.

title: A wonderful place to stay in NYC
text: The Iroquois is a great place to stay in NYC. Staff are exceptional, terrific location and having access to the "sister" hotels for daily tours is a bonus. Would definately stay here again.  Also a complimentary Wine and Cheese hour is a bonus.

title: Luxury at its finest!
text: I love staying at The Iroquois New York! We arrived at noon and were able to check in within an hour! We stayed in a Junior suite and it was gorgeous! Beautifully decorated, great bed, nice mini bar! The staff here is excellent and very accommodating! I highly recommend this hotel! The neighborhood is perfect because it’s close to Broadway and Times Square and shopping but far enough away to not hear the noise from that busy area!

title: Excellent
text: Maravilloso hotel cuidado al más mínimo detalle. Las camas súper cómodas. Cambian toallas todos los días y limpian la habitación. Experiencia 100% recomendable. Sin duda repetiremos. Desayuno también muy bien

title: NY hospitality
text: This hotel is in the best location for midtown - sandwiched between 5th and 6th it is close to Central Park and the upmarket shops around Rockefeller, close to the UN and next to Times Square for Broadway. The staff, especially Anthony and the concierges, are extremely welcoming and helpful. The rooms are quiet and arte nouveau in style; breakfast was a challenge as the room was h der construction but then head out to Bryant Park for a coffee and danish looking at the Chrysler building and Public Library.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois for our anniversary. The staff was fantastic and our room was amazing. The hotel was quiet and our bed was very comfortable. Great hotel experience! Thanks Iroquois team!

title: ONE NIGHT
text:
Loved everything about this hotel - room was a nice size for NYC and the bed was xtra comfy!
They also welcomed us with cookies and wine for our Anniversary! 
The only thing was the grab and go breakfast - stick with the Greek yogurt or oatmeal - coffee was good!  Restaurant should be opened next year!

title: My Stay at The Iroquois
text: Due to the pandemic my business travel was severely cut back, but I have been able to go to NYC for business this June 2023. The hotel as I remembered was very clean and quiet but still on the edge of Times Square so I could go back to the restaurants I loved when staying at The Iroquois. I would like to compliment Carlos for his promptness in getting me a taxi for my meetings each day. He was very professional, courteous,  and asked me each day I was there if there was anything else he could do for me. This is why I stay and recommend The Iroquois to my friends and work colleagues whenever asked.

title: I love the Iroquois
text: The Iroquois is the perfect hotel for me.  Clean, comfortable and attractive.  Just the right size so that I feel like I know the staff.  Best location - close to Broadway, great shopping and the subway.

title: Very welcoming and comfortable.
text: The Iroquois offers a restful environment near Times Square. The staff and property are of old world quality and the guest experience is well worth a visit. The staff is welcoming and the rooms very comfortable.

title: Clean, convenient and friendly staff
text:
A nice, clean and well-equipped hotel! 
Its location is perfect! A few minutes away from Empire State Building, Time Square, Central Park, Broadway, UN, etc.
The staff are really friendly and helpful. Anthony & Kamille were  great! They do their best for you whatever the case might be!
We did an early check in and a late check out without paying any extra money! We were there for three full days and two nights and could manage to see  most of the major attractions in Manhattan and was not possible without their help 
I definitely go back there again if I visit New York City in the future

title: Great stay in NYC
text: The Iroquois provided a good place for our 9-day stay in NYC. Clean rooms, friendly service, good breakfast - thanks! What is important, our bedroom was quiet and hence perfect for sleeping (but we did not have much of a view or much daylight, on the other hand). The interior is somewhat older but almost everything worked fine (we only had one day without warm water). And the location near Times Square is perfect. Thanks to the Team!

title: June business trip
text: Traveled for business and got the best sleep I’ve had in months! Wine hour was a nice bonus when I can back from the office on a Thursday evening. Thanks to the staff for all their help, everyone was very nice

title: Comfortable hotel. Great location.
text: Our room was on the small side but big enough for two people. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  The air con was a little loud and there was no fan in the bathroom, so the window had to be open after a shower.  Overall, we loved the room and the great location within the city, perfect for exploring the city from. Would definitely recommend and visit again!

title: Avoid until breakfast is at 5 star level again
text: Breakfast was absolutely unworthy of a 5 star hotel: plastic cutlery and cardboard boxes.  Sticky buns and cold croissants (which were microwaved on request - what do you mean fresh??).  The reason for all this was that their restaurant was being renovated.  They should have given no breakfast at all but some discount, because this was embarrassing.  My advice: don't go as long as the breakfast is not at 5 star level.

title: Perfect neighborhood
text: The hotel is located at 5th Ave and 44th Street intersection. A few minutes away from Time Square, Empire State Building, Central Park and Broadway. The hotel is very clean and the staff were very friendly

title: Excellent location
text:
Close to everything 
Very Friendly staff 
Clean and quiet room
Great value 
Great customer service they responded to our questions quickly , my kids really enjoyed the room and the breakfast highly recommended

title: Great staff, lovely room and BEST sleep!
text:
I sincerely had three of the best sleeps I've had in months while staying at The Iroquois. Considering its mid-town location, it was so quiet there. I didn't really hear other guests or street noise. The bathroom and room were both spacious, especially for NYC. Everything was clean and I felt very good and secure being there. The staff were really pleasant and genuinely warm from the moment I arrived to the moment I left (and actually even before I checked in, someone from the front desk was good about returning an email request I had before my arrival). I love this hotel! Will absolutely come back again. 
Even the breakfast was solid - breakfast sandwiches and nice fresh OJ to start my day off right.

title: Great experience, no complaints y
text: We had a lovely stay at the Iroquois for 6 nights. The location was great for walking to Times Square, Grand Central Station, Broadway, Central Park, etc. We loved the complimentary walking tours offered by Streetwise New York. The breakfast and daily housekeeping services were also wonderful in this clean, well kept boutique hotel. We shared a 2 bedroom suite with our 18 year old and enjoyed the extra space. There were not many children or younger kids at the hotel, it seemed like a lot of people on business trips. We would definitely stay again!

title: 12 Night Stay
text: The staff at the front desk is absolute rubbish except Anthony who makes a genuine effort to accommodate guest requests. the gym and the sauna are well maintained and clean. The hotel location is ideal.

title: Iroquois Review by Les
text: I experienced Excellent front desk attention by the two gentlemen who worked at the front desk. They were very polite. And they remembered me when I came back to the Hotel later in the day. They remembered me when I came up or down the elevator.

title: Great Place To Stay
text: I took my son to New York for his graduation trip. The Iroquois had good reviews and was in the heart of the city. They did not disappoint. From the moment you walk through the door, the staff was friendly and accommodating.  The rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. Shower had good water pressure and had plenty of really hot water. The free breakfast and drinks were a huge added bonus. Would definitely recommend

title: Perfect
text: Great location for walking. We came into town for our anniversary. Had dinner and a Broadway show. Al were within a 5-7 block distance including our brunch the next day. The staff were are very polite and helpful. Rooms a bit small but the price was right. Recommend this hotel to all.

title: A Time Piece
text: As a New York native, staying at The Iroquois is a great location to be a block away from Times Square, many upscale restaurants, shopping stores, subways, the famous 5th Ave with high-end fashion, Rockefeller Center, and more.

title: Quiet, comfortable, welcoming.
text: Beautifully situated near Times Square, near Westside and Eastside subway lines. Extremely quiet rooms. Extremely comfy beds. Super courteous staff, who always welcome you back after a long day of having fun with the very warmest smiles.

title: Perfect
text: Love it! Very convenient for visiting New York, great location (very central) close to Time Square but not too close, close to the subway, easy to walk to the Empire as well as to central Park. Nice restaurants in a short walking distance.

title: Excellent experience
text: I am fascinated, delighted with this hotel. Firstly, the perfect location. We went to many places just walking. On one side, Fifth Avenue, on the other Times Square. The staff is very friendly, attentive, helpful, especially Carlos, Orlando and a Moreno guy I don't remember his name (excuse me) who greeted us with water every time we arrived. We arrived before check-in and were able to safely leave our luggage and go enjoy ourselves. As soon as it was ready they texted us. We were on the 4th floor, everything was clean, no noise, it smelled very good. The super comfortable bed, in short, the perfect room for our family stay. The breakfast exceeded what I imagined, hot, juice and water. I will definitely come back and I recommend it 200%. Most importantly, there were no surprises on the bill.

title: Perfect Manhattan Stay
text: Super comfortable bedding and beds. Decent sized rooms. Quiet and well air conditioned. Extremely convenient for seeing basically anything in Manhattan. Relaxed, friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend highly.

title: Amazing Trip!
text: We were a 10 minute walk from anywhere we wanted to be.  Beautiful building.  Super friendly staff - very accommodating - very pleasant.  I felt like royalty staying there.  The rooms were smaller than I'm used to, but very comfortable and glamorous.  Thank you for a memorable weekend.

title: Cleanliness is an issue
text: The hotel was convenient in midtown near Bryant Park and was more affordable than others with a similar star rating. The issue was cleanliness as the room wasn’t properly cleaned between guests with clear evidence of this.

title: A great hotel in a great location
text: What a hidden gem!   Located within walking district of Central Park, the Theater District, Rockefeller Center, Museum of Modern Art and Grand Central Station - and much more.  Staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful.   Lobby was spotless.  Rooms are just as described on the website.  We had no housekeeping issues- halls were spotless and there was daily housekeeping.  This is a small boutique hotel with 120 rooms.  Lobby and amenities are similarly proportioned.   There is a small bar that serves great drinks and snacks.  A restaurant is currently being remodeled.   Wine hour is on Tuesday and Thursday with wine and cheese served in the lobby.  There is breakfast and coffee in the bar area each morning which is included.  There are limited offerings but the food is hot and tasty.   Water bottles are available from the front desk.  We enjoyed the great service and small size of this hotel.  We plan to return on our next trip! Highly recommend.

title: The right location with the right people and services
text: A well positioned elegant small hotel in a nice Manhattan neighbourhood with very friendly staff offering many useful suggestions. Rooms have a decent size and are always clean. We felt equally comfortable and safe at all times.

title: Service exceptionnel
text: Service chaleureux, employés accueillant et souriant. Tout était parfait. Endroit très propre. Le lit étais confortable, eau chaude. Déjeuner simple mais très bon. On nous a remis des bouteilles d’eau à deux reprises. Le stationnement était juste en face de l’hotel. (Par contre, il était payant)

title: NewYork Week End (mid Town)
text: Très bien situé, personnel accueillant et avenant, bon déjeuner, nous avons eu un surclassement de chambre pour souligner notre anniversaire de mariage, très belle attention et très apprécié! Nous y retournerons, c’est certain!

title: Best stay
text: Drove in for a long weekend to see the sights with my teenagers and just loved this hotel. The location was perfect, the staff was super helpful and polite and it was the biggest quaint room I have ever stayed it. I was worried before getting there that the quarters were going to be a little tight but it did not feel that way at all and we are three tall people! Very helpful to unload the car and help direct me to the parking across the street. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: A wonderful experience in NY
text:
We stayed a week at the Iroquois New York and had a wonderful time in a calm, clean and plesant environment. The staff at the Iroquois was friendly, serviceminded and wellbehaved in all aspects.

We can only recommend this hotel and its staff in highest regard on top of being in the center of The Big Apple between 5th and 6th avenue (5 mins walk from Times Square)

Thank you from Denmark :)

title: Best all around boutique hotel in the area!
text: Just returned from a fabulous 4 night stay at Iroquois NY.  The bed like a cloud, and the complimentary breakfast delightful/delish!  What a gem-the staff so friendly and at the ready to help with everything and anything - thanks to Yomaly, Emilio, Anthony, and Carlos who called us a cab every time!  Can’t wait to return!  My new home-away-from-home!

title: Good location, close to many hot spots
text: We liked our stay, even though we found the room a bit small for the price we paid. Also it was pretty dark because our window was literally 7-8 feet from the next building. Breakfast was fast-food like but still good. We liked it most for its location in Mid-Town Manhattan. 5 minutes walk from Grand Central Station that gets you everywhere. Staff was very friendly and made you feel welcome.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Hotel clasico muy bien situado. Hemos estado en una Suit. Es como un pequeño apartamento con comedor, sala de estar, dormitorio y baño. Fantastica estancia. Staff muy amable y colaborador. Si para ti grandes entradas y salones no son importantes, este es tu hotel.

title: Cute and comfy
text: Rooms are a little small but overall comfortable. Great and attentive service. Wifi and gym were the only things that needed improvement. Wifi is key for those traveling for work - but it was very slow and spotty. The gym needs a makeover - the equipment was limited and outdated.

title: Great!
text: Amazing hotel, perfect location just a few minutes walk from Times Square. Staff (breakfast, receptionnist) very polite and friendly. Very spacious room with marble bathroom. Very Good breakfast on the go with a variety of choices, we will be back soon!

title: Warning the "Do not disturb" system at the door
text:
The system of "Do not disturb" is through a button inside the door that if you forget to press it by mistake, which is easy as it is small and hidden, it can be marked.
This happened to us and instead of contacting the client throughout the day, they left a note on the door warning for it, so when we arrived at night after a long and tiring day we found the room completely unmade.
We think that instead of leaving a note, they should try to call the client to see if it was an error and thus access the room.
If you arrive before an hour, I think around 8:00 p.m., you can call and they'll go up to made it, but if it's later, which is very easy in NYC, they don't make the room.
This affects in the puntuation of the Cleanliness
For the rest everything else is fine.

title: Greate location
text: Perfect location, fantastic staff and very clean hotel, highly recommend,  the breakfast might not be for everyone but I found it ideal, the grab and go worked for me, I would definitely return to this hotel again.

title: Greatest hotel in New York City
text: If you want a hotel that is within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue Shopping and many great restaurants, this is the place to stay.  Rooms are perfect, it is surprisingly quiet, beds are very comfy and the price was great for all you get. Hotel staff is helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for location and atmosphere.

title: Great location
text: Had a very nice 5 night stay at Iroquois. Very nice staff, great location. Will be even better after refurbishment in hallway. My simple room did not have very direct sunlight (room 309) which was a pity. But the bed was comfortable, it was very clean and everything worked fine!

title: Pretty boutique hotel
text: Loved this pretty boutique hotel! Great location and friendly, kind employees. Room was small but adorable, and we loved the gorgeous bathroom! Terrible view of fire escape, but great sound insulation; we never heard anyone in other rooms or in the hallway.

title: Recommend, but remember the small things
text:
The staff were incredibly helpful and kind. The little extras were great (wine on Tues/Thurs, grab & go breakfast, etc). But remember they are part of the resort fee you get charged, so do take advantage of them. Also having a glass of wine before heading out to dinner or the theater is nice.

If you are driving to New York there is a parking garage near the hotel but make sure you make a reservation. We didn’t know that you needed to do that and were initially turned away. Thankfully the bellman stepped in and made arrangements. The garage apparently fills up fast so that may not always work. Taxis are plentiful around the hotel. Use them or uber. We booked the hotel “car” because we were afraid we wouldn’t be able to find a taxi and we had dinner reservations. It was expensive! We took an Uber back for less than a third of the price.

The room is comfortable. We couldn’t hear our neighbors which is a refreshing change. The robe provided is nice to wrap yourself in after a shower. The only thing missing is a coffee maker. You can get a coffee/tea in the Lanterns Keep and take it back to the room-but there’s nothing like having a cup of coffee/tea in your jammies in your hotel room.

Make sure you remember that the $300 the hotel places on your credit card for incidentals will not be returned when you check out. It may take up to 10 business days to hit your account. So if you are using a debit card connected to your bank account be sure to factor that into your vacation budget.

If you want to explore Times Square or go to the theater this is a great hotel. And knowing the small details makes it even better and stress free.

title: The Iroquois Hotel - a smart choice
text: I would highly recommend this ideally located hotel, a short walk from Times Square. Our room was clean and well appointed, with a comfortable bed. The staff was remarkably polite and helpful. Anthony, at the front desk, treated me like a firend, It helped that we are both Knicks basketball fans. Unfortunately, the dining room was very small. The breakfast was very meager. It's better to eat at the nearby restaurant.

title: Overprized and wasteful
text: Stay somewhere else where the hotel has an ecofriendly policy, edible breakfast with no plastic/paper waste and is uncrowded, and does not charge 100 USD more than others in the neighbourhood. The one solace was the close proximity to business and tourism sights.

title: They have drawers!
text: Cocktails in the bar were delicious, the breakfast was fine, the room and bathroom were large (especially by New York City standards), the bed was comfortable, and the dresser had drawers. It is close enough to Times Square to get to Broadway shows easily, without having to fight the Times Square crowds.

title: Personnel & localisation were ideal. Excellent balance quality/price
text:
Anthony & Emilio are the best hotel crew I’ve come across in all the travel I’ve done !
They were able to help & guide with any request and were always pleased to help.
Definitively had a wonderful stay (8 nights) All the staff was very nice as well.
The localisation is ideal, and all the services match the expectation you can have for this kind of hotel.
Would recommend 10/10

title: Business trip to NY
text: very good hotel and excellent location The price could be better but taking in consideration that hotel is located on the 5av it is acceptable. Service was very good and the only thing that definitely could be better is breakfast.

title: Emplacement parfait, personnel incroyable mais....
text: Comme indiqué dans le titre, les points forts de cet hôtel sont l'emplacement qui est formidable à quelques minutes de toutes les attractions de NY et le personnel qui est incroyable (accueil et femmes de chambre). Par contre, le bruit des chambres double (pour nous 301 et 1001) qui donnent sur la cour intérieure du bâtiment est insupportable, 2 jours sur 5 sans dormir à cause d'un groupe de climatisation/ chauffage des hôtels environnants, le double vitrage est insuffisant. Attention, le petit-déjeuner n'est pas un buffet, juste un plat au choix et une boisson.

title: Quick NYC trip
text: The hotel is centrally located.  Rooms are well designed, but small.  The rate for one night was pricey, but it did include breakfast and they were flexible with changing my reservation because my charity event was cancelled.

title: Lovely place in a good location, but cleaning should get better.
text:
The location is great, easy to get everywhere. Really enjoyed a walking tour with Dan from Streetwise New York/Triumph Tour offered by a hotel. 

Disliked · Cleaning was a big issue and only after the THIRD complaint the issue was addressed. The room was miserably dusty, cleaning crew would leave trash in the room (a trash bag from the bathroom was left on a chair in a living room, for example). Front desk didn't put much into it ("oh you think it should be cleaned?" - was a response to the second compaint about the dust). Breakfast wasn't very enjoyable and food felt artificial, but coffee was ok.

title: So nice !
text: Super journey  we will come back  cet hôtel est très bien situé a Times Square , chambre bien équipée, personnel très bienveillant, propreté implacable , vraiment on vous le conseille, il est hyper de ratisse

title: Amazing Hotel in the Heart of Manhattan
text: Beautiful hotel with the best attention, really clean and great location. Everytime I go there, they make me feel really welcome, the staff is great and are always willing to help you with anything you need.

title: The hotel is in a perfect location
text: All stores are very close by parking garage is in front of the hotel, time square is 5 min away walking. Room was very clean and great customer service from all staff. Highly recommend due to been so close to everything.

title: Fantastic Experience in Midtown Manhattan
text: Overall, an exceptional experience and highly recommended. Check-in and check-out with Emiliano and Anna, respectively, was pleasant and seamless. The room was great – nice use of space and very comfortable bed. Very conveniently located in midtown, so there's a large number of public transportation options and close to destinations, restaurants, and shopping. There's no question my partner and I will definitely be back.

title: Repeat weekend visit
text: Was our first visit to NYC since 2018. Third stay at the Iroquois Hotel. Location is perfect for theater goers, can walk to so many places from this location. Is enough away from Times Square to have peace and quiet at night. European ambience, small hotel, both travelers and staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Solo trip
text: I was initially given a room that had a very noisy leaking toilet.  It took some time, but eventually the staff gave me a different room which was quite nice.  The front desk staff, although ice, seemed quite new and not very experiences.

title: Love this hotel
text: Great location. Right in the heart of everything. Close to Times Square and wonderful restaurants. Staff is amazingly helpful with restaurant and activity recommendations. Although it is "New York" busy outside, the hotel itself is quite peaceful. Beautiful interior. Rooms are a little on the small side- that's New York- but very comfortable.

title: Fair at best
text:
Rooms quite small. Internet was fine. Very quiet.  Elevators pretty quick which was a relief. Not the place for a small group of 10 though. Restaurant under construction. No place to have coffee during the day or to meet except in the library which was often being used. Breakfast room far too small. They ran out of food during peak times. Plastic Plastic Plastic use everywhere. And the hotel suggested five months ago the restaurant could be open my Mid April. Not a chance .Had to go next door to the Algonquin to have coffee and meet our group. 

Staff tried hard. Doormen far more personable than front desk staff

title: Fantastique séjour au Iroquois Hotel
text: Séjour parfait, chambre calme, assez grande pour New York, propre. Le petit déjeuner n’est pas très varié mais suffit amplement à se sustenter. L’emplacement à mi chemin entre Central Park et le mémorial du 11/09 permet de tout faire à pied, notamment l’emblématique Empire State Building ! L’équipe de l’hôtel est aux petits soins pour nous. Nous reviendrons à lIroquois Hotel sans aucun doute.

title: SEJOUR NEW YORK
text: EMPLACEMENT PARFAIT PERSONNEL au top, par contre chambres petites, salle de bain minuscule, et pas de service bouilloire, machine à café, et accès réfrigérateur libre il faut payer, petit déjeuner très très sommaire et limité en quantité. Par contre literie exceptionnelle et draps et serviettes FRETTE un must.

title: Прекрасный отель
text: Великолепное расположение. Самый центр. Отзывчивый персонал. Удобные и чистые комнаты. Легкий завтрак. Ненавязчивое обслуживание. Размер комнат приятно удивил. Соотношение цены, расположения и сервиса хорошо сбалансированы.

title: L albergo perfetto per visitare Manhattan e di torni
text:
Hotel perfetto per visitare tutte le attrazioni di Manhattan senza fare capo a mezzi pubblici o taxi. A 5 minuti reali dalla pazza Times Square ma situato in una via tranquilla, la 44 tra la 5th e 6th avenue. Un 4 stelle molto carino dal gusto retro’ con personale gentilissimo e ottima pulizia. La nostra camera, una doppia con bagno privato era un po’ piccolina per i nostri standard europei, ma assolutamente in linea con New York, anzi persino più grande della media. 
Camera dotata dei necessari confort con tutto quanto puo’ occorrere. Include una colazione in stile grab and go, sempre uguale ma di ottima qualità, e consegna anche bottigliette d acqua ai clienti, un gesto molto apprezzato. Altrimenti fate capo ai numerosissimi ristorantini che offrono colazioni per tutti i gusti.
Check in e check out velocissimi e ricezione subito a disposizione per ogni necessita’.
Lo consigliamo assolutamente per il rapporto qualità-prezzo, per la posizione strategica (Empire Building, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, Madame Tussaud, The Edge, 5th e 6th Avenue per shopping o ristoranti, e per la tranquillità che offre la notte. 
Per tutto il resto e per un po’ di sana o meno sana follia ci pensa Times Square un posto assolutamente da gustare; come essere catapultati in un film di fantascienza. Noi abbiamo fatto ogni riservazione tramite booking e tutto ha funzionato perfettamente compreso il taxi da e per il JFK.
Con The Iroquais New York si va sul sicuro, consigliatissimo.

title: Chambre minuscule et mal équipée / petit déjeuner lamentable
text:
Hôtel indigne d'un 4/5 étoiles (seules 3 étoiles devraient être allouées à cet établissement).
La chambre était minuscule, sans lumière, avec un lit trop petit pour deux personnes (de corpulence normale). Aucun plateau de courtoisie (thé/café). Pas de pression dans la douche et eau parfois tiède/froide. Un peignoir pour deux (une seule paire de chaussons également). Pas de table de chevet de chaque côté du lit (la chambre étant si petite...). Le pire est le petit-déjeuner : servi comme dans un fast-food (boites en carton) / absence de pain, de salade de fruits, café infecte (absence de machine expresso...).

title: Perfect stay!
text:
From the moment I arrived at the hotel, Anthony made me feel incredibly welcome. He was attentive, friendly, and went out of his way to ensure that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. He was always available to answer any questions I had and provided me with excellent recommendations for local restaurants and attractions.

Anthony truly made my stay at the hotel memorable. His attention to detail and genuine care for his guests were evident in every interaction we had. He truly went above and beyond to make sure that all my needs were met, and I can't thank him enough for his outstanding service.

What impressed me the most about Anthony was his professionalism and enthusiasm. He clearly loves what he does, and it shows in the way he interacts with his guests. His positive attitude and energy were infectious, and I found myself looking forward to seeing him every day.

In summary, Anthony was the best part about my hotel stay. He made me feel like a valued guest and truly went above and beyond to make my stay unforgettable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for exceptional service, and I hope to have the pleasure of staying there again soon. Thank you, Anthony, for making my trip so special!

title: Great location
text: Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side but that is NY. The hotel makes up for it with its friendly staff and services. The hotel is very clean and close to everything. The breakfast that is included is enough to get you through the morning. They always had wine and light snacks between 5-6:00.

title: Excellent Central Hotel
text: Most wonderful hotel nestled in the centre of NYC. It’s on the doorstep of times square and many wonderful attractions. The room was clean and had a good amount of storage for everything. Beds were made everyday as well as replenishing all toiletries and towels. Front desk staff were so helpful and friendly and we were able to smoothly check in and out. Also thank you for the cookie and wine for celebrating our 21st. Thank you for providing such a wonderful stay.

title: Best place in NYC
text: Location is incredible.  Walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Rockerfeller Center, Central Park, 5th Avenue and all the shopping and restaurants you could want.  Lobby and rooms are very well-appointed.  All the employees provided excellent service.  We booked a 3 bedroom suite for the six of us (try finding that anywhere else).  Everyone had a little of their own space, yet we still had a common area where we could hang out together between activities, in the morning and late at night for a drink.  Few amenities (small gym, no full serve restaurant) but who cares.  You're so close to everything, nothing like that was missed.  They made up for it in more important ways like great service, free newspapers each morning, and a free fresh breakfast each morning.  We would stay at the Iroquois again in a heartbeat.

title: Comfortable, quiet, and wonderful
text: My friend and I loved staying here--clean, comfortable, QUIET, and very pleasant. Central to theaters, the park, subway, restaurants, and stores. Would return in a heartbeat! This was my friend's first NYC visit, and she would gladly re-book at this hotel. FYI not easily accessible for disabled due to front steps and small elevators.

title: Amazing!!
text: The staff is amazing! Always caring and attentive. Cameron, Emilio, Orlando, Kamille and Anthony were outstanding. There were more staff that were also outstanding but I don’t remember all the names. The hotel is also amazing! Free hot breakfast and a sauna 24/7 is two features that make this hotel better than most others. Location is great! Rooms are beautiful and very clean! I have many great things to say about this hotel. We Will try and stay here any time we visit NYC. The only one thing that needed attention was the air conditioner in our room. Room 1008. It was not working properly. We had to open the window every night to not be so hot.

title: WELCOME TO NEW YORK
text: Settled in a quiet street amidst the hustle and bustle of Midtown Manhattan is the beautiful boutique hotel The Iroquois New York. Just minutes from Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center or Bryant Park. The perfect starting point to explore New York on foot. The room was super spacious and stylish. Here you sleep like at home.

title: An oasis of calm
text: What a wonderful little hotel!  We are so pleased we chose this for our New York accommodation. From the friendly staff to the impeccable cleanliness, we were so happy with our stay.  The rooms are compact, in line with a hotel of this vintage and New York hotels in general, but the beds are super comfy, amenities tasteful, linens high quality and it was wonderfully quiet.  The elevators are a little quirky but this adds to  the character. Due to dining room renovations the breakfast is a grab and go arrangement but there is room to consume in the bar. A great location close to the beautiful Bryant Park surrounded by classic buildings. A real bonus was being able to join one of the complimentary walking tours led by David which gave a fascinating insight into the local area and subway/central station’s development.

title: Excelente servicio sobre todo de la señorita Yoslany
text: Nos encanto este hotel , sobre todo la limpieza y la excelente atención . La señorita Yoslany nos hizo sentir en casa, súper buena y atenta . El señor Carlos también fue muy amable .Volveremos el año q viene si Dios quiere.🙏🏻

title: Very friendly and competent staff.
text: I felt welcome, every request got a prompt and satisfied answer. Rooms are very small, but clean and calm. Breakfast is a bit poor, but long time available, fine gym equipments including sauna. The staff is excellent and very service orientated.

title: Resort fees refunded
text: The hotel had a surprise "resort fee" when I checked out, but kindly refunded it after they saw that the information I was given upon booking didn't make these fees clear. Hotel was pleasant and clean and had good breakfasts. Great central location.

title: Great stay for St. Patrick’s day
text: This is a fantastic Hotel. Centrally located close to 5th Ave and 44th. Lots of attractions in walking distance as well as the Grand Central Station. The hotel staff was super nice and the rooms and bathrooms were very clean. As a special perk the bar in the hotel serves excellent drinks. I can highly recommend this hotel.

title: Times Square stay
text: My girlfriend and I loved this hotel. We were able to book the presidential suit for a sweet deal by booking the night before! If you stay don't forget to try the dry sauna!👌The cleanest sauna we have ever seen. We were recommended the quickest and nicer way to JFK by the doorman; Long Island railroad to Jamaica then airtrain!

title: Great Stay
text:
Great Hotel, nice satf and great locaation.
I would definately come back.
The only recomendation I would make is to have a better breakfast option. The take away breakfast is fine if your in a hurry but a sit down breakfast with hot dishes would be great.

title: Sales Trip
text: This was a great hotel.  I was here for a sales meeting and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  The property was very convenient to where our group's business needs were.  I would definitely refer this property to friends and colleagues!

title: Misleading Price Estimate
text: Very nice hotel with a helpful staff.  My one complaint is that the emailed documents sent to me prior to my stay, with estimates of the charges, omitted about $50 per night of taxes and "facility fees," albeit a little paragraph below the price quoted mentioned the fees--in other words, I felt misled because all of the charges that definitely would be applied were not clearly included in the estimate price--misleading.

title: Great find in the theater district
text: We have stayed in several hotels when we spend the weekend in New York.  The Iroquois is at the top of the list now!  It is very well located - right on 44th street.  It is clean, the staff is courteous and polite, and the rooms have many amenities that are not so common anymore such as a room safe, bathrobe, lotion etc.  We will be returning to The Iroquois.  It is a great value and we are happy we found it!

title: Great location and fine staff!
text:
A great place to stay if you want to visit the heart of Manhattan. Great staff, excellent location, good big rooms en fine beds.

The doormen are to be mentioned separately: great guys with a lot of knowledge of the city!

title: An excellent place to stay for a romantic weekend
text:
The Iroquois was a really nice place to stay. The heated floor in our beautiful bathroom was amazing and felt luxury. The sheets, and robes once again felt luxurious.
We were treated well- and showed up early to drop our bags to the bellhop and we were given our room early at no extra charge. It was wonderful to feel like they weren’t out for money.
We didn’t use the sauna, fitness center, or use any “extras” but it was nice that it was available.
Breakfast was okay. We got bacon egg and cheese- it seems it was made earlier in the day and our was warmed up in the microwave leaving the bread chewy. Other breakfast options looked good- oatmeal, parfait, pastries, fruit. Coffee was pretty good.
I’d stay here again- it’s so close to Times Square. We enjoyed our stay.

title: New York Iroquois
text:
The hotel was in a great location.  Very close to time square.   The hotel is clean.   The breakfast is very poor.   You have only two    choices…either a breakfast sandwich or yogurt.   The dining room is tiny   Only about 10 people can be seated at a time.   As for breakfast, you need to ask the employee what you want.   You cannot serve yourself.   
As for the hotel service it was okay.   Our tv remote was broken and needed to get replaced.   They replaced it a few hours later.   Also the hotel checked in another guest and gave them our room.   Yet we were already in there.   The guest was letting himself in and realized the room was booked.

title: Great hotel in Manhattan
text: Lovely location near Times Square. Nice clean, comfortable rooms. Rooms generally have a shower rather than bath but this is normal in New York. Good breakfast that you can either eat in or take a grab bag. Second time here and will definitely return.

title: Best of the Best
text: Top notch in every way. Will definitely stay there again. Close to so many attractions yet has a nice, boutique feel. The hotel concierge and staff were accommodating and knowledgeable. The room was immaculate. The music in the lobby and lounge was also right on the money!

title: Subtle, historic elegance on a personable scale with attentive (also subtle) staff to match.......
text:
Recently stayed here on an overnight, as I had happened to walk by on a previous trip, and was intrigued.  It did not disappoint.  

Since it was just me, I reserved the least spacious (and most reasonably-priced) "queen" room. Despite being 200 sq. ft. it didn't feel small due to the triple window, clever arrangement, and high ceilings. Cozy but not cramped. Well placed closet keeps luggage, etc., out of the way. Small desk was handy. Elegant bathroom had ample storage surfaces, numerous lighting choices, and even a window. 

Enough about the room, the "star of my stay" was Emilio at the front desk, who from initial check-in,  numerous comings/goings, check-out, and luggage retrieval hours later,  was indispensable.  He helped me find destinations, print a reservation, and even went on a treasure hunt for postcards/envelopes for me to send. He is the kind who keep people coming back. ALL MY THANKS. 

Breakfast was included, and served in a space at the rear that appears to double as a bar, I'd gladly have a drink here on another visit.

The Iroquois is tucked in an elegant, yet quiet section of 44th Street, a nice refuge from the rest of mid-town.   Based on the above, I'll definitely be back.

title: Great
text: Wonderful stay only place we will look to stay when in NYC. Staff greeted us very accommodating and extremely helpful and friendly.We arrived early and staff made us feel comfortable the minute we arrived. My wife and I can’t wait to stay again. It was her birthday weekend and the stay made the whole birthday wonderful. Thank You Iroquois Staff. Lenny and Lisa Camarda

title: Excellent Find
text: All the staff were so helpful. The room was great and breakfast was also spot on. I really didn't know how close to Times Sq, Grand Central & Bryant Park the hotel was , it was a most convenient location

title: I really liked my 4-night stay
text: I would describe this hotel as subdued luxury, My king-size bedroom on the second floor was somewhat small but had a window that was perhaps 7 feet high and 10 feet wide (it took up most of the wall), and a marble bathroom that was really beautiful. Though I didn't ask for much I found the desk personnel to be cheerful and helpful. There is an included grab-and-go breakfast which was consistently excellent. The neighborhood was great. I would gladly stay here again.

title: 1st time in NYC
text: For a first trip in NYC it was perfect. The location of the hotel is perfect in the centre of everything. The service is great and room are confortable. I recommande this hôtel that fits for a a family of 4 people.

title: Awesome stay
text: My stay was absolutely magic!  The room was so spacious and beautiful my wife and I were in awe!  The bathrooms were sparkling and large with showers and separate tub.  Everything was like brand new.  The pictures and paintings were stunning and attractive.  The service was incredible.  Friendly and top notch!  The lanterns keep was really great and the mixed cocktails ever original and the food was delicious.  Bar none, the best breakfasts at a hotel I’ve ever stayed at.  Really great job!!!

title: Good location but the breakfast is a joke
text:
Thé location is gréât but the rooms are little and the breakfast is A joke 
As it is in the price of the room you cannot decide to take it away and that is not serious at all ! The beds are quite little also

title: Two wonderful nights at this small hotel
text: We selected this hotel because of its location near Broadway theaters and restaurants but away from all the traffic and noise. It was perfect. Small room (not unusual for NYC) but very comfortable. I’m fussy about pillows and these were terrific. Slept well with no noise outside or on corridors. Wonderful, friendly, helpful staff. “To Go” breakfast (due to some COVID restrictions, I guess) was a bit skimpy but there was a great diner right down the street if you wanted more.

title: Hidden Gem Boutique in MidTown
text: If you are looking for a departure from the chain hotels, Iroquois is an absolute gem. Staff is outstanding, every person we interacted with was memorable, friendly, helpful. The room was incredible, so much more than a simple hotel room, upscale finishing and touches. Great location in mid-town, close to shopping and the theater district. Highly recommend this hotel, you will get more for your money and some personal touches that few hotels seem to get these days.

title: Nice hotel near times square and theaters
text: We picked the hotel due the location and free breakfast with coffee.  It's a nice hotel for the price and close to the theaters.  The staff at the hotel were friendly and professional. I would recommend this to anyone.

title: Cramped hotel in a good location
text: It was our first stay at the Iroquois since the interior renovation was completed and we were not impressed the lobby area and restaurant are not very welcoming. The rooms are nice but small and cramped. We will likely try another hotel on our next trip to NYC.

title: Great Location
text: Great location for the Theater district, reasonable value for the location, good overall ambiance, room was decent size and comfortable, staff friendly and accomodating. Breakfast ok/convenient. Bar cocktails good. Would definitely stay again.

title: If only the breakfast wasn’t a disgrace
text: Ideal location, small rooms, some street noise (earplugs recommanded), very friendly staff, breakfast is a disgrace (bacon and eggs sandwich put in microwave, very small breakfast room, nothing fresh, lots of plastic)

title: NYC 2023
text: Went with my boyfriend and another couple to run away from home for a few days. This hotel was the best we’ve stayed at so far in NYC. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone heading that way.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: This boutique hotel has been delivering for me for over 20 years. This is an absolute gem and most importantly, the people are first class. If you want the extra room, get a suite and enjoy your time.  Everything here is first class

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text: This hotel is one of the best places I have ever stayed! The service is outstanding, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the amenities are top-notch. The rooms are spacious and well-furnished, with all of the necessary amenities for a comfortable stay. The beds are comfortable and the linens are of high-quality. The in-room internet access is fast and reliable, and there are plenty of outlets to charge all of my electronics. The bathrooms are clean, modern, and equipped with all the necessary toiletries.

title: Very convenient location, friendly staff
text: Rooms were very clean and the bed/pillows were comfortable; good size for one or two people but would be cramped with kids. Breakfast options are a bit limited currently, but very tasty. Staff was friendly and on-point at all hours.

title: Excellent experience!
text: We have stayed @ Iroquois several times now, and are never disappointed. The staff, the accommodations, Lantern's Keep, the location of the hotel...all great! We were even given an upgraded room! Just an overall positive experience & we will continue to choose this as our first choice for hotels in NYC.

title: Nice hotel!!!!!
text: Fun hotel. Enjoyed my stay. People were very nice. The bar closes at 10:00, which is a little early for NYC. Breakfast grab and go was very nice to have, especially for those of us that need our morning coffee

title: Comfortable stay
text:
Provided great location and comfort for my business travel. Location is perfect walk to grand central station or  time square.
Great restaurants nearby and Gregory’s coffee across the street is my favorite and I always bring a bag of coffee home when traveling to NYC

title: Exceptional Experience
text:
Best Lication just next to Fifth Ave.
Staff is exceptional,  very very well organised. Specially Anna at the front desk was amazing. She made our trip so comfortable.  Explained each and every places to visit with patience and her guidance was outstanding.

title: A great centrally located option
text:
The hotel is in a great location, one of the things I really appreciated was how quiet the street is and the lack of horns and sirens throughout the night. We had a room with two queens bed and a view of an interior corridor that appeared to be under construction. 
Regardless, it was quiet and the beds are really comfortable. Breakfast leaves something to be desired, I have a gluten sensitivity and the options, other than yogurt, were severely lacking as all the sandwiches are premade and it is not possible just to get bacon and eggs. Otherwise we found everyone to work at the hotel very pleasant and overall really enjoyed our stay.

title: Not very welcoming first impression at the reception
text: Gym was a small but good enough to work out, nice thing to have.Good location and clean room. People at reception were impolite, I tired to avoid dealing with them after check in - I got the feeling that is what they wished. Breakfast was not good and the usage of paper and plastic only created a lot of waste, environmental disaster.

title: Unpolite staff, good location
text: Good location, spacious and clean room, staff in reception seemed to hate their jobs, avoiding eye contact etc. Small but nice gym was a big plus. Bar hours were limited but service was good. Breakfast is not good, microwaved breakfast burgers (?), filter coffee, everything is paper/plastic --> lot of waste.

title: Love the Iroquois
text: Alway love our time at the Iroquois - love the smaller hotel atmosphere, the location, and the staff. The staff is always very welcoming and helpful and the rooms are lovely. We particularly like that it is a smaller hotel.  Looking for special discounts when booking directly with them allows us to stay at a nicer hotel at a more reasonable rate.

title: Very nice
text:
Location of this hotel is awesome - walk a block or two to Times Square. Plenty of restaurants and things to do.

Hotel staff was very welcoming and friendly. 
Room and bathroom was spacious and comfortable.
Free breakfast was a very good bonus. 
Highly recommend.

title: Iroquois is a great place to stay!
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice, clean and the beds were very comfortable....especially after a long day and night out in the city. I went with my nieces and sister in law. The location was perfect for all the sights and shopping!

title: Great Location, Good Price
text:
We had a great three-night stay at the Iroquois.  The location was ideal - very close to  the Broadway shows we were going to see and a pleasant walk to, subway back from Lincoln Center.  Located on the same block as several private clubs with which we had reciprocal privileges as well.  The room was a nice size and quiet.  All amenities were in good condition.  The staff was much friendlier than typical in NYC.  (The elevators were a little flaky, but it wasn't much of a problem.)  A nice treadmill was convenient.  A very modest breakfast was available at a very modest price.

The hotel offered a free set of walking tours with Streetwise New York Tours.  We really enjoyed our Grand Central/Midtown tour with Sonya.   I wish we had noticed this offer earlier; we would have taken more of the tours.

title: Quick Trip with Family
text: Great value and location.  Rooms were clean and up to date.  Easy walk to major subway lines, Times Square and the Theatres.  The staff was generally courteous and gave us helpful opinions on places to go.

title: Gorgeous Hotel in the Perfect Location
text: We used to stay at the Algonquin next door, but they did a horrible renovation and ruined the ambiance. The Iroquois is just lovely and the staff are very kind. We had the most beautiful room we’ve every had in New York. We love coming to New York and seeing a show, and now we will only stay at the Iroquois. It is the perfect location and an elegant hotel.

title: Another time where TA needs an 'Above Average' Rating!
text: I've stayed in many properties in NYC from Central Park down to South Side Seaport.  I would rank this as an Average property in the $200-$250/night class.  Very clean with great staff, room and especially bathroom a bit on the smaller side.  Location great for Theater and East side shopping access.   For the money, the Sofitel next door may be a better bet/value for amenities.

title: Poor
text: Poor quality not worth of 5 star. due to prime location it was convenient. otherwise all poor. There was nothing in the room. no water. no tea / coffee. not even a cattle in the room. service is only for tips.

title: Great location
text: Great central location. Cute diner next door for hearty breakfast. Rooms are small but comfortable. Mini fridge well stocked. The only negative was room was too warm even with the heat off during our Jan stay.

title: It used to be a great place....
text: We used to love staying at The Iroquois (especially after The Algonquin was bought up by Marriott!), but it seems to have really suffered from Covid....the restaurant seems permanently closed (they have a "breakfast to go" which is not great), no tea/cider/coffee in the library anymore, and overall things seem rather "tired". It's a great location, and the staff is nice, but it needs some TLC....and a restaurant!

title: Perfect Place in central Manhattan. We enjoyed a fabulous stay with the entire Family in three rooms. super place.
text: Clean Place, super friendly personell, great central Location in Manhattan. No Noise at Night. Good breakfast, Little different from Standard Full breakfast. We could leave our luggage there, Weile we Touren.

title: Clean, comfortable and spacious!
text: We stayed in the Iroquois because it was close to the theatre district and it had gotten nice reviews on Expedia and Booking.com.  There is only a grab and go breakfast but it had some hot croissant options, oatmeal, juice, etc so it was find.  Very comfortable and quiet room!  The staff was very welcoming and always ready to answer a question.

title: Small but nice hotel in great location
text: Small but upscale hotel. We were upgraded to a suite. Nicely appointed and comfortable. Very clean.  Great location with convenient parking. Easy walk to Broadway and Times Square. Breakfast was disappointing but wasn’t expecting much. Coffee spot and diner across the street for better options. Did not try the bar.

title: Central and quiet
text:
Very central location from which we could easily walk to Broadway, Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State and even Central Park. Despite centrality of location, it was very quiet at night, within the hotel as well (and we were close to the elevator). 
Room is well appointed with very comfortable bed and private bathroom with walk in shower. 
Breakfast was great. Hot oatmeal with variety of toppings, breakfast sandwiches, pastries and coffee/tea. 
Would definitely stay here on our next trip to NYC!

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Our room was big (for NYC) and clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was huge (for NYC). The lobby and bar were beautiful. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel offers free walking tours in a different neighborhood each day. The tours were great. We learned something new on each tour.

title: Too expensive for this kind of hotel
text: There was no view in our room. Breakfast has been very, very light and the same for 8 nights stay. Housekeeping was very kind. The location is very good and it was easy to get to anywhere in the city.

title: very nice but expensive
text: We stayed at Christmas time and purchased the Christmas package which included a lit tree and stocking and extra bateries and cookies and a note from Santa, very sweet.  But my oh my those extra charges for taxes, hotel fees etc added about $150 to our bill!!!

title: Great stay for a quick trip to NYC
text: Overnight stay to catch a play the next day, and was a quiet night considering how close we were to the hub of Times Square and right before NYE! Staff was awesome and welcoming! Emilio at front desk very helpful with information! John with our luggage storage also helpful and asking if we needed transportation. Parked overnight across the street at garage that was very convenient.

title: Poor attitude no breakfast no apology
text: Breakfast is until 11am, so went at 10.40 and they had nothing to eat and said they run out of food, then said we have had more people here, surely you buy food for the visitors booked, then I asked for a drink, he said I’ve only got Diet Coke and then said it’s chargeable. So I paid for breakfast got nothing then got charged again for a coke, what a joke run by kids. Do not book or pay for breakfast as they don’t have it and charge you loads to receive nothing and reception thinks this is fine, the hotel is a rip off and makes money on out of town tourists, do not stay.

title: Top
text:
Hôtel très propre très bien placé dans une rue calme le petit déjeuner est un gros plus dans cette ville qui bouge tout le temps 
Beaucoup de restaurants prêts de l'hôtel
Prêt de toutes les attractions 
Super je recommande

title: A Longtime Favorite in Midtown
text: Just returned from another great stay at the Iroquois. It’s a smaller hotel on “club row,” a quiet block of hotels and member clubs between 5th and 6th. A perfect location within east walking distance to Grand Central, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway. The rooms are on the smaller side, but nicely appointed. Lobby is small and there’s only a very small bar, but other bars, coffee shops, and a diner are literally steps away. Friendly and competent staff. My go to hotel in Midtown.

title: Quiet luxury in the Big City
text: The Iroquois Hotel is nestled on 44th St between 5th & 6th Ave.  Excellent accommodations, extremely quiet, staff knowledgeable and friendly. The sort of place you LIKE recommending to family & friends, with no hesitation! Located just 1 block from the subway, 2-3 blocks from the scene on Broadway. Excellent stay.

title: Very clean and comfortable hotel, staff was extremely nice and professional!
text: Hotel room was perfect size and very clean and well kept. Staff were very kind and professional and the experience all around was amazing. Location was perfect for what we traveled to see. We will definitely be booking to stay here again!

title: Gorgeous hotel & location
text: This hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms are spacious, clean, modern & comfortable.  All of the staff are very accommodating and welcoming. We were travelling with our 11 year old daughter and it was perfect for our needs.

title: Perfect Location
text: Very well kept across the board. First rate overall. Great history with James Dean having lived there in the early 50's before it was converted from a small apartment building to a small luxury hotel .... if I have my facts correct

title: Awful hotel
text:
Oh where do I start? 
I have stayed in hotels all over the globe but this is the worst. Five grand or so for a suite (🤔) 
First night we get there about 10.40pm. Any chance of food? 
We were told to call a pizza. The Wi-Fi is non existent. 
Breakfast and the bar??? I have better in my garage. 
Very disappointed but to add injury to insult they keep your deposit then start a fight with you to get it back. AVOID AVOID AVOID

title: Everything you could expect from a 4 star hotel and more!
text: First time at The Iroquois and multiple previous visits to NYC at other hotels (mostly 5 star). I was really impressed with this place. Clean and spacious room for the price. Location is amazing. Close to Times Sq and Broadway. Wonderful for Xmas sights and Rockefeller tree/Saks Christmas display. Quiet despite being downtown. Breakfast was perfect with solid choices. Emilio was exceptional at the front desk. Always kind and obliging. Eager to give us the best experience. Bell hops were attentive and very friendly. Would definitely stay here again. Staff were wonderful. Small and boutique.  Not at all large, commercial or overbearing.  Great bars and diners nearby. Definitely worth the price imo. We will be back.

title: Perfect Location and Amazing People!
text: Rooms are VERY clean and wonderful!  Staff was A+ and the location was incredible!!  Walking distance to everything.  Gave incredible recommendations on where to go for dinners and when needed even the most little things they were there to help.  Wonderful place and wonderful people.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: Classy, Comfortable and Convenient
text: Fabulous!!  For NYC it checks all the boxes   Staff is superb. We stayed 3 nights and everyone we met was wonderful. Never wait for an elevator. Room was roomy and quiet. Bed comfortable. Close to everything. Grab and go breakfast was really good. Shower was great - hot and strong with heated bathroom floors. Bathrobe was nice and had a blow dryer that actually worked liked one you’d buy yourself. They still clean the room every day (like before pandemic). Feels like a 5 star hotel. We have come to NYC a few times a year for the last 30 years. This is now our favorite hotel. I don’t generally write reviews and we stay in very nice places but I have to say this hotel just impressed us from the moment we entered.  We will definitely be back again.

title: Großartiges Hotel in top Lage
text: Wir verbrachten 5 Nächte in einer Suite (10. Stock). Die Größe war vollkommend ausreichend. Ruhig, gemütlich und stilvoll. Die Betten sind sehr bequem und die Fenster halten den Lärm der Stadt draußen. Zwischen Subway Stationen, Grand Central Station und Times Square gelegen, welche unterschiedliche Linien bedienen und innerhalb von 5 min zu Fuß erreichbar sind. Ideal um die Stadt zu erkunden. Das Personal war jederzeit sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Tolle Bars und Restaurants in direkter Hotelnähe.

title: The height of luxury in a boutique sized setting!
text: The Iroquois New York is a real gem! From the second you step into the gorgeous lobby or even before when the bellhop helps with your bags outside, it’s a lovely experience! The front desk staff is welcoming, helpful and efficient! My room was stunning and I think the only thing I would say is that if you want a room with some type of view, you should express that in your reservation! It’s NYC and someone has to have a view of a building next door, but it’s more exciting to see the street or have a view of something besides the neighbors! But overall this is a great hotel!
