My room was clean and the marble bathroom with heated floors was impressive and luxurious! The shower pressure was amazing and the bed was very comfortable! I can’t wait to go stay again in the future!

title: A great find in Midtown
text: This is a historic, small hotel on a quiet street near everything in mid-town. I visited on Thanksgiving and the Iroquois was a lovely oasis from the mid-town madness but close to the fun. The rooms were small (as are most in NYC) but immaculate and well-appointed. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or pleasant. There is a small, cozy bar for a drink before dinner or a play. Enjoyed my stay and hope to return.

title: Stefano Vlm
text: A week in New York in a beautiful structure in the center of Manhattan. Clean rooms, perfect wifi, reception staff helpful and very kind. Excellent value for money. When my wife and I return to New York we will definitely stay here as it was a good experience

title: Best hotel ever
text: We stayed at IQHNY for one night while seeing the Christmas Spectacular at RCMH. From the moment we stepped in we were treated like royalty. We were upgraded to a higher room category… my daughter had a blast. Thank you IQHNY for a lovely stay. See you next time…

title: Amazing nyc stay
text: Great hotel. Awesome staff. Great location. Will definitely stay here again. I really liked the rooms, the decor, and the overall style of the hotel. The front desk staff were really attentive and helpful.

title: Family Friendly
text: Great location, close to shops and Times Square. And even better service, the hospitality was impeccable. We had an early flight to JFK and they ensured that a taxi was there when we checked out to get us to the airport on time. We truly enjoyed are stay here and will be coming back!

title: Heating system wasn't working and I didn't even get an apology!
text: During my stay, the heating system broke down (twice). The temperature at my room dropped to 58 and they didn't even give me a space heater. It took them forever to change me to a new room which was at 69 - the best they could do in freezing weather outdoors. The new room, I found, had not been flushed. There was no staff available to bring me disinfectant so I could clean it myself. I slept curled like a ball under the blankets and checked out  earlier than anticipated. Didn't even get an apology!

title: Fall weekend stay
text: We loved this small hotel with high end features.  Our room was spacious and very nicely appointed.  We walked everywhere we wanted to go.  We appreciated getting upgraded to a suite!  The breakfast was simple but just what we needed.

title: How lovely to be back at the Iroquois
text: The newly renovated Iroquois is an attractive & appealing boutique hotel. It’s been our go to place near Broadway shows and museums. The Grab & Go breakfasts, small gym facility, and welcoming and kind staff are also valuable features for us. The only concern was a loud AC noise from a next door building that would go on intermittently, esp at night, in the part of the building where we stayed. Otherwise, we had a lovely & memorable stay!

title: Fabulous Stay
text: This was a great place to stay from the location to the cleanliness and friendly staff. I'd definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC. The room was lovely and the hotel is just the right size to be comfortable.

title: Great place for a weekend getaway
text: Loved staying at this very lovely small boutique hotel.  Staff was very friendly. The location was just about perfect -- easy to walk to shows, shopping, and restaurants. Loved the grab and go breakfast. Accommodated requests for birthday greeting.

title: great location, great staff
text: we have stayed at the iroquois many times and keep coming back.  the hotel restaurant will re-open in december which will be an  added bonus.   the most outstanding part of the hotel is their staff----very friendly, professional, even remember your names--like being part of a family.

title: Home from Home
text: Had a great stay here with my family. The rooms have a vintage but slightly modern look about them. We were out exploring New York but the staff here was very helpful in giving us places to visit and very friendly. Looking forward to coming back next year for my niece's graduation. Thank you Iroquois for  the New York experience.

title: The perfect place  to stay in NY
text: Excellent location! The rooms are very nice, and the staff is great! We enjoyed breakfast, and drinks in the evening at the Lantern. Price value is perfect and everybody extremely nice. I was there one whole week with my mum and had a great time.

title: Another great stay at The Iroquois.
text: I have staying at The Iroquois since the 1980's.  No reason to change.  This is a great hotel, in a great neighborhood and close to everything.  Clean and comfy rooms, great vibe, nice lobby.  What more can you ask for?

title: Excellent Location!!!!
text: Location was ideal, you are within walking distance to Broadway shows,  Time Square, shopping but it’s also quiet enough to sleep at night. The complimentary breakfast was good. Hotel staff were really attentive and friendly. The AC wasn’t working properly at first but took care of it quickly. We will definitely be staying here again!!

title: Awful place
text:
Air conditioning was not working room temperature so high it made me very unwell. Five days on still not working so was offered a 50% discount off room rate but that has failed to happen.

Bad bad service and unsafe heat made me ill when I should have been on holiday

title: Poor conditions and response
text:
We arrived at the hotel and were informed that the AC in the room was not operational, and they weren't sure when it would be online. When we got to the room, it was 77 degrees and very stuffy. Fortunately, we were able to open some windows for relief. While we were showering, someone walked into the room, and we had no idea they were there until we heard them talking. They announced that they were there to check the AC, but we were given no prior notice that they were coming. We informed them to come back later but they were already inside the room.
The next morning, while filling the bathtub, the water pressure suddenly dropped and then started spitting out foul water with muddy contents. When I called the front desk, they said they would send an engineer to check. It was close to an hour before anyone came to our room. When I explained the issue, he simply replied that someone must have exercised the main valve causing the contaminants in the line. We checked and found the same conditions were at the sinks and in the shower but eventually ran clear after about 5 minutes. 
When we went down for breakfast, we found a very limited menu of pre-prepared food and an overcrowded dining area with no open seats. The food was something you would find in a Best Western or similar motel.
When we were checking out, the front desk staff just said sorry and offered no other compensation for our troubles. 
We also notice that the door was left unmanned and the employee who seemed to be responsible for the door was hanging out by the front desk not offering to help with bags or anything of the sort.
Our overall experience was poor at best and not a good value for the price. The ratings on Booking.com were certainly misleading and we would recommend that anyone considering this establishment think twice before booking.

title: En stor besvikelse
text:
Med högt ställda förväntningar checkar vi in på ett hotel som skall vara medlem i ”small luxury hotels”. Hotellet har ett utmärkt läge, en uppmärksam personal som är tillmötesgående och hjälpsamma vid incheckning. Dock borde jag redan anat ugglor i mossen då receptionen är sliten, baren minimal och det följs upp av att rummen är små och helt utan utsikt. Under vistelsen å, 3 nätter fungerar inte a/c.n - man skyller på att hela systemet byggts om, frukosten är en katastrofal med oengagerad personal och minibaren är så dyr att man tror man köper hotellet om man tar ngt och ett extremt långsamt wifi. Det ingår inte ens ett par vattenflaskor som är standard på de bättre hotell jag bor på i Europa. 

Small Luxury Hotels bör fundera på vilka hotel som skall vara medlemmar- har svårt att förstå alla positiva betyg.

Boka hellre på nyare hotel i närheten med utsikt och ta frukosten på stan. Kommer inte att återkomma.

title: Broken HVAC and inedible breakfast
text: I have stayes at the Iroquois several times in the past but the last time was pre-COVID. The location is great for my business as well as personal travel for theater. The restaurant used to have a well-prepared boutique Italian menu many years ago, but now functions as a bar in the evening and a place to get an inedible breakfast sandwich or yogurt in the morning. The rooms are quirky but nicely appointed and spacious enough. The staff is well-trained and welcoming. But the infrastruture has not kept up with appearance. Two antique elevators service all the floors and when there is a rush in the morning or evening, one can wait a long time to get to the room or out of the building. On this trip NOV 1-2 2022, the HVAC was broken. The room was ~ $600 nd the temperature was 77 degress. Fortunately, the windows on the back of the hotel could be opened to let in the night air, as well as every siren, truck backup signal and other NYC noise the city has to offer. The staff was helpful enough to move me to a "slightly cooler" room -- it was 73 degrees -- but the windows were fixed shut on the front of the building, so it was a hot night, and actually 76 degrees when I woke up. I really like this hotel and the location, but until they spend some money on infrastruture improvements, I'll be trying the other hotels on the same block. (The Sofitel next door has its own problems, but as least one can get a good night's sleep without night sweats.

title: great location and well appointed rooms
text: Great location and well appointed rooms. Recommend higher floors as low floor rooms are dark. Great staff, and Anna in reception was excellent. Doormen were very helpful also. Desk area and bed were great. No restaurant at the hotel, but good options near by. No room service, which was missed.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Bon hôtel, idéalement situé et personnel très agréable. Petit déjeuner est un gros  plus ! Chambres propres. Petit bémol sur la climatisation un peu bruyante si vous êtes situé sur l'arrière de l'hôtel. Je recommande tout de même pour les couples. L'emplacement est vraiment idéal.

title: Great location but the rest
text: Breakfast a joke, very small rooms totally without a view, A/C that did not work properly, very slow wifi. Need a facelift to compete with other hotels around time square. On the plus side - helpful staff in and around the reception.

title: Excellent service
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location for sightseeing in New York. Close to all the new York City attractions and Bryant Park which had set up its Christmas Market and Ice rink. Room was very clean. There was a problem with the air con which meant leaving the window open at night which was a bit noisy. Didn't take away from the experience too much

title: October 29, 2022
text: The hotel is situated nicely on 44th street close to all things within the theater district.  The staff is very welcoming for a boutique hotel.  We have stayed her many times.  The lobby has a nice sitting room with the New York Times for a leisurely read.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Wanted to stay in something charming an off the beaten path. The staff were so friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and comfortable! Lovely grab and go or sit and enjoy complimentary breakfast was healthy and delicious. The location couldn’t have been any better to be near all of the activities we had planned.

title: We were expecting much more about this hotel
text: We were expecting much more about this hotel. The breakfast was really bad to be a 4-5 star hotel with no fruits, no bread, only eggs burgers. The room and the bathroom were so small. But it's a clean hotel with a good location.

title: Iroquois Hotel stay
text: The hotel has an excellent location a few blocks from Times Square and also close to my meetings on 5th Ave. However, the room, as expected, was tiny. We were put right across from the elevator so we heard the bell quite often. The view was of a wall. We had problems with the air conditioning that took three visits to resolve. Staff were, for the most part, very helpful and friendly. We were given water on our return each time we were out. They had oranges at the desk.

title: Iroquois excellent
text: Excellent all, the room, cleanliness, value, location, sleep quality and the bed. All good. Near time square and metro station and bus. Breakfast is small but delicious. The personal is professional. Thanks

title: Perfect for larger families
text: We traveled as a family of 7 and loved the 3-bedroom suite offered by the Iroquois. Easy access to all of the main attractions and subway stops, and far enough removed from Times Square that it was quieter. The hotel was perfect for our group and we look forward to returning.

title: Wonderful, small hotel
text: A welcoming retreat in midtown; well run with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are clean and well appointed....warning to those early riser coffee addicts like myself....no coffee machine in the room but breakfast does open at 7 AM.  I will definitely return to The Iroquois when I am in NY

title: New York
text: the view from the room was non existent.  the window opened onto a dark and unwelcoming internal cortike. Maybe higher floors are better, I don't know!  Expensive and poorly presented breakfast.  Little supplied.

title: Love the iroquois
text:
The Iroquois is a fabulous boutique hotel with an amazing location!!!
The service is exceptional and the staff is so friendly and helpful!!!
Could not ask for a better or cleaner place to stay.
I do find the street noise quite loud however, so if you are a light sleeper, it is a little challenging.  However, the beds and pillows are comfortable, and so many aspects of the hotel are exceptional, so I will stay there again.

title: Bruyant mais literie confortable.
text: Petit déjeuner à fuire. Chambre bruyante avec la soufflerie à côté. Literie confortable et hotel bien situé. Je n’y retournerai pas même si le personnel a été très gentil et serviable pour nos demandes.

title: Leisure
text:
Excellent hôtel, très propre, très bonne situation et très accueillant.
Il faudrait remplacer les verres en plastic dans les chambres par du verre. En plus d'être plus écologique, cela respecterait les quatre étoiles attribuées à cet hôtel. Enfin, une cafetière dans la chambre serait grandement appréciée.

title: Not as good as expected
text: The Iroquis is conveniently located, clean and modern for sure, and has a friendly staff, too. However, the hotel didn’t meet our expectations as a comfy resting place after hectic days in the city, especially being - at least for us Scandinavians - very pricy, and for us personally, the destination for a long foreseen 25th wedding anniversary trip. Our Superior Room turned out to be minute, murky and dark, windows facing a wall without a glimpse of the sky. The  bathroom was diminutive too, fitting one person. Not much street noice was heard but instead a very noisy ventilation, the fan had to be turned off not to disturb sleep. Non-functioning heated floor in bathroom. Breakfast to-go wrapped in plastics, breakfast room lacking windows. Internet connection much slower than Starbucks’. Not that this is a bad hotel, but, in summary, we would have chosen another accommodation for our anniversary vacation trip.

title: Great location for access to Broadway
text: We enjoyed our stay.  One of our major plans was to watch Broadway shows, and this location gave us easy walking access to the shows, as well as plenty of dining, shopping, and sightseeing options.  Service and cleanliness were superb.  I would not hesitate to stay again.

title: Need better pillows to make 5 stars
text:
The pillows look nice, but when you sleep in them, they offer no support, which gave me neck pains. I did not sleep well there.
Staff were super nice and helpful. They even helped print out meeting documents. Location is very good.

title: Clean and comfortable. Great staff.
text: Room was excellent and typical small NYC rooms.  Clean and comfortable.  Just missing any business related accomodations like meeting spaces. The bar was cozy, inviting, and prices were very reasonable.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Mid-Town Manhattan
text: The Iroquois is our go-to hotel when we are in NYC.  The location is perfect for theaters and dining and the room rates are reasonable given the location and amenities.  It is a small boutique hotel with friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful staff.  The King room is fairly large for the city.  The Queen room is small but adequate for 2 people. The hotel is clean, well maintained, and very well-appointed (Frette bedding and bathrobes!).  The grab and go breakfast including coffee and juice was delicious with several options and was included with our room.  The two staff members attending the breakfast were so helpful and genuinely concerned that we got what we wanted given we were a few minutes late.  Also, we didn’t realize hailing a cab at the time we needed one was nearly impossible, and the young man at reception worked diligently in the rain to secure one for us.  All hotels in this area are pricey (New York sales, hotel, and occupancy taxes can raise the rate up to 25%, but that’s the same for all hotels) depending on the time of year, but this hotel distinguishes itself with exceptional customer service and incredibly friendly and helpful staff.

title: very disppointing - should not even deserve 2 stars
text:
disappointing on all services:
- breakfast: no hot chocolate, not enough pastries for clients even when reserved/paid in advance, personnel was annoyed to be disturbed from their telephone
- services: no sleepers
- front desk: personnel annoyed by questions (except morning shift)
- shower: cold water with little flow

title: Nice find!
text: 1st time staying at this hotel & it was very nice.  Great location on West 44th street, expensive...but you pay a lot in tax and fees in NYC.  I would recommend this hotel & also included in the price is a breakfast!

title: First time in NY
text: This was our first trip to NY and I did a lot of research on where to stay. This hotel is the perfect location, the staff is friendly and helpful. It is walking distance to Times Square but far enough away from the crowds, noise and craziness. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone. There are some great restaurants within walking distance and the theatre district is about a 10 minute walk. Very convenient.

title: False advertisement
text: Expedia’s website said breakfast was included, but we were charged a $27 facility fee. The facility fee was for breakfast and gym we were told upon checking out. We had never intended to use the gym and the preset breakfast became boring after the 2nd morning. The room which we were told was an upgrade was dark and drab with a view of the fire escape. But the staff was very friendly, the place clean and great location.

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
text: We have stayed in the Iroquois on numerous occasions.  We love the location in mid-town; close enough to Times Square, but on a relatively quiet street without the traffic noise.  It is close to subway stops, so you can do the subway thing to get where you want to go quickly.  Also is nice walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and theaters.  It is a small hotel, so you don't get all the hustle and bustle of the larger hotels, but does not have a lot of their amenities either.  It is quiet, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff friendly and welcoming.  Rooms are not large, so we typically go for the larger king rooms.  The queen rooms are small, but comfortable.

title: Review
text: The staff were Friendly and helpful.  The Grab and Go breakfast was great with enough healthy choices. Especially Loved the Frette bed Linens.  We don't normally stay at the Iroquois when we are in NY but we will definitely stay at the Iroquois again as it was a very positive experience.

title: BEST Hotel Stay!
text: A MUST for any NYC visitor seeking a QUALITY accommodation experience! Everything from last minute booking, to greeting at the door, to watching the staff respond professionally to other guests- Iroquois is TOP NOTCH!

title: Great service, quiet room
text:
Great location, good room size and very quiet, we slept great. Staff helpful and friendly.
Breakfast free and simple but good, bacon, egg and cheese on a roll was great.
Starbucks a block away as the coffee is really poor.

title: A VERY GOOD HOTEL
text: A very nice hotel, with very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are very quiet and spotless. The gym is small but adequate, breakfast was good I liked the fact you can grab a takeaway breakfast that included bacon and egg rolls. We were upgraded on arrival without asking buy a very friendly young man at reception. The hotel is close to Times Square and all attractions and is in a very safe area. We would stay again.

title: Great Rooms and Great Location
text: Our first visit to NYC in 18 years -- post covid -- didn't really know what to expect. This hotel was recommended to us by a friend who comes to NYC every 6 weeks and it was a great recommendation. Anna, Charlie and all the front desk staff are professional, knowledgeable and so helpful. The rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable and the bathroom had enough room for all our lotions and potions needed when you get our age. Location was great -- easy cab rides uptown and to lower Manhattan -- an easy walk to all of mid-town.

the room it is very quiet,  without noise, silent air conditioner.
Linens, Frette, excellent
the Cleaning is very careful, since they   ketp one of mi headphones.
the breakfast  is convenient.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Très bon hôtel, emplacement idéal au cœur de Manhattan. Chambre assez grande (19m2 ) + placard, nécessaire de repassage, bureau, SDB fonctionnelle. L'ensemble très propre. Literie extra ! Personnel très disponible. Petit déjeuner bien,  même si le choix est un peu restreint. 
Je recommande vivement 👍

title: Dr Louis and Sue Reardon
text: Excellent accommodations!  Always clean, always everything that we need.  The staff is so pleasant and ready to do anything that they can to be helpful!!  We will certainly be back on our next trip to New York!  We love that it is a smaller hotel-not a big chain and the location is the best for us!!

title: Wonderful weekend.
text: The Iroquois in New York is a fabulous boutique hotel. The staff is wonderful and the rooms were clean and charming. The location was perfect, close to Times Square with several good restaurants within a short walking distance. I’m looking forward to returning.

title: GREAT centrally located hotel
text: Pricing reasonable for location. Location fantastic for theatre-based visits and centrally located for any activities in Manhattan. Excellent parking facility just across the street; I was astonished by how easy the arrival and exit by car was. Our suite was beautifully appointed with a very comfortable bed. Very friendly staff made us feel welcome and valued. Only downside is that WIFI/Internet was quite erratic -- strong in the wee hours, but became slow/unreliable during the day, presumably as a function of increased usage. I hope they address this; if we'd been there for work, might have been an issue. They only serve breakfast, but the Algonquin next door has a great, well known bar and you're a 3-minute walk from Times Square. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Sejour au coeur de Manhattan
text:
Nous avons sejourné dans cet hotel deux semaines au mois d aout et comme notre premiere fois il y a quatre ans, le sejour fut tres agreable.
Les chambres sont propres et la literie confortable. La salle de bains est impeccable et bien equipée.
Le petit dejeuner du matin se compose de profuits frais (jus d orange et yaourt avec fruits et granola, des sandwichs salés chauds sont egalement disponbiles).
La situation de l hotel proche des transports (plusieurs lignes de metro et de bus) et de Bryant Park (avec une vue imprenable sur l Empire State Building)  est tout simplement  idéale et permet de visiter le coeur de Manhattan meme a pied car il est proche de Times Square, Rockfeller Center ou encore Central Park.
Enfin le personnel est tres accueillant, souriant, aimable et disponible. 
En bref, nous avons passé un excellent sejour!

title: attractive hotel in midtown Manhattan
text: the hotel location is in a safe area,  close to all the main attractions,  the staff are very friendly,  kind  and does all they can to make you feel comfortable,  the room although it's size is well equipped,  very clean, unlike other hotels we got late  check-out without changing, take care that like all the hotels in New York the price does not enclud significant amount of tax!

title: Fabulous experience!
text:
We decided to stay in the Times Square area because my husband had a knee injury and we wanted to go to Broadway plays without walking a lot. This boutique hotel had the best front desk staff! They refroze my husbands ice packs several times a day
in the most cheerful and helpful way! Over our four nights we felt pampered and
very welcome. The breakfast every morning was way undervalued in the write-up....
it was very good and fresh, with wonderful staff there to offer help.

title: Excellent.
text: Everything was terrific. Minor complaint wifi so so. All else great. Location. Safety. Love having safe in the room. Protected our luggage while we are at the ball game before we went home. Great little hotel.

title: Top quality. Beautiful suites. Amazing staff.
text: Flawless stay with efficient pre check in. The suites are clean, beautiful and bed was comfortable. The staff were so kind, professional and accommodating. The grab and go breakfast was sufficient to start the day. The orange juice was fresh. The location is perfect. Would most definitely stay here again!

title: Our adventure in Manhattan New York
text: Excellent location, close to many attractions. Walking distance to Times Square with a variety of different eating establishments to choose from. Part of our fee included a small breakfast but it was enough to help start the day. Clean facilities and the staff were extremely helpful.

title: Double WOOT!
text:
Staff is bend over backwards helpful and courteous. My room faced the street (perfect for daydreaming while not out on the town) and was spacious while housekeeping was at the ready to tidy it up once I'd leave to start my day.
In the heart of mid-town so subways, taxis and ferry's are easy. Plenty of sights, bars, restaurants and theaters in walking distance.

title: Great value and location
text: For the value and location this option was great. It’s set back just enough from Times Square that you don’t get a lot of the noise but close enough to enjoy walk to a show and into the heart of Times Square. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. We will revisit here again.

title: This is a great theatre hotel
text: Lovely boutique hotel around the corner from theaters in NYC. not elegant , but nice. Rooms were not large ,but clean and nicely decorated . Lobby was small but lovely. A nice included breakfast for those on the run. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful as we felt right at home. Reasonable price for NYC.  Definitely to be used again when at theatre . A great find felt by the 4 of us

title: Excellent hotel with close proximity to Times Square
text: Stayed here for a business event and couldn't be happier with the experience. The room was clean, breakfast was fantastic and the staff were all extremely helpful. You can't beat the location! Definitely a fantastic experience all the way around.

title: Very meh for the cost.
text: Check in was on his phone while we stood there for minutes. Room had no ac. Bed had no fitted sheet so we had to sleep on top of the comforter all night. Rooms were not available until an hour and a half past check in time.

title: Small and inconvenient
text: The hotel was nice, but the room was small and needed a comfortable chair to sit on instead of the bed.  the room was clean, bed comfortable and the bathroom was clean and pleasant.  They advertised “Parking Available”, but we had to park in a garage around the corner.  There is no valet service and it was inconvenient.

title: Great Adventure in Manhattan starts HERE!
text: What a beautiful room and central location. But the staff, particularly Charlie the manager, took such great care of us! Breakfast was terrific as well. We could not have enjoyed a hotel more! We will return to this exquisite and welcoming location!

title: An excellent hotel close to Times Square
text:
The Iroquois is an excellent boutique hotel in the middle of Manhattan. It's minutes from the theater district and Times Square. The room was stylish and spotlessly clean. Every single member of the staff I met was polite, helpful and friendly; they really added to the whole experience. There is a nice bar where you can get a craft cocktail and relax. The kitchen was closed when we stayed there, but they did a nice continental breakfast which was fresh and delicious. There is no on-site parking, but there is a parking deck literally across the street. I valeted my car there for $55 a day, and it was fine.

Highly recommended.

title: Great location and pleasant staff
text: Great for trip to Broadway. Rooms quiet and comfortable. Stately large bathroom. Included breakfast a nice touch and tasty even if picking it up a bit if a scrum. Friendly accommodating front desk staff. Overall would stay again and rate it highly among many similar class NY hotels we’ve stayed in.

title: Reliable and comfortable midtown refuge
text:
We stayed two and a half weeks at The Iroquois, and enjoyed every minute.
We were fortunate to be allotted a huge room overlooking West 44th Street. (This hotel has a variety of rooms, some larger, some smaller.) With the exception of the occasional siren on a passing fire engine, the room was exceptionally quiet, and the beds comfortable.
Our room had a walk-in closet as well as ample storage space. The bathroom was, by New York hotel standards, roomy. The room, as were all the public areas we saw, was very clean and well-maintained.
An added benefit is the free Grab-and-Go breakfast (orange juice, orange, coffee / tea and a choice from among a yogurt and two different egg buns).  
There is a small but adequately fitted 24-hour gym on the third floor.
The second-best feature of the hotel is its midtown location, with several subway lines within a few minutes' walk. Times Square is five minutes' walk away, and yet this section of West 44th Street is relatively quiet.
A diner is located 50 yards away, and several delis are one or two blocks away.
The best feature, however, is the staff: unfailingly courteous, solicitous and helpful.
Highly recommended.

title: Fantastic boutique hotel in midtown!
text: This hotel was perfect for our family visit. We had a 3-bedroom suite, the rooms were spacious & clean. The staff is helpful and very friendly, regularly greeted us, and asked about our stay and if we needed anything. The location near Times Square and Broadway was convenient and what the family wanted to experience. It’s a renovated older building ongoing construction and maintenance so we experienced a few building/utilities issues, but the staff was communicative and worked to restore them ASAP.

title: My stay at The Iroquois NY
text: The location was very good. also the service was very good and the people working at the hotel very kind and helpful when needed. Rooms were clean and in general we had a very pleasent stay and I recommend the hotel.

title: A true gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Iroquois.  Fantastic staff, great room, and the location can't be beat.  5 minute walk to subway station (several lines) and 7 minute walk to Times Square.  Room was small, as expected in NYC, but full of character.  Beds exceptionally comfortable.  Breakfast in the morning was much appreciated.  This hotel embodies all of the charm of 1940's NYC, from the light fixtures to the mosaic floors.  You can imagine you walked into a black and white film and would not be surprised to see a man in a fedora or a woman in an evening dress hanging out in the lobby.

title: NYC hotel
text: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, the grab and go breakfast worked prefectly for me, I used the coffee shop across the road too.. Great room (King) my bed was very comformable. The internet was very reliable for workng and video calls.

title: Perfect location, good room, helpful front desk staff
text: You can’t beat the location. The room was very comfortable. The linens were good, the bed comfortable, and the front desk staff were fantastic. The grab and go breakfast was OK and there were a few options. The hours that it was available were quite long compared to other hotels. Drinks at the bar were very expensive but hey, it’s New York! Food options were limited as were the hours in the night time. But I would definitely choose to stay here again.

title: A week in New York
text: Great location! Clean and comfortable room. Dining area is small and windowless. Breakfast choices are somewhat limited, but adequate, and the coffee was decent. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly and professional. Two elevators so some waiting at busy times. Choose a lower floor so you can take the stairs as an option.

title: Great Midtown stay!
text: We had a group of six stay at Iroquois for a work event. The staff was superb, so helpful and kind as we schlepped in supplies for the event. Charming lobby, nice rooms, prime location and a great stay overall.

title: Great location, friendly staff!
text: This hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan, walking distance from the Time Square and 5th Avenue. Our room was relatively small but clean. The staff, except for those in breakfast area, are super friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not impressive at all; natural orange juice, coffee, and sandwiches.

title: Great Hotel - Restaurant Needed
text: The hotel is absolutely fantastic.  The staff are great, kind, and helpful.  Expect the rooms to be smaller is it is NYC, if you need the space, do what we do and get the 2-Room Executive Suite.  Everything is great, except the lack of food.  There is no restaurant and the breakfast they do serve is rather atrocious.  BUT, the hotel is really still worth it, and great location.  I did have to go across the street to get decaf coffee for mom and pastries, bit of a bummer.  And the lack of food when I arrived at 9am in the Lantern's Keep Bar, i.e. nothing was there, not a great impression.  When Triumph was there, it was a top notch hotel.  I hope a restaurant returns, they are certainly missing out on business, especially a good breakfast.

title: Great hotel but be aware they charge a substantial  daily "facility fee"
text: Liked the hotel--lovely small bar, nice breakfast included. Room clean though small. Big surprise was the almost $30/day "Facility fee" which also had a "facility fee sales tax' and 'facility fee city tax'.  None of this was disclosed anywhere when we booked. Would probably stay here again but wish I had known that my $360 per night room rate would net out at $445.29 with all the fees and taxes.

title: Great customer service and clean rooms!
text: Had an amazing stay here. It was a nice location that was easily accessible to subways. All the staff were very warm and friendly. I would definitely recommend staying here again. The rooms were also very clean and the beds very comfortable.

title: Disappointing room, good location for Times Square
text: We stayed at the Iroquois before but found our room this time to be disappointing. (We stayed in a Deluxe room, so not the best, but not the worst either.) The bathroom in particular was long and thin and I don't know that an obese person could have fit comfortably in the shower.  (This is despite the fact that their website says a Deluxe room "includes an oversized wall-to-wall marble bath." You would have needed to be a Lilliputian from Guillver's Travels to consider the bath oversized.) The bed was comfortable and our room, in the back of the hotel and away from the elevators, was very quiet, which was appreciated. They take your towels away at each cleaning (there is no option to keep them to help conserve water). It is a relatively affordable choice if you want to stay in Midtown. It is near Times Square and Grand Central but off the main drag.  The staff is very pleasant and helpful.

title: Thank you
text:
Damian at the front desk is very pleasant . 
This boutique hotel is charming and steps away from Bryant park and Whole Foods. 
Staff is pleasant / no attitudes. 
Had a pleasure of meeting Damian during check out .

title: Lovely Hotel in a Great Location
text: Loved our weekend stay at the Iroquois.  The hotel is located steps away from Times Square and Broadway.  Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms are quite small, as is typical for big city older hotels (and our view was of a brick wall) but the room was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean.  My only 'small' complaint was that the "grab and go" breakfast was very limited, and when I wanted a croissant to go with my oatmeal, I was told that I would have to pay extra for it as I was only entitled to ONE option.  In spite of that, I will absolutely be back!

title: central location - too expensive
text: hotel is located nicely close to times square. Stuff is friendly, but the hotel itself needs some refurbishment. Breakfast was very disappointing (quality, too many packed items). but too expensive for the value.

title: First-rate accommodations
text: The Iroquois is a gem, located near the theater district, the New York Public Library, the Morgan Library and Museum, MOMA, and great shopping and dining. Every aspect of our stay was lovely: the well-appointed, immaculate room; friendly and helpful staff; and tasty breakfast.

title: cute hotel
text: clean, great location. terrible grab and go breakfast.  You can only have 1 item then must pay for rest. So dont grab a greek yoghurt (which was terrible) AND a pastry..they will charge you.  For nearly $400/night, that was a ripoff.  Room had NO view just a brink wall...Was  not informed until I got to room which was too late.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: This was my first time at the Iroquois and it was a great stay. I stayed in the executive suite and it was so spacious for an NYC hotel. What gave it the finishing touch was how clean it was. Housekeeping did a wonderful job in servicing the rooms. The location was super convenient, walking distance to Bryant Park, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and the Theater District. We also had a great time at the hotel bar, Lantern’s Keep. Awesome drinks and great food, must order the Devils on horseback! The front desk staff was amazing. They were so attentive and kind.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy a great time in the city.

title: Amazing hotel in great location
text: My stay at the Iroquois was amazing to say the least! I’ve stayed in NYC at other hotels, and I would have to say that this is one of the best hotels in midtown. They are so close to the Broadway shows as well as Central Park and Bryant Park. Hells Kitchen is also about a few min walk so we enjoyed some great food. The breakfast at the hotel was very tasty too! The parking garage being right across the street is very convenient. The staff was great. All members of the hotel were very helpful and nice. I will be back in a few months as I stay in the city for work. Thank you Iroquois Hotel for providing such exceptional service and an amazing room!

title: Perfect Mid City Location
text: The location and fantastic staff made our trip.  We stayed in the 2-bedroom executive suite and it was perfect! The rooms were roomier than expected (for a stay in NY).  It was super easy to get around the city.  Great walking distance for many attractions.

title: Good experience overall
text: This was our first time staying here. It was a nice hotel in a good midtown locationlocation. The people at the desk are great the people at the door are great the people at the food service are a bunch of Incompetent jerks. Yes, that really needs work. Highly recommend getting the suite on the front. The higher up you are, the better. It has excellent Light control so you get very good sleep. Beds are supremely comfortable and I do recommend this place. For the money it’s hard to beat in NYC. Of course NYC is one of the most expensive places in the world. So expect sticker shock everywhere you go.

title: Lovely boutique in excellent location
text: We have stayed at multiple properties on W 44th, and The Iroquois is the best. The lobby, cafe, and rooms are clean.  Immaculate really.  The rooms are stylish, classy, yet and well kept.  The beds are very comfortable and the HVAC runs quiet and smooth. The rooms are perfect for sleeping.  We heard nothing from the hallways or streets during our stay.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The bar/cafe includes a quick breakfast.  Although I prefer a sit down, made to order experience, this is the best COVID era grab and go experience I have had yet.  Overall, The Iroquois is just a great value. It is a perfectly curated boutique experience at a reasonable rate you will appreciate.

title: A true gem
text:
The staff goes above and beyond, the location makes it walkable, the rooms are comfortable and impressively clean. 
Although complimentary breakfast is included, don't expect a full buffet, it's one item, coffee and fruit to go. However, this is perfectly convenient if like us you want to grab something and go wondering in the street. 
If we're lucky enough to go back to New York, we will stay there without the shadow of a doubt.

title: The breakfast wasn’t good. Not many options to pick.
text: The hotel has a great location, good service in general but the breakfast has to be improve in my opinion, it was very poor. The rooms was cleaned and the bathroom too! The price I paid was expensive in compare with other hotels.

title: Comfortable and personal - counter corporate
text:
Very convenient location. 
A relaxed, comfortable guest centered hotel. 
Staff very accommodating and prescient.
Especially hotel manager Kelli and front office manager Charlie professional and above bar courteous 
Most rooms quiet away from street.
Housekeeping thorough and clean

title: Location Location Location
text: This is my go to hotel while in New York.  The location in the middle of the theater disctrict is perfect. and the hotel staff is charming and helpful.  The rooms are spotlessly clean and well appointed.

title: Welcoming and Professional
text: The Iroquois Hotel employees answer the telephone and are very helpful in making arrangements.  Requests for allergy free and quiet room were seamlessly provided.  Appreciated the offer of the hotel to stow luggage until check in time.  Looking forward to staying at the Iroquois again.

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel - shame about the incorrect billing and lack of communication post stay.
text:
After 4 previous stays at The Iroquois with my sister, I returned to NYC with my husband in March 2022. There was no doubt where we would choose to stay.
The only small inconvenience whilst there was the lack of WiFi for around 24hrs, which resulted us being delayed in completing our passenger locator forms and checking in with our airline. Upon checkout the reception staff offered to waive our resort fee of $28.69 for the inconvenience.
HOWEVER when our credit card bill arrived a couple of weeks later a charge of $229.42 had been taken. Upon closer inspection of our receipt we’d been charged $70 & $88, plus associated taxes for the mini bar. We had NOT consumed any items, but made space for a few personal items - will anything removed being replaced before checkout.
I’ve written 3 emails to the Triumph Group tried to contact The Iroquois via social media & Expedia and have had absolutely NO response.
Please can a member of hotel management contact me to discuss and rectify.

title: Great choice for Midtown
text: We’re just going to quote one of the other reviewers (Craig 215 from Pennsylvania) : “Proves to me why small hotels fit my needs better than large ones. I had a great experience overall. No complaints other than facing a window well -- but that made for a really good night's sleep, so I guess it's a fair tradeoff. Felt like good value for the money. Staff were very helpful and responsive.”  We should also mention that we really liked the “grab & go” breakfasts. Midtown location is excellent. The only downer, if true, is that this might be a Trump property.  But for that, we’d be happy to stay here again.

title: Flawless Stay!
text: My husband and I returned to NYC and the Iroquois after a long break visiting the city due to the Pandemic.  We have stayed at the Iroquois previous and were reminded what great place the Iroquois was. From Location to staff and the comfort of our room we were very happy to return!

title: Friendly staff and great location
text: Great hotel in a fantastic hotel. Had I known it was a Trump hotel I wouldn't have booked however I'm glad I did. Nice small rooms with everything you need. There is a "to go" breakfast but I'd have preferred a coffee maker in the room. The staff were brilliant and in particular Ivan, the bartender and the super helpful janitor.  The ladies and doorman were great too. The location is perfect just a 5 min walk to Times Square . There is a great Diner next door but one and does a great breakfast. The onsite bar is great and cosy. We'd stay again and recommend too.

title: Great location and boutique hotel with multiple rooms for families
text: After having received a tip from a friend for this hotel for Spring Break family trip two years ago, we finally got to go after Covid postponement.  We chose this hotel for its suite and two adjoining bedrooms and location.  I'd consider it a luxury boutique hotel but maybe not 5-star quality and cost.  It's fairly roomy, especially for NY.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Only would criticize that the furniture, bed, and bathrooms are looking a bit worn with some stains.  Drinks at hotel bar are pricey (aren't they always?) and breakfast was just ok and limited.  Cleaning staff was routinely great (rare these days).  Would recommend but wish it sparkled a bit more.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: I stayed in one of the larger suites with family.  The service was superior.  The suite was quiet and very well appointed.  Beds very comfortable.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.  We were there for several nights and could not have asked for a better experience.  Good location to Central Park, Theatre District but was a nice quiet place to return to each day.  We will be back!!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: The Iroquois is one of our favorite hotels in New York City. The staff is always top notch from the doorman to the front desk. The location is perfect for walking to restaurants, bars, shopping and shows. The rooms are nicely appointed with comfortable beds and quiet. I highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Wanted to love it, but it's seen better days
text:
I booked the Iroquois based on the glowing reviews on this site. And after my stay, I'm not quite sure what hotel those folks stayed in! While my stay was fine, it should have been better in many regards, especially for a property that advertises itself as a "luxury hotel" and charges as much as it does.

For one, it's one of those places that seemed to cut a bunch of amenities "for Covid" and yet has not brought them back despite mandates and such ending. Turndown service is advertised; it's not offered. Room service is advertised; it's not offered. The free breakfast in the morning is really embarrassing – disgusting microwaved egg sandwiches, lukewarm cheap coffee, and oranges that were way past their expiration date.

The room itself was fine. Nicely decorated. Cleaned decently, with some dust along the walls. Tight is of course standard for New York, but I expected a little more space given the price and SLH billing. An old fashioned TV and a shower with a busted handheld attachment that sprayed water in every direction.

The service was fine. Not particularly courteous or anticipatory. I was initially given a room different from what I reserved without any mention of it, without an explanation or apology.

The decoration throughout the hotel is nice, but then there are like, printed out paper signs in Times New Roman every so often. It's that kind of place, you know? You get the sense it was a tighter ship until a recent manager, perhaps.

At checkout, I happened to touch the big, pretty plant next to the front desk and noticed that it was made of plastic. It felt like a fitting conclusion to my stay.

title: Do not miss this luxury boutique hotel in the heart of midtown!
text: This is my second time staying at the Iroquois. It is in the heart of the activity that I need: close to office, great shopping, phenomenal restaurants, and Broadway, The rooms are a good size and they have a lot of touches to make your stay comfortable: quality bedding, robe & slippers, heated bathroom floors, and nice rain head and handheld shower treatment  The staff are friendly and kind. They greet you throughout the day and ensure you leave for the morning with a pack & go breakfast. Staff are also efficient in responding to requests (e.g., blanket, water temperature). I look forward to my next stay at the Iroquois!

title: A gem of a hotel
text: The Iroquois Hotel, situated in a perfect midtown location (walking distance to all of our destinations), was a great choice.  The room, lobby area, bar, etc. were all meticulously taken care of and the entire staff was very professional and friendly.

title: Wonderful
text: We love staying at the Iroquois. The suite is spacious, and the single room is lovely. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly, helping us with every facet of our trip.  The location is unbeatable. We’ll be back.

title: Great in many ways
text: It's been about a decade since I lasted visited the Iroquois Hotel and was happy that it is as great as I remember it..  Location is perfect.  Room is really nice with an Art Deco look.  Staff are very friendly, happy, and helpful. The only name I got was Damian but they are all nice.  The room is a very good size for NYC.  They have an excellent in-hotel gym with a Peloton bike, free weights, elliptical, and mats.  There is also a shower/bathroom in the gym which is convenient.  The grab 'n go breakfast was very good with decent options and very sufficient.  I've stayed in a few a few hotels since the start of Covid, and the Iroquois definitely had the best breakfast.  It is good value for money.

title: Nice quiet place to stay near Times Square
text: Proves to me why small hotels fit my needs better than large ones. I had a great experience overall. No complaints other than facing a window well -- but that made for a really good night's sleep, so I guess it's a fair tradeoff. Felt like good value for the money. Staff were very helpful and responsive.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: We were treated great on our stay to this cute boutique hotel that has some great modernization to it as well.   It was in a great location but yet was still quiet at night.   The staff definitely made the hotel as they were always offering to help and you could tell they were genuinely friendly and wanting to help.

title: Best stay in Midtown Manhattan.
text: What an incredible stay.  We were visiting for a week for business and pleasure.  The Iroquois exceeded every expectation.  Perfect location, just a few minutes from multiple dining and entertainment options.

title: Excelente relación precio-calidad
text: Mi familia y yo nos alojamos por 10 noches para las fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo en la Suite de 3 dormitorios. Está decorada con muy buen gusto, la limpieza fue óptima y nos resultó super cómodo tener un sector con sillones y escritorio. Nos atendieron con esmero y dedicación. Nos sentimos en casa. Sin duda, volveremos. Ojalá pronto puedan reabrir el restaurante. Poder desayunar en el hotel y disponer de room service fue lo único que nos faltó para una estadía perfecta.

title: A real gem centrally located.
text: Greeted with a smile am and pm, friendly efficient service. Delicious grab and go breakfast- Yogurt and fresh fruit. Tasty coffee. Rooms quiet and clean with comfortable beds to sink into, light marbled bathroom with Bigelow supplies.

title: Sweet home in the heart of Manhattan
text: We really very happy to stay in The Iroquois Hotel in the last tripe to New York. We felt that we are staying in our home in the heart of Manhattan. The location of the hotel just perfect to explore Manhattan. The hotel staff were excellent and they were ready to help in any thing we asked for..

title: I will not be back
text:
The hotel was practically empty - January in Covid time :-(
Shower was very weak.
The bathroom was pretty small and cold (floor heat did t work).
The bathroom door handle fell after the first use.
We asked for a quite room ahead of time and verified again upon check in and we’re told “yes, away from elevator “.
We got a room in the back of the elevator shaft where we heard every one that used it on our floor.
The room was smelly .
The windows have “blinds” which do not block the light completely.
There is a big gap under the door.
No coffee/ tea in the room and before you say COVID, the “mini bar” was fully stock AND more stuff for sale on top (and don’t dare to put anything in the fridge - they’ll charge you $25! In all my extensive travels over the world I never encounter anything like that…).
One day There were drilling (and other) noises from around 8am ( Sounded like work in the hotel) and the next day construction noises that started before 8:00 am.
We were promised free upgrade and drinks every day (by Hotels.com) but we’re offered neither .
And as a farewell, they posted $28+ @ day “resort fee” (for what? Did I miss the pool? The beach?) which they did NOT disclosed upon check-in.
You won’t see us again Iroquois …

title: Fabulous Hotel in Superb Location
text:
Booked The Iroquois for 6 nights in December after doing loads of research for the best place to stay for our special sister’s trip to NYC.
We stayed in two double double rooms - although small they were perfect. Extremely clean. Lovely decor and a fabulous shower.
Grab and go breakfast was a great start to the day - the yoghurt with granola delicious. 

Location was ideal - close to Bryant Park, Grand Central - we managed to walk everywhere but always felt safe in the neighbourhood .

Staff were very friendly and helpful . So nice to be in a smaller boutique hotel rather than a chain. 

Enjoyed our stay so much looking to book again for this December and take my niece so hopefully get to see what one of the larger suites are like.

title: Sehr gutes Stadthotel mit bester Lage
text:
Ich war im Dezember für 4 Nächte im Iroquois. Das Zimmer war zwar eines der kleinsten, das ich bisher in einem New-Yorker-Hotel hatte, aber es war geschmackvoll eingerichtet und sauber. 
Die Angestellten an der Rezeption waren sehr freundlich, ebenso wie die Reinigungskräfte. 
Verbesserungsbedürftig sind wahrscheinlich die beiden Aufzüge, die relativ langsam sind und keinen sehr vertrauenserweckenden Eindruck machen, teilweise muss man auch einige Minuten warten, bis ein Aufzug kommt.
Das große Plus des Hotels ist eindeutig die Lage. Nicht alle Hotels, die mit zentraler Lage in Midtown Manhattan werben, sind es wirklich. Denn wichtig ist, dass man recht mittig bzgl. der Ost-West-Ausrichtung ist, da es ansonsten mit den U-Bahn-Verbindungen schwierig werden kann. Das Iroquois liegt zwischen der 5th und 6th Ave, nur 3 Fußminuten vom Bryant Park entfernt. Das ist nahezu perfekt, denn somit ist man direkt an den wichtigen Subway-Linien B/D/F/M sowie der Querverbindung 7 zu Hudson Yards.

title: Great staff and great location
text:
We stayed 2 weeks at this hotel, 6 people, 3 rooms and the hotel is great. Very good beds, nice rooms, great great location, close to Time Sq but very far at the same time, walking distance from Central Park, close to subway stations.
Special mention to the staff, Carlos, John, Charlie, Savannah, Anthony and everyone whose names I’ve forgotten but all helped to make our stay superb. Thanks to everyone,

title: Outstanding Hospitality and Accommodations
text:
After two years without traveling due to Covid, we returned to the Iroquois for a brief stay. Once again, the Iroquois did not disappoint. The service is extraordinary, the rooms are spotless, health/safety is a priority, and the price beyond reasonable. I cannot emphasize more how each person associated with the Iroquois Hotel is simply NICE! 

The members of the Iroquois "family" go beyond a "cool" politeness and extend a genuine, caring, welcome to their guests. It goes without saying, that a night at the Iroquois will make you feel special and cared for. 

PS: When making our reservation we shared that we had been vaccinated and boosted. Each member of the Iroquois was wearing a mask that covered their mouth and nose.

title: Historic charm & excellent staff
text: What a sweet boutique hotel, with modern upgrades while retaining its historic charm. And--as many other reviewers have said--the staff here are absolutely the best! Friendly, helpful beyond the basic expectations, and responsive, they made our experience delightful. I can't even single out anyone by name, because every employee we encountered was like this.

title: Gracious staff, great location
text: Unfortunately another longtime favorite hotel nearby had gone downhill, so I decided to give the Iroquois a try.  Despite the pandemic staffing woes, I had no issues at the Iroquois.  The staff were wonderful, responsive, and as helpful as possible.  The room was very comfortable, reasonably spacious for a Manhattan property, and well appointed, nice bedding and linens, great shower.  It's a very convenient location, close enough to Times Square or Rock Center, but a bit out of the hubbub.  And once again, I can't emphasize how helpful and courteous the staff were.  Would definitely return.

title: Great Mother Daughter Trip to NYC
text: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. Had all we needed. Very comfortable beds, nice bathrooms. Surprisingly quiet area close to all that is going on for Christmas in NYC. It is a little pricy but felt very safe and overall was a very nice hotel.

title: Great people and location.
text: The staff was very friendly and always available to help.  The hotel was the perfect location for us and the price was decent.  We were just there the week of Christmas and were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go.

title: Very helpful staff. Nice and clean
text: Just returned home from a nice stay here. The room was very clean and towels and products are changed every day by housekeeping. The room we stayed in was a twin room, which was spacious for new york. It had enough room to store two suitcases and a closet to hand clothes in. The room provides things such as a safe, iron and hairdryer.  Whilst here we struggled to get a covid test to return back to the uk. The woman at reception was very helpful and had the information to hand of where to go. Breakfast is as stated a grab and go. We had a muffin, orange apple and fruit bar, along with tea and coffee. There are vouchers for the cafe next door two days a week. All in all i would recommend this hotel.  Very central, clean and friendly.

title: Magical City
text:
Myself,  my 2 sisters and 2 friends stayed at the Iroquois New York for 5 nights.  The rooms are lovely with very comfortable beds. There were 4 of us sharing a room with 2 beds so it was a bit snug so I would definitely recommend 2 people per room. The breakfast is "grab and go" which consisted of a bacon/egg/cheese burger 🍔 which basically had been pinged in the microwave. Its not Michelin ⭐ but sets you up for the morning.  You also get a breakfast snack bar and 2 pieces of fruit, coffee ☕ and/or tea 🍵.  Sunday and Monday you get vouchers to use in the diner further down the road.
The hotel is literally 5 mins walk from Times Square and in a very good area. Staff are lovely and very helpful. 
I would highly recommend the Iroquois ⭐

title: Nice location, need a good breakfast restaurant again
text:
Very clean hotel, can be more cosy in the commons 
Restaurant is missing🤞
Rooms in front of street are too noisy 
But overall very clean and well managed hotel
Staff very friendly 
Good for couples more than large family

title: Iroquois
text: Nice hotel with high quality rooms and staff in an excellent location. The small room is tight, worth upgrading if you will spend time in room. The manager went out of her way to make us welcome and identify the room we wanted. Very personal touch with her.

title: Nice Hotel with Great Staff!
text: The room was very comfortable and staff were friendly and very responsive and helpful.  The location is close to restaurants and theaters.  There is a small bar onsite for a quick drink but not a lot of food options.  We would definitely stay at the Iroquois again when we return to NYC.

title: Family trip
text: Weekend trip with Family and Friends.  Our family stayed in a 3 Bedroom suit on the 12 th floor that provided plenty of room to spread out and relax.  Spacious and the rooms were clean and comfortable.  Staff is excellent and locations is ideal.

title: A fabulous hotel in a great location
text: What a gem of a hotel, it’s in a fabulous location in Central Manhattan: 5th Avenue on one side, Broadway and Times Square on the other; the Empire State Building and Grand Central are a short walk away. The room was extremely comfortable and cleaned daily; there were 4 of us in one room, I would recommend 2 in a room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It’s a grab and go breakfast, not great but sets you off for the day and on Sunday’s & Monday’s you are provided with a voucher for a diner close by which was great. There’s a small bar too. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC on a budget, it doesn’t feel like a budget hotel!!

title: Excellent Service
text: Visiting NYC as a tourist can be a challenge but the hotel staff made things easier for us and really added to the pleasantness of our trip.  I would definitely stay here again.  Everything really was perfect, from the comfortable bed and linens to the heated tile floor in the bathroom.

title: Sub Par Hotel
text: We had no hot water the day we arrived. We called the front desk five times to ask for help with the issue and kept being told they would call back. Turns out there was no hot water in the entire hotel. After a long day of travel then exploring in the city we were unable to shower. The next morning we were still unable to shower as the issue was not yet resolved. Additionally, we were in a room with an adjoining door as were kept up the entire first night because you could hear loud screams from next door. Our family staying in another room heard people screaming and fighting their first night and police were called. This left them quite uneasy to see police just outside their hotel room door in the middle of the night. Weird hotel, sub par experience– we booked here because the two groups we were traveling with were staying here but there are way too many great hotel in NY for an experience like this.

title: Awesome place to stay!
text: We had such a wonderful experience at the Iroquois.  We stayed during Thanksgiving week, not realizing that we would be right off of the parade route.  We were able to walk right outside and see much of the parade the morning of Thanksgiving.  The hotel was also centrally located and close to so many sights.  The staff were friendly and so helpful! We would certainly stay here again.

title: 3 star at best
text: There is no restaurant, breakfast ( opens at 7:30 for those who wake early) is a brown bag with an egg mcmuffin the consistency of a old flip flop and a single pot of coffee for all guests to queue up and share. The room has no glasses or kettle, TV remote is broken, the staff are lovely and I feel sorry for them having to make excuses for these things. Great central location and clean which makes up for the tiny room. The rating online says 5 star, the brass plate on show says 4 star, 3 star at best.

title: Hotel amb encant
text:
Era el nostre 10é aniversari, la recepció va tenir un detall molt agradable en tenir-nos una habitació tranquila i amb un ampolla de vi esperant-nos. El tracte de la recepció ha estat fantàstic indicant llocs on sopar, moltes gràcies Damian, Carlos, Charlie… igualment a tot l’equip que han fet la nostra estada de 4 dies extraordinària, després de tant de temps de no poder viatjar.

Localitzacio perfecte en un carrer tranquil entre la 5a i la 6e, rockfeller, grand central i times square a 5 minuts a peu, conexions amb el metro per visitar tota la ciutat. 

Una recomenacio si arribeu o sortiu de Newark, anant a peu la parada de l’aerobus (18.5 dollars) es troba entre la 41st i lexinton, es entre 40/60 minuts de trajecte.

It was our 10th birthday, the reception had a very nice detail as we had a quiet room and a bottle of wine waiting for us. The treatment at the reception was great indicating places to diner, thank you so much Damian, Carlos, Charlie… also to the whole team who made our 4 day stay extraordinary, after so much time not being able to travel.

Perfect location on a quiet street between 5th and 6th, rockfeller, grand central and times square 5 minutes walk, metro connections to visit the whole city.

A recommendation if you arrive or leave from Newark, get the airport express bus.  The stop ($ 18.5) is between 41st and Lexinton, and takes about 40/60 minutes.

title: Wonderful stay and location. From check-in to check-out everything was amazing.
text: My accommodations were just as I booked. Everything was very clean and beautifully decorated. ALL staff members were gracious, helpful, professional, and knowledgeable.  Damian, at the front desk, always was in a great mood and always there to answer any questions that I may have had. If you meet him say hello!!

title: Fantastic stay at The Iroquois
text: Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 4 nights and was blown away at the size, quality and cleanliness of the room.  The location is fantastic for anything you’re doing in midtown - short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Ave Shopping/Central Park, Grand Central, Empire State.  Staff is very attentive and took care of everything we needed promptly and with a smile.  Can’t say enough good things about The Iroquois and highly recommend you stop your search and book here!

title: Wonderful stay and location.
text: Great location. Room very clean. Staff was attentive and helpful. Got early check in and late check out. Included walking tour was great. Will definitely stay at The Iroquois again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Peaceful Gem in the Heart of Chaos
text: The Iroquois is an amazing "boutique" lodging in the heart of the theater district and adjacent to Times Square.  The location is phenomenal, but the real specialness of the Iroquois is how quickly and completely you can leave the street hustle and bustle for quiet, relaxation and superb service.  New York City runs on noise but when you get tired of that, being able to retreat to an absolutely quiet room is a complete pleasure.  Moreover, the room and bathroom were immaculate and the bathroom had a spaciousness and retro vibe that was really great.  And all of that at a really competitive and fair price.  Don't miss staying here -- this is a great spot in a perfect location.

title: Great Quiet Hotel
text: The Iroquois is a small hotel on a quiet street but right in the middle of things.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very comfortable - great beds.  It had a slightly old world atmosphere which was cozy.  I look forward to returning!

title: Excellent Hotel for NY visit
text: Great hotel....good sized rooms, clean, and well maintained.  Centrally located hotel.  Have stayed there several times over the years.  Highly recommend.  Much better than large hotel chains at Times Square.  Great value.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text: We made our first visit to New York City to see our daughter who had recently moved to Manhattan.  This hotel was in a perfect location to explore the area.  The staff was friendly and helped us when we had questions on transportation and other issues.  Our room was clean and we appreciated daily room service.

title: Great Hotel
text: Nestled in the heart of Manhattan, this hotel was centrally located to everywhere I needed/wanted to be on my trip. The staff were so accommodating, and a bar perfect for meeting friends or clients. Highly recommend staying here on your next business trip.

title: Solid Choice for Price
text:
Location is great if you want to be in midtown. We were in town for some Broadway shows so the location fit our needs. 
It's a small property but service was very friendly. Our room was an Iroquois Suite which was a decent size. The bathroom was also spacious and we felt very comfortable for our stay. It looks like it also connects to the room next dor if you need a decently priced 2 bedroom suite in Midtown. 
Breakfast was really a $10 coupon for the diner next door. Food was decent, except on Saturdays when you get a McDonald's style refreshment at the hotel instead of the coupon for next door.
Don't expect luxury, just solid upscale comfort and you won't go wrong.

title: Great place to stay in mid town.
text: Hotel was clean and staff were friendly. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, south side of Central Park and museums. Hotel offers free walking tours. Lots of restaurants of great variety close by.

title: Wonderful European-style hotel in heart of Midtown
text: Small European-style hotel, great value with “stay 5 nights or more” package. Close to all the Broadway shows, easy walk to Central Park and Met, close to good subways.  Due to Covid precautions breakfasts are under-par, delivered in a small bag with inedible fruit and unpalatable yogurt or breakfast sandwich. Friendly staff, small but efficient rooms.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed here 6 nights and really enjoyed it. The location is perfect --it's very quiet but still close to all the mid-town things and an easy walk to Broadway shows. Very clean, and well tended too, with a great day staff (shout out to Damian at the front desk). My housekeeper, Arta, was lovely -- it was my birthday on one of the days I was there and she brought me a new robe. Sweet! The grab and go breakfast and coffee was a nice touch as well. Will definitely return here.

title: A little gem in mid-town Manhattan
text: This is the perfect place to stay if you need to be in mid-town.  Close to Grand Central Station, Times Square and the Broadway plays, and great shopping streets, we found it  easy to catch cabs should we need to venture farther away.  We stayed on the 12th floor and between being high up and the double-paned windows, the typical City noise was not a problem.  Our 'suite' was comfortable.  The staff were accommodating, and the little bar at the back of the lobby was a great way to end  an evening out.  Highly recommend.

title: Great hotel!
text: My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for a girl’s weekend and had a great time. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect as well. I plan to stay at the Iroquois again!

title: מיקום מעולה, צוות אדיב מאד , חדרים נקיים
text:
שהינו במלון 9 לילות, המיקום מצויין, 5 דקות מהשדרה החמישית ו5 דקות מהטיימססקוואר ו5 דקות מחב"ד למי שצריך. החדרים מצויינים מאובזרים במה שצריך, יש אינטרנרט במלון, הצוות אדיב מאד וממלא כל בקשה כולל בקשה.

Thanks to Damian that treats  us very well   He was here when we came and 

explained every thing kindly and with pathient .

title: very nice boutique hotel
text:
small, clean, modern rooms, very friendly and helpful staff.   breakfast not at the hotel, but we did get a $10 voucher (per person) at a breakfast place just two doors down on 44th street.   

not cheap, but you can do a lot worse in manhattan for the price.

very convenient to the theater district.  there's a parking garage right across the street (which may be full on busy nights, though).

the hotel is also very convenient to grand central station and not far from penn station.

title: Excellent Midtown hotel
text:
Absolutely adore it’s classic New York hotel. We looked here last minute when our booked hotel that was being renovated was unavailable and I am so glad that we did.Excellent location for walking to all of the popular tourist spots but still a quiet little corner of NYC. 

The Lanterns Keep was a nice little treat on a weekday to grab a cocktail. The suites Are extremely spacious and the heated floors or an excellent amenity.

Desk staff was friendly and accommodating. Helpful with recommendations and our needs in the room.

title: Great hotel and outstanding location
text: This hotel served all our needs. The bed was very comfortable. We were on the 8th floor and it was very quiet. The staff was incredible and the location was perfect. We were right off Fifth Avenue and 3 blocks from Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Great location.
text:
Very professional and helpful staff. Savannah at the front desk was particularly helpful when she offered to send someone to our room to make up our pull-out bed. The To Go Snacks were tasty and the Red Flame coupons were also very nice. 
I would only as that the bar wait until 10:00 pm for last call. Several people arrived at 9:45 and were turned away. Say you close at 9:45 and take the outdoor sign down if you don’t serve after 9:45.

title: Excellent service at a great location
text: Recently spent 3 nights at this well located midtown hotel.  Excellent service from a knowledgeable friendly staff.  Well appointed spacious and very clean room.  Minutes from Broadway and Times Square as well as Fifth Avenue.  Will definitely return!

title: Lovely nook amid the chaos
text: Definitely recommend this hotel.  It's small and unique, but the rooms are beautiful and very quiet and peaceful.  Wish the bar/breakfast had extended hours for those coming from the west coast and only there a couple of days.

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC
text: Would recommend for convenient and safe location, friendly staff and attractive comfortable room. Theater district, restaurants and Fifth Avenue we’re just steps away. Grab and go breakfast was a Perfect start to each day.

title: A gem right in the heart of NYC.
text: Service is impeccable. Location is convenient to Broadway, shopping and great restaurants. A cool little craft cocktail place hidden in the back of the lobby. (Wish it was open longer hours.) Hotel is a little pricey but worth it.

title: great service
text:
liked the ease of check in and early check in available
availability of front desk person
location was good - easy walk-ability
linens were comfortable and bathroom was clean
thank  you for a good experience on return to visiting NYC

title: hidden fees & not a real luxury hotel
text: We booked directly through the hotel website and j like most hotels the total room rate did not include facility fees or various taxes and fees totaling almost  20%. For the price we paid, I was surprised by the low quality of the facility and the terrible bag breakfast. Avoid this hotel.

title: Excellent stay. Very nice hotel and very good location.
text:
Excellent stay. Very good hotel and very good location.
Spacious and comfortable room.
We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very attentive and helpful.
I would definitely stay at The Iroquois Hotel again.

title: Great Location, Lovely staff and large rooms
text:
When booking in New York City, most of the reasonably priced Hotels have tiny rooms. The Iroquois had good sized rooms which were clean and nicely appointed. We are not big breakfast eaters but they did include a "to Go" breakfast which we had once and if was quite good. 
Very pleasant staff and since we came in on a red-eye flight the option to get an early check in for a small price was great. Good location, just far enough from Times Square to avoid the crowds but close enough to be convenient. Very reasonably priced. Will definitely consider staying here again

title: Convenient and quiet
text: The hotel's location was a short walk from Grand Central Station and close to Times Sq. and the theatres.  My room was small, but quiet and very comfortable. The front desk was always staffed and helpful.

title: Back to Broadway
text: First  time back in NYC since COVID. Hotel looks great, staff friendly, helpful and efficient. We were disappointed restaurant closed and bar had very limited hours. We love the location and access to theater district and Times Square.

title: Great stay and central location!
text: Awesome stay at Iroquois and central to everything that NY has to offer. The staff was great, daily room cleaning, complementary 'grab and go' breakfast and a great FREE walking tour  via Streetwise New York/Triumph of 'Tribeca and World Trade Center.'

title: Nice midtown hotel
text:
We usually always stay at the Sofitel next door, but it's closed for a few weeks still, so we stayed for the first time at the Iroquois instead, since we know the area.  Parking is easy at a huge garage across the street. 

The hotel is nice enough.  It's small.  Staff were all very nice and friendly.  Location is ideal for NYC.  It's in the middle of everything, but on a relatively quiet cross street. 

The rooms are tiny.  We had a king deluxe, which I think is just below the suite, and it was really small.  That doesn't bother me, and it's normal for NYC.  

The AC was awesome.  You could crank it to make the room cold, loved it.  Our room was quiet enough, but the soundproofing was not as good as the Sofitel.  I could hear traffic noise, horns, trucks backing up, etc.  Ask for a room not on the street if that bothers you. Also, you could hear some noise from other rooms at times.  Not bad though.  I'm just used to the Sofitel which is pretty much silent.

Breakfast was a prepacked choice of either yogurt, gluten free muffin, or bacon/egg sandwich, and all of those came with an apple, tangerine, and bottle of water.  They have coffee too.  That was nice if you want something quick, and avoid going out.

All in all, I have to say the Sofitel is a bit better, but the Iriquois is cheaper, and I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Good character, great location, awesome staff!
