text: This was our first time to the Iroquois, and we will definitely go back. We were really impressed with the overall experience. It is centrally located to all the action in Midtown; the rooms were charming, clean, and comfortable; and the staff was proactive and welcoming.

title: Otima localização
text:
O hotel tem uma localização fantástica! Perto de tudo, acesso fácil a várias estções do metro. Os funcionários são bem educados e achei muito limpo. Porém, tivemos uma surpresa ao entrar no quarto: a janela é praticamente colada a um muro de concreto! Não é que vista é para um muro, ele fica a poucos centimetros da janela, impedindo qualquer luz natural de entrar no quarto a qualquer hora do dia. Não é possível sequer ver o céu. Isso foi muito angustiante para nós, num primeiro momento,  porque os quartos são muito pequenos (mas em NY quartos são mesmo pequenos) mas um quarto tão pequeno e sem claridade natural não foi uma boa sensação e a iluminação do quarto também é pouca mas, por se tratar de NY, pouco ficávamos no quarto.

Se eu ficaria de novo no hotel... talvez sim pela localização que é maravilhosa. O banhero também é bem pequeno, mas a agua e a pressão do chuveiro são muito boas, a cama é confortável e o quarto é bem silencioso. O frigobar é daqueles que voce tira as coisas e já é cobrado, portanto não pode ser usado para itens pessoais, e em cima da mesa de cabeceira tem alguns itens numa caixinha que também funcionam assim, a caixinha inclusive é ligada na tomada.

title: Theater Stay
text: Decided to stay at the Iroquois when we were planning our trip to see a Broadway show. Lived in NYC for many years but this was our first time staying in a hotel and the Iroquois was wonderful!! The staff was super courteous every time we saw them, and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. The location is perfect, close enough to the Broadway shows but just far enough away from the hubbub. The grab & go breakfast was a nice touch too! Will definitely be back!

title: Very Good Experience
text:
Friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed, awesome pillows. Room is not big, but is OK for NYC.
Breakfast is "grab n" go", which is not great buy OK for the room price. Location is good, close to the Times Square area (few blocks)

title: Wonderful experience
text: The hotel is in a central, yet quite enough location.  It is exceptionally clean, and the rooms have everything one may need.  The staff is friendly and helpful and whatever small issue we had was resolved immediately.

title: Great place to stay!!
text:
This was a great place, very close to the theatre and everything we wanted to see!
The staff was outstanding!
Wish the restaurant had been open, but that will come in time!
Can’t wait to go back to see another show and stay at the Iroquois!!

title: Great location & service
text: The rooms are typical NYC city hotel size rooms. The room was clean and service was great. It is only a few blocks away from Times Square if that is important to your travels but also close enough to several train stations.

title: No value for money
text: Nice location not worth it the room is ok although very small no coffe machine no refrigerator not even a welcoming water in the room the breakfast is very poor (delivered on bags) with no many option it feels like the Hotel is saving its costs..

title: superb choice for theater district
text: Within two blocks of theater district yet seems miles away from the noise and congestion, situated on a high-end block of hotels and establishments.  Well run; breakfast included; and top notch service and cleanliness

title: The most gorgeous hotel!
text: When I decided to stay at the Iroquois New York, I had very high expectations. I usually stat at the Sofitel that's nearly right next door - but they are closed right now. I was concerned that it wouldn't be as nice. But I was very pleasantly surprised because the Iroquois is absolute luxury at it's finest. From the gorgeous lobby to the most beautiful room I've ever stayed in, it was fantastic. The front desk staff was amazing! They were friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating. They upgraded my room and it was seriously - absolutely stunning! The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in! I can't wait to go back and stay here again someday!!!

title: On Booking.com, when booking, your hotel was rated 5 stars, and when I arrived, I was shocked that the hotel is 4 stars,
text: On Booking.com, when booking, your hotel was rated 5 stars, and when I arrived, I was shocked that the hotel is 4 stars, and there is no coffee machine, no slippers for the bathroom, and breakfast is substandard, and there is no room service, and the reservation amount per night is large. I booked 3 rooms for 3 nights, 900 dollars were booked!!! !!

title: Our wonderful stay at The Iroquois
text: We spent a mother/daughters overnight stay to see a Broadway musical.  The Iroquois hotel was a highlight  From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with professional and friendly staff who went above and beyond to ensured an outstanding experience.  Our suite was exquisite. The hotel was conveniently located for our dining and entertainment plans. We cannot wait to go back.

title: Great quiet hotel!
text: We took our first trip since Covid 19 hit and could not have picked a better hotel. Wonderful staff, perfect location and a very quiet room. So close to everything in Midtown, yet from our room, we had none of the noise that typically comes from this area.

title: A Few Days in Midtown
text: My wife and I spent three days at the Iroquois while enjoying some fine dining and taking in David Byrne's American Utopia show at the St. James Theater, which was two blocks west of the hotel. The Iroquois lived up to our expectations of a storied hotel to stay in midtown. The room was very clean and had a comfortable bed. We also were greeted with exceptionally helpful and friendly staff at every turn. We enjoyed a few drinks in the bar and made good use of the excellent location to visit restaurants and shops as well as checking out the High Line.

title: Great choice!
text: Hard to imagine a better choice than the Iroquois for location, facilities and outstanding staff!  The historic building combines elegance with up to date services, and every single staff person we encountered during our three-day stay was welcoming and helpful.

title: Work stay
text: Hotel has maintained its boutique feel, yet it is beginning to look a bit worn. While it would have been nice if the bar was open on the weekend and if it closed later than 10PM, we understand Covid has presented many challenges.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is in a great location for dining, shopping and the theater .Rooms are a good size for NYC and are clean. Staff was friendly and attentive. I would recommend the hotel due to location and it being a smaller hotel

title: Y
text: Breakfast included is just a snack, so take into account when booking, also I don’t understand why there are always surprise charges, why not charge the total amount? It is in a great location and the room was perfect

title: Perfect location
text: The Iroquois is a lovely boutique hotel. The staff is attentive and friendly. The rooms are well appointed and clean. Note that some of the standard rooms are very small so consider upgrading. COVID protocols were observed and we felt very safe. The hotel is perfectly located for theater and shopping but situated on a quiet street.

title: Just a room....with no staff or services
text: Nice room was nice but the hotel must be suffering from the staffing shortage, or did it. Many times there were 2 people behind the desk but the coffee bar was empty and messy and it was 15 feet away from the desk. The hotel ran out of water bottle for guests for 2 day yet told us to go to Walgreens...which we did. It was about 100yds away. Why could the staff go get water for guest...while 2 of them stood there all day.

title: Great hotel
text:
Great value for our stay. The hotel is clean and cozy. You will get a daily breakfast voucher which you can use at the diner next door. 
The location is awesome and very close to the Times Square and broadway shows.

title: September 2021
text: Central and safe location for NYC visit.  Hotel facilities and staff are great.  Staff very helpful in aiding guests with questions and recommendations.  Convenient to public transportation, shopping and restaurants.  Will stay again!

title: Good value, great location
text: Extremely convenient location (subways, shopping, theater, and dining), and a really good value for a Midtown hotel. Will definitely stay there again. Some small disruptions due to COVID, but nothing that really mattered.

title: Boutique hotel
text: Beautiful hotel.  Felt very safe and comfortable. Great experience. Perfect location, close to everything. Lovely rooms, helpful staff. All The latest safety measures have been added for an additional layer of safety.

title: Stay
text:
Our stay in the hotel was satisfactory in general terms. The reception staff and the bellboys very attentive.

There was no location for breakfast, although the food was satisfactory, however not varied.

Very good location of the hotel.

The room is comfortable and allows you to rest. The place is quiet and safe.

We were struck by the fact that the room is not cleaned daily.

title: Brief stay but delightful
text: We immensely enjoyed our stay. Room was exactly the size we expected it to be in NYC. The bed was comfortable. The blackout shades and blinds let us sleep until 9:30. Can't even tell you the last time that was a thing. The room was clean. Breakfast wasa quick grab and go and they were able to accommodate a request for our sandwich. We were hoping for a late check out after immediately responding when booking that we needed this but upon our arrival, we were told it wasn't available since it was a holiday weekend. They were able to hold our luggage safely all day so it wasn't a huge problem. Enjoyed our stay!

title: Lady Gaga cincert
text:
We were in town to see the Lady Gaga and Tony Bennett concert.
The  staff at the Iroquois were fantastic. They were friendly and helpful in suggesting
restaurants etc. Great location! Close to time square, broadway and within walking distance of Central Park.

title: Comfortable stay
text: But please, for the love of God, bring back daily housekeeping services. If guests don’t want a cleaner in their room for the duration of their stay, there’s an app for that: the ‘Do Not Disturb’ door tag.

title: Terrible Stuff
text:
It is terrible stuff, they never care about the customers. There is no a real breakfast which they give a bag with some terrible snacks. I had problem with my AC and told them many times but they just returned back to me after many hours and they told me they need to change my room at 7 pm which I will need to check out the next day. 
So they do not have any hospitality and I do not recommend anyone, there are many hotels near this one, much better with better costs.

title: Good value
text: Excellent location, very clean, tiny, but very smart and tastefully decorated rooms. Good value. Have been first time in this hotel, probably not the last time. Can recommend the "Iroqouis" hotel for friends.

title: Great Location and Service
text: Nice hotel in walking distance of Times Square, Bryant Park and 5th Ave shopping. Fantastic staff, excellent customer service. Well appointed rooms with a very comfy bed. Nice bar open on the evenings with a great selection of cocktails.

title: Back to the city
text: Hotel was trying. But no bar or restaurant was a limitation along with lack of a real lobby. Room was great. Staff was exceptional. Location near Grand Central a plus. Bryant Park nearby is great for pandemic outings.

title: Great location, spacious room for NYC, comfortable stay
text: Stayed here for 2 nights, came to NYC to see Springsteen on Broadway.  Very close to the action, but just far enough away to be quieter.  Spacious and nicely appointed rooms with comfortable beds.  Good value for the location.  I would stay here again.

title: Lovely Quaint Hotel
text: Just a couple of blocks east of Times Square but far enough removed that 44th Street feels quiet, the Iroquois is a safe and good bet for a hotel in the area. Staff is friendly and the hotel is quiet. The elevators are a bit old and oddly located. The rooms are large versus standard NYC rooms which was nice. We were there two nights and I wish they would have proactively replaced the dirty towels as we were not told that housekeeping was by request only. Regardless, nice stay at a very reasonable price in a great area.

title: perfect for attending a broadway show
text: The Iroquois is just a short walk from Times Square and the Broadway theaters but is located on a relatively quiet street (for NYC). My room was very comfortable and, in contrast to several places I have stayed recently, well insulated from noise coming from the other rooms. The staff were very helpful and the inclusion of breakfast with the room cost was as very nice addition. I would definitely stay here again.

title: excellent hotel and service
text: This was my first stay at the Iroquois. The room was small but very comfortable and quiet. The staff are exceptionally responsive, accommodating and friendly. The rate is quite good for the level of comfort.

title: Welcoming and centrally located
text: We recently returned from a trip to NYC and stayed at the Iroquois, which is located conveniently to the Theater District.  The room was clean and comfortable and appropriate security precautions were taken, both against COVID and personal safety.  The room was more spacious than one we stayed in at another NYC hotel.  I also liked the option of having or not having daily maid service.  The staff was universally engaged and efficient, yet friendly. A continental breakfast was thoughtfully provided, too.

title: Good expérience
text: This was a good experience for all the family. The hotel is very well located and the suite we had was fine and spacious and we enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was not at the expected level though. All together we have enjoyed it

title: Nice small hotel near Times Square
text: The hotel was in a good location, clean, and priced reasonably. Staff was friendly and helpful. The grab and go breakfast was uninspiring, so I didn't eat it, so can't comment on how it tasted. They had "light" housekeeping, which meant no service unless you asked for it. Meaning no bed-making, fresh towels, trash emptied, or the normal things housekeeping would do on a daily basis. in all fairness, I was told this when I checked in and was told if I wanted any of these things, to just ask. I was OK without them, but some might not like to have to ask.

title: Surely for a costly stay NYC can do better?
text: The air con fan was very loud. No natural light into the room. Phone to front desk didn’t work. Restaurant is closed and the bar doesn’t serve non alcoholic drinks. It’s $10 if you want the drinkable water in your room. The staff are nice but you have to communicate with them, it never happened the other way. The air con broke one night but they gave us some money back for that. Great location though, they just need to improve overal.

title: Fantastic Location, Friendly Staff, Clean Room
text: One Block to 5th Ave shopping.  Short walk to times square and many restaurants.  Room was very clean and quiet.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Our flight was cancelled while we were in the boarding area.  Their customer service was extremely helpful and accommodating.

title: Mid Week Visit
text: Made a mid-week visit to the CIty. The stay at the Iroquois was wonderful, There is a kiosk for checking in and out but both times, the employee at the desk offered to assist. The grab and go breakfast was good, The room was immaculate and very quiet. Highly recommend.

title: Good location
text: Good location, convenient, professional staff, clean room. Breakfast to go is great concept. Will stay again definitely. Subway is near. Duane reed likewise near. When in New York this is a good place to stay

title: Fine
text:
Good location. Nice staff. Room not clean, which is super annoying when we are all pretending it’s COVID safe.

 Elevators annoying, but I guess what one should expect in old hotel.

Odd that in small selection of in room items they chose the ‘love kit’ - a couple condoms and a vibrator. Made me wonder if I should have rented by the hour.

Overall recommendable if were clean.

title: Great location but rooms need maintenance.
text:
Friendly staff. Great location. 
Poor internet service, flat pillows, weird grab-and-go breakfast that had nothing to offer for my kids. My request for rooms with a connecting door was not respected at first although we found our it was possible to respect.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: The Iroquois has consistently been my favorite hotel in New York for the last ten years. I love the new updates to it, and the controlled heated floor in the bathrooms is divine. Also, the decor is stunning. I love the Great Gatsby feel throughout the entire hotel.

title: Perfect small Manhattan hotel
text: My husband and I spent three nights at this charming, well located Manhattan hotel. From check in to check out, service was exceptional. Our room, a king, had plenty of room, which is unusual in New York City. Location is fabulous, and there was free coffee in the lobby in the morning. Frette linens, too! Definitely recommend.

title: The Iroquois New York
text: Beautiful hotel, superb location (easy walking to 2 subway/train stations, Broadway, Times Square, etc) with fabulous employees from the front desk workers to the house keeping staff. The staff went out of their way to provide useful, helpful advice re: local attractions, transportation, etc. Delicious grab & go breakfast, thick luxurious towels and dark blinds to facilitate sleep. A big plus was that I didn’t hear any ambient noise (was on the 10th floor). Would highly recommend and will be my go to hotel for NYC trips. Would also highly recommend taking in a Met's game if possible…just ask the front desk for tips re: Met's….a highlight of my trip!

title: Not a luxury experience
text: Hotel staff needs some basic hospitality training. The lost a package, gave bad restaurant recommendations, and failed to proactively solve problems or meet requests like “I’d like a quiet room.” Cannot recommend

title: Billing Mistakes
text:
The hotel was nice, this is a review on my billing experience.
This was a week booked through a travel agent.  At checkout, they gave us bills for the amenities fee, which I suppose is common enough these days, but no other charges were discussed.  Then they charged us the full price of the room + the amenities fees for each  booked room (2 rooms), even though the room charge had been paid by the travel company.  After calling in to get these charges reversed, they then charged another room to my card as the week long charge without the amenities fee. In total this is 3 mistakes around $1000 each, which seems a bit careless to me.
I didn't notice this third charge until weeks later, which means they're also not balancing their books to make sure their charges line up with their bookings, so if left up to them they'd never notice their mistake.  On the phone they agreed it was a mistake and started the refund process, but neither call netted any sort of apology, explanation or assurance that they'd follow up, just BAU. 
I don't feel like this was a trustworthy experience.

title: Great Location, friendly staff, small rooms
text:
The location is perfect if you like to be near time square, 5th ave shops and Central Park. It’s a good walk to go down to Chelsea or soho. 
We had a king bed and was comfortable. Room was adequate however was small even that we did not spend much time there we felt the luck of space for our bags and belongings

title: Excellent hotel close to Times Square
text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and had been recently updated. A small breakfast was included each morning. The fitness center was small, but offered everything that was needed. Would definitely recommend.

title: Quiet, tasteful, friendly
text: The perfect choice for a long or short term stay in the city, Iroquois excels in all the important areas - knowledgeable and personable front desk staff, well appointed bed and bathrooms, quality linens,  prime, but quiet, location, great shower pressure, nice light, good gym, calm and welcome ambiance. While the hotel faced staff and materials shortages as the city reopened, the level of service stayed steady. An easy recommendation.

title: Un lugar ideal en NY
text: Hotel boutique , Súper buen ubicado . Cerca de todo . Central Park, Bryant Park, Times Square . Baño a nuevo, cómoda cama . El hall íntimo y pequeño pero suficiente . Un muy lindo lugar para quedarse en NY con todo el glamour de la 5 ya avenida . Perfecta estadía

title: Excellent place to stay
text:
I stayed 4 nights in July 2021 at this hotel.  In fact,  I always stay at the Iroquois every time I come to New York.  Front desk always friendly, clean rooms and nice bedding.  
Located in the heart of New York .

title: Great value in a fantastic location!
text: Had a very pleasant stay for a weekend getaway. Everything was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly, informative, and very helpful! If you’re staying in midtown, the location is fantastic. Close to everything, yet tucked always so it’s quiet and out of the way. Overall a great quaint little boutique hotel with great service in a great location. The grab and go breakfast is a great bonus! Shanile was very helpful and friendly!!! Will definitely stay there again!

title: Clean, great location
text: Clean hotel within walking distance to many sites. The diner vouchers were great, traveling with 2 teenage boys. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Felt very safe walking around after dark. Nearby restaurants are great- ask the concierge for a dinner recommendation. Rooms were very quiet. My only recommendation is to add a top sheet instead of just a duvet.

title: The Iroquois in NYC is fantastic!
text:
My subject line says it all.  The The Iroquois in NYC is fantastic! This hotel is aligned with a boutques style hotel which is to say that they don't have a dedicated restaurant BUT they do have everything else.! Special thanks to Carlos, David and Tiffany for making check-in and check-out so seemless. They gave us GREAT recommendations to restaurants in the city (listen to the locals b/c NYC is not fully open yet as of 7.18.21). And then there was....... Jack our bartender. This guy makes THE best drinks in NYC! He is a master of his craft. If nothing else, get a drink from him before you head out to your adventures or wrap up your night with 1 of his great drinks. This was my g/f's last drink for 3 months do to us training for our summer vaca. She loved it!

I've been to a few hotels in NYC but the Iroquois is a must-do

title: Excelente
text:
Estuvimos una semana en este hotel,  fue muy buena la cercanía del hotel a todos los lugares y medios de transporte, pero lo mejor fue la atención prestada por los señores Carlos y David Shanies fueron de mucha ayuda para todo lo que se les solicitó de información. Carlos principalmente por que habla español pero ambos prestaron un excelente servicio. 

Es un poco costoso el lugar pero vale la pena. 

100% recomendado.

title: I canceled my res, but Iroquois did not cancel the airport pickup.
text: When I made my res, this hotel did not tell me their restaurant was closed. I also booked an airport pickup. The hotel did not give me the airport pickup info. When I went to book dinner at the Iroquois, I discovered their restaurant was closed and consequently canceled my hotel reservation. THE HOTEL NEVER TOLD THE DRIVER. I then booked the Langham and a driver through their hotel. When I arrived at the airport, two drivers texted me. I feel terrible that The Iroquois is so irresponsible, that I told the driver booked through them that I will mail him a check to compensate him a little. I am making up for the inadequacies of a hotel I never even stayed in! Incompetence is not a good look for a hotel. I would never book this hotel again.

title: Un hotel cerca de todo en NY
text: Un hotel acogedor, excelente servicio de su personal el cual es muy atento.  La mayor importancia es su ubicación ideal para caminar por Time Square y sus lugares de importancia.  El desayuno no es nada del otro mundo por lo cual se debe de solicitar otros productos del menú.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: Great location close to times square and grand central station, clean room and common areas, free breakfast at restaurant next door, parking available across the street (for charge) and room was above average size.

title: Location
text:
Location is great.  Rooms were not stocked properly since considering there is not maid service.
Front desk staff was helpful.
Lounge would be great but bartender is very slow and unwelcoming.
Breakfast voucher at Red Flame dinner were great.

title: One night in New York during TS Elsa!
text:
I tried to get to New York in time for the Bruce Springsteen show but was stuck in traffic due to the TS Elsa floods and missed it! The Iroquois staff recommended Molloy’s
Irish bar around the corner and it was great!

title: Family Stay
text: This is not a 5 star hotel at all.  A very decent 3 star at max. There was no room service and pull our sofa bed for my kids was very uncomfortable.  Staff was helpful and room was clean.  But of noise from the street at night.

title: Otel temiz fakat her gün temizlik y 5 gece konaklama süresince yalnızca 1 kere temizlik yapıldı.
text: Otel temiz fakat her gün temizlik yapılmıyor 5 gece konaklama süresince yalnızca 1 kere temizlik yapıldı. Ayrıca girişte ne kadar depozito alındı bilgisi verilmedi. Çıkışta para iadesi yapılmadı. Ben hala bekliyorum

title: Comfortable, clean room.  Great Location!
text: The location was close to Times Square.  The bed was comfortable and the towels were plush.  The bathroom was cute and all was clean.  They offered $10 voucher for breakfast per person at the diner 2 doors down since they do not have a restaurant.  The diner was pricey but the voucher offset the cost.  Great room!

title: Finally getting back to NYC.
text: The Iroquois has been our go-to hotel for the past 6 years.  It's convenient to Broadway and subway stations for heading over to Brooklyn for pizza.  The rooms are clean and a good value for the location.  A few things have changed due to Covid but that's not surprising.  We look forward to coming back in Spring 2022 when more shows will be open.

title: Clean, roomy, and great location
text: The Iroquois is conveniently located near Times Square and Grand Central Station.  Our room was clean and comfortable, and was spacious for a room in the city.  Breakfast from a diner down the street was included.  Staff members were friendly and helpful.  Great place!

title: Conveniently located!
text:
Overall, great location in Midtown near the subways and Times Square.  The staff was extremely helpful in everything.  We had a suite with a city view.  

The only minor inconvenience was we had to order ice - though to be expected in a boutique hotel.  Grab and go breakfast and coffee was included.  Wifi was spotty when we were there, but we didn’t spend that much time in the rooms anyways!

title: Great Stay
text: Very nice room and great location. Comfortable bed and very clean. Quiet even though next to elevator. Would gladly book there again. The bathroom and shower were spotless and well stocked. The TV was good as well.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Lovely hotel close to Grand Central, Bryant Park......small rooms but oh so comfortable.  Lantern Bar in hotel a cocktail gem.  Although I didn't  use it loved the grab and go breakfast provided by hotel.  Friendly helpful staff.  Got a recommendation for a Greek restaurant just a couple doors down which was excellent as well.  Will definitely be my go to hotel anytime I visit NYC

title: Unique boutique hotel
text: Location location location. I stay for two nights and enjoy very much. A small place, less people, easy to access in/out. The beds are perfect. Shower excellent. Quiet place closed to 42th and subway.

title: Very friendly and welcoming team!
text: David and the team at the Iroquois are very friendly and welcoming. I stayed with them for nearly a month and they were very attentive and professional helping me with the requests I made. Beds were comfortable and rooms a decent size, especially with the luggage I had. Perfect location for exploring the city and cute little speak easy bar for a cheeky cocktail at the end of a long day. Thank you team!

title: Rude bartender
text: Checked in today, the front desk told me I could get a Diet Coke from the bar and there is no shop or in room sodas. Went to the bar as I was instructed and the bartender refused to sell me a Diet Coke. He was rude as hell… Looking forward to the rest of my stay, NOT!

title: Quick Stop
text:
My days of checking out hotels in Manhattan are over. It wasn't my first stay at the Iraquois but I won't be staying anywhere else in midtown for a long time.
   The staff was more helpful than you could ask for and everyone did their job with a smile. From the front desk to the housekeeping department , all were perfect hosts. Treat yourself to a trip and check into the Iraquois.

title: No city view
text: I booked a room with a city view being it was my fiancé’s first time to visiting NYC the view was no view instead it was the hvac system and building view. Unfortunately the hotel was completely booked so I couldn’t be accommodated to a new room , if I had known it wasn’t a city view I would have booked a slightly bigger room but instead I sacrificed size for a non existent city view

title: FANTASTIC PLACE
text: Hotel has been renewed and looks great. Service is very good, people make you feel very comfortable. Location in mid-manhattan is fantastic near Grand Central, Bryant park , Central park, Times square. All you need is at walking distance. Room was clean and nice.

title: Lovely Old School Charm
text: Small quaint hotel built in 1900. Hotel has lots of charm. Small rooms, very clean. Comfortable beds. Nice speakeasy. Great, helpful,  friendly customer service. On a street with and near restaurants. I would return.

title: The best hotel in nyc
text:
We enjoyed our stay 
Wonderful hotel, very clean. And the service was excellent, the staff was very nice, the bed was comfortable , the location is great, the breakfast in the dinner near the hotel was very good 
I recommend the Iroquois hotel

title: Perfect
text: Everything was fantastic. The location is perfect, the room were nice and clean and the front desk staff were so much nice and helped us with everything we needed! Especially Carlos, he’s one of the nicest people I’ve met. Will definitely come back!

title: Great Service with an Amazing Team!
text: We could have never picked a better hotel in NYC! The room was beautiful and spacious. The service was 5 star 🌟  Tiffany, Jack, David and Carlos are an asset and should be recognized.  They were extremely helpful and always had a smile on their face 😊 Jack made me one of the Best Whiskey Sours I have ever had!! Egg whites added- who would have known. Lol. Will be trying that recipe back in Dallas.  We will be returning to NYC and The Iroquois will be our pick every time.  Great job and keep up the amazing work! See you soon 😊

title: Great Hotel and Location!
text: The Iroquois was fantastic overall. Very clean, not too noisy, and a great location. A 5 minute walk to times square and short walks to subway stations. Staff was extremely helpful. Gave us breakfast at the Red Flame right down the street, super convenient. The toilet area was very small, but that's it! I look forward to coming back!

title: Classy & quaint
text: Check in/out was a breeze, attentive & friendly staff. Luxury linens & towels (that robe!) with quality personal products. Even though our room was close to an elevator, noise was never an issue. Highly recommend this boutique gem!

title: Excellent service, luxury accommodations, and tremendous value
text: My husband and I rented the Iroquois Suite, plus an adjoining room for us to stay with our toddler for three nights. The hotel far exceeded our expectations, as we typically stay at The Four Seasons when traveling and have historically stayed at The Greenwich when in Manhattan.our family was visiting and picked the Iroquois, so we booked a room there instead. The service was unbelievable each time we called to make a request and no matter who was on duty. The rooms were spotless and well appointed, and parking was conveniently located right across the street. The central location is close to the theater district and Times Square, but not in the thick of it. Central Park is easily accessible, as well. The value was exceptional, and we will absolutely stay there again.

title: Large and comfortable in amazing location
text: I absolutely loved this hotel - it was extremely clean, the staff was so helpful and friendly, and the rooms were spacious and comfortable.  We requested a room change twice due to noisy neighbors and odors, and the staff immediately addressed these issues without hesitation.  The gym was open with limited capacity and reservations, which I appreciated as it allowed for more privacy anyway.  Breakfast was also provided each morning, and we were able to request a refrigerator for our room as well.  The location of the hotel was perfect as it was very close walking distance to Times Square without being in the heart of the noise.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Best hotel possible for a business trip to Manhattan
text: This is the perfect hotel for business travel. Situated in the middle of Midtown Manhattan, the rooms are cozy and quiet, amenities are great, and the rooms are clean and beautiful. The staff is also incredibly helpful and friendly with 24/7 front desk services.

title: Aloha and Mahalo!
text: True aloha and care displayed at this most beautiful hotel, The Iroquois.  New York with ALOHA!  The level of care extends from all members from arrival to departure.  Friendly greetings at the door, helpful guidance from concierge, and the beautiful hotel itself all contributed to a wonderful experience.  Mahalo nui!

title: A gem
text: We always love staying here when we're in NYC. The location is perfect for our needs, as it is close to the theaters and midtown shops. The staff has always been welcoming which we never get in a large chain hotel. The linens are top notch as are the amenities in the bathroom. Can't wait to come back.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: The Iroquois is a great place if you enjoy small, quiet hotels.  The rooms are spacious (by NYC standards); the beds and pillows very comfortable and the staff is friendly and accommodating.  It is a small hotel, so not a lot of on-site amenities, but it's in a great location and a couple blocks from Times Square and shopping on 5th Ave.

title: Great experience
text: Our experience was awesome. David at the front desk was very friendly,  and JJ was kind enugh to take care of my car while I needed to run a quick errand (note:t” Valets are not currently working in NY). Hotel is extremely well located near Times Square, rooms were nice and clean. Extra towels delivered to the room quickly upon request, and breakfast two doors down was above our expectations. Would definitely recommend and we will certainly return.

title: Amazing stay
text: Amazing stay it was pleasure to stay in there was my first time and wont be the last , i liked the cleanliness of the hotel , location us amazing , friendly staff members , it was really great having me there

title: Great stay, great location
text: This hotel is great place to stay. It is very comfortable and is in a great location. The staff is very friendly.  I can’t wait to come back and stay again. The beds are very comfortable and rooms are very nice.

title: The best service
text: The room was exceptionally clean and the service was some of the best I have experienced. This was my family’s first trip to NYC and the location was perfect, very close to Grand Central Station, Times Square, Central Park and subways to get anywhere. We had a truly memorable stay

title: Exceptional experience at The Iroquois
text: First time in NYC, wonderful hotel near by Bryant Park and easy access to local subway/bus system. We stayed a week there and had a wonderful time! Just a couple of blocks away from Times Square to walk over to experience the night lights & shopping but out of the way as it can get really loud and crazy there on the weekend.  Great services from David, Carlos and Tom.  All were so accommodating and such a friendly fun staff.

title: What a mess
text:
Booking.com Offer this hotel with 5 Star, realy was 2-3.
Rooms are to small, Booking.com Offer 32 sqmt, was 20.
Shower área ir flooded, 
Tottaly disapointing.
Location very well, near 5th Ave, don’t deserve 4 Star

title: A great hotel at a great location
text: The location is less than a 5 minute walk from Times Square, the street is calm and nice. Hotel is definitely recommended. David Finch from the front desk was also of great help to us during our stay, Thank you David!

title: How come I didn’t I know this place earlier and when can I be back?
text:
I’ve been traveling extensively for conferences and visiting friends since I moved to the States about 7 years ago. For all the hotels I’ve had the chance to stay in, I don’t expect things to be perfect from the get-go. I do, however, things would be solved efficiently and effectively should they pop up. The Iroquois New York probably has the best of the best staff members I’ve ever met. I’d like to extend my appreciation to David, Carlos, and two amazing ladies I embarrassingly don’t remember the names of. From my early check-in to surprisingly early check-out, David and all the staff members have never made me feel ignored; they always attend to those matters earlier than they claimed. David’s “5 minutes” is way shorter than my partner’s “just a second.” From the bottled water, to broken A/C and room change, everything was done swiftly. I’ll add onto that David’s charming yet calming voices and smiles (under his mask of course) also make you feel like you’re working with your close friends or family members. Staying at Iroquois is just like staying at home, not like any other hotel I’ve stayed in. 

The Iroquois New York also benefits from its closeness to Bryant Park and Time Square, yet it’s far away enough from the crowds so you don’t have to squeeze yourself through tons of tourists to get back. If anything, at least during my stay at the Iroquois, I had to reserve my spot at the gym and there’s no breakfast on the property. However we can only blame COVID for this. Even if you don’t like the diner Iroquois is partnered with, the Gregory’s coffee David recommends is just across the street and it’s amazing. Price-wise, it’s more than just reasonable and the service/attention you get from the staff is way much more. I hope I get to come back to Iroquois as soon as possible. :) 

Truly, there’s nothing I can complain about this hotel.

title: Amazing service!
text: The entire staff was amazing. For being in midtown, it was pretty quiet. The value is great, clean and modern. I will definitely be staying here again while I search for apts. Definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Decepcionante!
text: Visite el hotel por la buena crítica y calificación pero fue una gran decepción, empezando por qué el hotel definitivamente no corresponde a uno de 4 estrellas y mucho menos a la categoría de small luxury hotels of the World, ni mucho menos a boutique, es un hotel de 2 estrellas con pésima atención. Actualmente el hotel no tiene servicios, no restaurante, no bar. Las habitaciones muy pequeñas con alfombra vieja El desayuno es detestable en un restaurante cercano de pésima calidad red flaming, hasta el jugo es malo. No limpiaron la habitación, las amenidades son más que ordinarias y corrientes y la limpieza deja mucho que desear, la atención de front desk es pésima, ni siquiera usan cubrebocas, no dan ni agua, la televisión tiene solo canales de aire, la vista desde las habitaciones es decadente hacia un cubo con una pared, tienen un horrible mini bar con productos corrientes, en donde venden condones cómo si fuera un motel, las batas que te dan están percudidas, el elevador es viejo y con falta de mantenimiento, el lóbulo pequeño y con nada de personalidad. Nunca caigan en esta estafa...

title: עיסקה מצויינת
text: מלון קטן ואינטימי עם יחס אישי, כל מה שביקשנו נענה באדיבות ובמהירות, מרבית הצוות היו נחמדים מאוד. החדר היה מעט קטן אבל מאובזר בכל הנוחיות הנדרשת, המחיר היה כדאי מאוד, וארוחת הבוקר בדיינר הסמוך היתה תוספת משתלמת במיוחד. נהננו מהמיקום ומהנקיון. סל הכל מלון מומלץ מאוד.

title: Great Premium Value in Midtown Manhattan
text: Just letting you know about the great experience my family just had at the quaint perfectly located Iroquois Hotel.  In city quiet, friendly can do staff will insure our next visit back. Newly reopened with updated rooms which are just big enough to satisfy making it a great value.  The heated floor and excellently appointed bathrooms a plus.  Also, plenty of amenities close by and enough fine or other dining around for us to be patient until our next visit when their bar and restaurant open back up.

title: Stay here.
text: This place is quiet, clean, and secured. It is pretty. The employees are kind and friendly. I loved the heated bathroom. It is a few blocks from Time Square. The area is not crowded. Breakfast was also good.

title: Our Stay at the Iroquoise New York
text: We had the most amazing customer service and care for our stay and the  hotel was so comfortable you felt like you were home . The staff went out of their to make sure we were happy with our room and if there was a problem they immediately made sure we were completely happy.

title: Weekends at the Iroquois
text: Beautiful boutique hotel walking distance to Time Square and Broadway shows.  Very comfortable beds, very nice bedding, small rooms but it is New York and a wonderful older building.  Iroquois is one of my favorite hotels in NYC and I've stayed in Marriott's, Sheraton's, The Belvedere (another boutique hotel that was nice, but just not the Iroquois).  It is a bit more expensive than the chains but it is a very nice treat!

title: Highly Recommended
text: Our stay at the Ioquois hotel was lovely, we stayed in April 2019.  I had read great reviews and that's why we chose this hotel and I found out that all of the positive reviews were spot on. The staff was phenomenal, they were friendly and inviting, helpful and professional.  The location was great (plenty to see and do within walking distance) and the rooms were clean and well cared for. I would highly recommend this place.

title: Hidden Gem
text: We couldn’t have asked for any better experience than if the Iroquois hotel.  I researched many hotels and I’m so glad that I picked this one. Perfect Location, close enough to everything but far away enough from the mob scene of times Square.  The rooms were spotless and a very nice size. Will definitely be my hotel of choice when in New York. And… A great price point as compared to the surrounding hotels on 44th St.

title: Always a pleasure to stay here
text: My husband and I stay here several times a year while travelling for business. We love the boutique atmosphere and attention we get from the Iroquois. The location is perfect for our needs and always look forward to staying here.

title: Fantastic Location, Wonderful Staff, Excellent Value
text: I highly recommend this hotel! We had a great family vacation and found the staff to be accommodating and amazingly friendly and helpful. Also, we stayed here before and it was nice but the renovations fantastic. We will be back!

title: A New Favorite
text: My husband and I travel to NYC annually, often choosing to stay in a different hotel each time. Our stay at The Algonquin was so pleasant and convenient that we my find ourselves becoming repeat guests. How nice to have a quiet, comfortable room smack dab in the middle of so much activity!  We never used a taxi except to and from the airport.

title: Great experience
text: Staff was very friendly, we arrived early and early check in was not a problem.  Loved our room it was clean nicely appointed.  Great location, we walked to see Hamilton, the New York Public library, the Metropolitan Museum of Art.  Lots of good dining around.  Hotel was very quiet.

title: Another great stay
text: This is probably the 6th time we have stayed at the Iroquois, after stumbling on it years ago.  We love the small size of the hotel, the comfortable rooms and the extremely accommodating staff.  The rates are reasonable and the 3rd night free deal made us decide to come in a day earlier.  The location is perfect and we always make a point of staying at boutique hotels when possible.  Iroquois never disappoints and it our go-to hotel in NYC.

title: Delightful property perfectly situated in NYC
text: There are so many things to like about The Iroquois, from our preliminary conversations with Vanessa (an angel) to the directions given to us for how to get to JFK on our departure, the property beyond exceeded our expectations. It is perfectly situated near multiple subway options - anyone who has visited NYC will tell you how important this is - as well as easily walkable to dining, shopping, and sites. As a bonus, we were greeted warmly at reception and in our room with congratulations on our birthday/anniversary with a bottle of Prosecco -- a very nice touch. Every morning when we left the people at the desk wished us happy exploring and were happy to see us when we returned, asking us about our day. The room was comfortable and roomy by NYC standards and even though we didn't have a view (it didn't matter, we didn't need one) plenty of light came in through the three windows. We will absolutely stay here again.

title: Great midtown oasis.
text: We stay at the Iroquois Hotel frequently. We love the staff who are always helpful, polite, and professional. While you are only a block or 2 away from the heart of Times Square, you feel you are a mile away from the hustle.

title: Nice Stay
text:
Ok I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Let’s start with the good things. The location is phenomenal. The hotel is between 5 and 6 Ave right by Bryant Park. The lobby smells wonderful. The doormen are very nice. The suite was big. The bathroom was also very large,I love that it had a little window and that the floors were heated. The room temp. and cleanliness were a 5. There was turn down service in the evening. Large windows in the suite. The reasons I won’t give the hotel above 4 stars- the elevator was tiny and took a very long time. We were on the 5th floor and often took the stairs. The lobby is small and the elevator is by the front desk and the people at
the front desk rarely spoke to us as we waited for the elevator or as we came in. The Lantern bar was open and popular, Friday night when we arrived, and we never saw it open again. I liked the room a lot, so if you are looking for a really good hotel room,  I highly recommend it. If you are looking for more amenities and movement in a hotel this one isn’t the one.

title: A little slice of Heaven
text: We have been staying at the Iroquois for about 6 years and have never been disappointed. Everything has been recently updated and we are looking forward to the opening of the restaurant. The staff are top notch and the lobby and rooms are immaculate.

title: Charming hotel !
text:
Very nice and charming hotel. Top location between fifth avn and times square. No possibility for dinning or breakfast ! We had a room for 2 adults + child. The beds were very small for 2 adults.
Price - value = excellent !!

title: Very nice hotel; stay less desirable due to other guests
text: I’ll start by saying this is a very nice small luxury hotel. You can’t beat the location for getting around the city. The staff is excellent(JJ at the door is awesome),the rooms are spotlessly clean with great beds, VERY quiet room, heated bathroom floors, and the most amazing shower ever! I’d give this property a strong 5, but the ventilation system(or smoking policy)needs improvement. When we returned from dinner last night, it smelled like someone had been smoking in our room. I notified the front desk so that we wouldn’t be charged a cleaning fee. Tonite as I’m laying here in bed, there is cigarette smoke coming through the vents from another room. The front desk says they think they know which room it is coming from, but that room won’t answer the phone. They offered for us to change rooms, but I’m not going to wake my husband at 11pm to change rooms. I do think a strong knock on the culprit’s door is in order. Again...very nice hotel, with a stay that was made less desirable by other guests.

title: Fabulous stay!
text: My friend and I had an incredible girls trip for my birthday. Every member of the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a beautiful experience. The hotel is beautiful and full of stories from the past. Very nostalgic and elegant. I will definitely be back.

title: a historic old hotel that doesn't feel cramped and worn-out--a rare pleasure !!!
text:
great place-- great service--  super clean and modernized.... night and day difference from a very nearby - very similar old hotel ( not gonna name it--but it's easy to figure out ) --
i'm fussy about hotels--and this place is awesome !!

title: excellent !
text:
Great location.. just few steps from 5th avenue and Times Square. 
Very nice rooms, very comfortable and clean. Love it !! 
The only bad thing is there's no breakfast anymore, but there are many restaurants near.

title: Our new favorite in the neighborhood
text: We had stayed at several hotels in the immediate neighborhood, including the Algonquin and Royalton, dating back many years. Searching for a hotel in mid-winter, I was  delighted to find that the Iroquois was a bit more flexible regarding cancellations than the others -- coming from the northern snow belt, that could have been very important. Not only that, but the Iroquois has been recently renovated, and also offered a three-night special package. The hotel was convenient (well, we knew that), the staff were courteous and helpful, and we found the lighting and climate control in our room to be well designed and functional. Really, there was nothing to criticize, although we were sad to discover that the former restaurant in the hotel had been closed. There are wonderful eateries on the same block, so that was not a serious problem. I usually resist giving all top marks in these review, but the Iroquois earned them!

title: Pleasant stay
text: My short 3 day stay at the Iroquois was thoroughly enjoyable. The room was perfect for one person. Excellent bedding, towels and gowns. Friendly, polite staff and also helpful. My room was in the mddle of the hotel and away from any noise. It was acrosss from the lift which, surprisingly was no bother.at all.  A pleasant stay and higly recommended.

title: The Iroquois New York Accommodations
text:
My stay at the Iroquois was fabulous.  A quaint, friendly enviroment to stay while here on business and pleasure.

The room had all the amenties needed with highend finish for a reasonable price considering it is located in the heart of the city.

I highly recommend the Iroquois.  Clean, safe and comfortable.

title: A very nice place to stay-location is great!
text:
The room was quiet, very close to all of the attractions. Subway was nearby.
The staff is very helpful and friendly.
Wish we had more time to visit the bar/tavern on site.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Feb 2020
text: Excellent hotel, great staff and service, would highly recommend.  The pillows and bed were so comfortable.  The heated floors in the bathroom were so welcome.  The voucher for the DB bistro continental breakfast was nice.  The hotel had coffee in the lobby also and wine and cheese in the afternoon.  Having a gym in the hotel to use was great.

title: Great find
text: Great find in Manhattan. Centrally located, friendly reception, contemporary (though small) rooms. Included breakfast in DB Bistro nextdoor was very upmarket though limited choice. Great value when I stayed

title: Perfect hotel and great location
text: My husband and I were tourists in NYC with a jam packed itinerary. We were thankful to be staying at this gem of a hotel where we could rest our weary feet. You cannot ask for a better location, and the hotel is clean and quiet. Above all, their staff is extraordinary.

title: The  hotel where comfort happens -  the Iroquois Hotel
text: My husband and I were recently in NY for a week of conference meetings (held at another - large conference -   hotel)   - we stayed at the Iroquois because we wanted a smaller hotel.  I found the Iroquois on line and the location was excellent for our needs - mid town, quiet street, lovely  facility, great area for anything you wanted to do.  I called for a reservation and have never found a receptionist as helpful, resourceful, and patient as the woman with whom I spoke.  We were not disappointed when we arrived at the Iroquois - in fact, it exceeded our expectations  from the moment we entered the lobby -  We were greeted warmly  at the front door  by the doormen every time we cane and left for the day  - to the desk personnel who registered us and showed us to our room, to the concierge  who recommended some of the  most wonderful  restaurants - 3 of them on 44th Street -    the room was  very quiet and the bed comfortable (would love to have one for our home) and the housekeeping was impeccable.  Our room was small and at first we thought we would like to move to a larger room, but actually decided not to do that - we were comfortable and it was cozy. The widows actually open to allow fresh air if you want and the heating unit was responsive if we wanted more or less heat.  Upon arriving home,  I discovered I had left  (or lost ) a sweater and upon contacting the Iroquois, was informed not only had they found it but were mailing it to me.  I cannot recommend highly enough the benefits of staying at a hotel in New York City that has all the comfortable qualities of the Iroquois.

title: Our home away from home
text: For years we were frequent guests of another nearby boutique hotel, but on the suggestion from a close friend we tried The Iroquois, and we haven't gone anywhere since. My wife and I love the old world charm of the hotel. The staff have always been professional, friendly, and very accommodating. We love visiting NYC regularly for Broadway shows, or trips to Radio City, Carnegie Hall, and Lincoln Center. The hotel is close enough to walk to the heart of it all, but away from the madness of Times Square. We look forward to returning soon !

title: Great service and location
text:
We had to unexpectedly book a room last minute in NYC on Valentine's weekend, due to a mixup at the hotel we originally booked. Much to our surprise, not only was a room available at the Iroquois, but it was a better rate for a larger room than our original booking. We were greeted warmly at check in, and offered our choice of a prosecco or water. Of course, we chose the Prosecco! That was just the beginning of the hospitality we received during our 3 night stay. Every single staff member was welcoming, friendly and accommodating. 

The room was comfortable & clean, and the bathroom had plenty of shelf space (important for 3 women sharing a room!) for storing toiletries. Bonus - it had a heated floor! The decor was modern and the beds very comfortable. 

The location is very accessible to transportation via subway, car or on foot. 

I would definitely stay here again, it would be on the list of my top 5 midtown hotels, especially for the rate we paid.

title: If you find this place, stay here.
text:
This took some digging to find, but I’m really glad I did. I’ve stayed in New York a fair amount and the value at this place is excellent. They seem to have some great deals and rooms are definitely 4 start (I think many NY hotels claim to be bit so often feel tired and not quite at the standard). It was a decent size (again for an NYC hotel) and staff were friendly. Super convenient for all of Midtown too. 

Having just looked for the right deal in the past I’ll now look for this place first. I’m really pleased to have found it.

title: Theater District gem!
text:
Wonderful location on a quiet side street near the theaters and Times Square. Attentive and friendly staff, nice gym and lively small perks to put the extra touch on your stay. Quiet with very little city noise - 4/5 for sleep quality only because I am over duvets - too warm!
Overall was perfect for our theatre weekend!

title: Excellent stay , nice staff
text: I stayed the second time at the Hotel and it was as Pleasant as the First time ... the staff is always greeting friendly , asking for help ... room Service immedeately ( ice cubes ) ... clean Rooms ... clean bathrooms ... everything Great ... and very Central ... Great Restaurant next door : db Bistro moderne ( breakfast, lunch, Dinner )

title: Always great to stay at the Iroquois!
text: My recent stay was awesome- the customer service is phenomenal  and the staff (from concierge, front desk, and housekeeping) are all so friendly. The hotel location is the best, can walk everywhere. It is always nice to return to the Iroquois whether for business or personal travel!!

title: Great Location & wonderful Staff
text:
Really enjoyed the Iroquois Hotel.  The hotel is in a perfect location for theatre but is off the Times Square noise.  The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and the wine & cheese receptions in the lobby on Tuesday and Thursday evenings was lovely.
Would have preferred having a coffee pot in the room rather than in the lobby by the elevators.
I definitely would recommend this hotel on a trip to NYC.

title: Iroquois
text: I was there only for 1 evening.  The personnel were very professional and courteous.  The location was excellent and the room decor was simple yet elegant.   The room I stayed was very quiet.  I was able to leave my bag upon checkout with the front desk so I could continue to enjoy NYC.  I would recommend Iroquois to anyone.

title: Excellent hotel
text: The hotel was extremely clean.. the staff was courtesy and kind.. door men were excellent as well as front desk staff.. I cannot comment on food as I didn’t eat there but all else was wonderful and I would def stay there again

title: Fab hotel
text: What a lovely experience staying at this hotel. Where do I start the room was really beautiful and so comfy. Underfloor heating in the beautiful bathroom to make early morning shower so inviting . Housekeeping service every day hotel was spotless.The location is fantastic just a short stroll to Nroadway and Times Square and yet complete silence in the bedroom at night for a great nights sleep I am not sure how they achieve this. Lovely wine and cheese reception on the Thursday evening we were there in the lobby really nice idea to meet some fellow guests. Wasn’t sure about the tea coffee at reception  in the mornings rather than this facility in the room,before I went but have to say it was ideal no faffing around with small cups and cartons we could get a very good take away cup of coffee just outside the lift door and bring back to the room without all the mess.  The staff we met during our stay couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful from the bell hops to the concierge and reception staff all willing to go that extra mile to oblige special mention to DJ  Irma and Oliver. Negatives ? I honestly cannot think of 1 except cocktails are pretty pricey in the cocktail bar but I suppose that’s New York prices. I hope I will get the opportunity to return some day and I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan.

title: Small comfy room
text: First impressions, beautiful outside, very clean but small reception. Our room was on the 7th floor, superior room which really is ordinary room... Room very clean and pretty. Bed soft and comfy. Bathroom small but beautiful... Normally at this point I would give it a 5* and move to my next review but I left it on 4* for 2 reasons... The window in our room was very small and due to the wall being pretty much there in front of it there was no natural lighting... that would be ok if it was mentioned when I was booking it... the second thing is minor (or major if you are in a hurry) but no spare tp was left in the room... not good if you are desperate 😳 I would book the same hotel but maybe a different room next time when I am in New York... oh forgot to say this hotel is very close to all the theatres...

title: Comfy, Cozy, & Convenient
text:
This was the second time we stayed at the Iroquois, and we enjoyed this stay just as much as our visit last year.  The front desk staff was welcoming and efficient, providing superior service and responding quickly with anything we needed.  

The location cannot be beaten with quick access to anywhere in midtown Manhattan just a few minutes walk away.

The Iroquois (Presidential) and Executive suites are a good size and offer a comfortable, quiet stay.  Quite enjoyed the heated bathroom floors and in the Iroquois Suite the steam shower.  It's also nice to have windows in the bathroom for the natural light.

I agree with most of the reviews that the absence of a coffee maker or tea kettle does dilute the overall guest experience, but we did bring our own kettle and mugs, so it wasn't much of a problem for us.  We did have a Nespresso machine in our Iroquois Suite, but there were no capsules or coffee cups provided, so the device served no purpose. Also, there was a dining room table but no tableware, so we made do with paper and plastic from take-away places.

Appreciate the chocolates left on the bed each night during turn-down service but would have to say housekeeping needs to pay more bit attention to service details as we had a couple of hiccups, but none severe enough to elaborate here.

We've enjoyed our last 2 stays so much that we've already booked our stay for 2021 and look forward to returning then.

title: Small Boutique Hotel In The Theater District
text:
This is a small boutique upscale hotel in the heart of the theater district. It has been completey renovated in a contemporary style although I miss the library off the lobby, which has been turned into a small space for relaxing. The restaurant was under renovation when I was there but there is a bar adjoining the lobby.

Pros: I stayed in a "Superior" room. It was small but adequate for one person. It may be cramped for two. The furniture is attractive and very good quality. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom is an adequate size with good shelf space. The bathroom floor is heated (nice touch!) although there was no instruction card and I couldn't figure out how to work the controls (I had to ask at the front desk). There was a walk-in closet with an ironing board, iron, safe, bathrobe and slippers. The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly, polite and caring, knowledgeable about nearby restaurants and always willing to help. I was offered a glass of prosecco or a bottle of water on check-in. There was wine and cheese in the lobby for guests on the Thursday night I was there. 

Cons: I asked for a quiet room on a higher floor away from the elevators. My room had a small window over the bed with a view of a fire escape and the back of another building. I asked if there was a room with a better view available. None of the rooms have great views because the hotel is sandwiched between buildings. I was told that any other room wouldn't be as quiet so I stayed where I was. Heat throughout the space was not uniform. The window in the walk-in closet was old so the closet was cold and my clothes were cold when I took them out. The window in the shower stall also was old so the stall was cold until the hot water warmed it up. The heating system was loud when it cycled on. None of these were deal breakers for me and I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful, highly quality hotel with a few little kinks
text:
This hotel was beautiful.  Our room was big and gorgeous and very clean.  Perfect location.  Staff superfriendly and helpful.
Fitness center left much to be desired and no on-site restaurant at the moment.  Would've been nice to grab breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day.

title: Nice hotel fair price
text:
The Iroquois is a nice place, clean and nicely appointed. The price is what you get for a hotel on 44th street and so I would call it fair - not too expensive not too cheap. The hotel was offering a package with valet service for the car which saved some money for our 1 night stay but would have been significant savings had we been staying longer.

Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: The Iroquois
text: The Iroquois is on a very good location (between 5th and 6th avenue and very close to Times Square). The decoration is refined (rooms, bathroom and corridors). We enjoyed our stay and we would return.

title: Hectic day made easier to take
text: On the run all day. The service and staff were so accommodating. Checkin professionally done with a smile. Needed to run the next morning and leave the bags after we checked out. It was seamless and quick. So appreciated.

title: New York hotel gem
text: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, comfortable rooms great location,new renovations are coming along well, Lanterns keep cocktail bar is hidden gem, comfort and cleanliness of the hotel is excellent with free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning,

title: great location, quiet&clean rooms, friendly staff
text: I had an upgrade to a suite so maybe this doesn't apply to the other rooms... The suite was nice, spacious, clean, with an extremely comfy bed and marble bathroom.  I think this is due to current construction (which also may explain the bargain price?) but the bar is really rather tiny. But the two bar keepers were friendly and trying to work with what they had.

title: Good stay but could be better
text:
Family of 4, stayed 5 nights in Dec 2020, in 2 rooms. 

Plus:
a. Excellent location, within walking distance to New York’s top attractions including Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Bryant Park.
b. Friendly doorman. 
c. Comfortable bed, cozy room.  Heated bathroom floor is a big bonus.

Minus: 
a. No coffee/ tea making facilities in room. Complementary cofee is provided at lobby in the morning but we missed having our decaf cuppa in the evening.
b. No complementary bottled water nor an electric kettle in the room. Not sure if this is unique to NYC hotels but this is the only hotels in my 16 days US trip whereby we have to pay for water and this is not exactly a budget hotel.

Read somewhere there is nightly turndown service with chocolates and daily delivery of The New York Times but we didn't have any of those (likely discontinued). We are generally happy with our stay at The Iroquois.

Other than food, accommodation takes up a big chunk of our budget for NYC, may be worthwhile staying in NJ or Brooklyn and train in/ out of Manhattan.  But for first time visitor to NYC with a flexible budget, stay in Manhattan.

title: Quick Convenient stay in Midtown Manhatten
text: The Iroquois is perfectly located on a quiet street so close to Broadway, NYPL, Empire State Building. Its a quick,easy 10-15 min walk from Penn Station. Room rates are reasonable if staying on the right nights, rooms are small but beautiful and clean-icing on the cake was heated bathroom floors.  24 hr fitness and dry sauna provides water and towels and a pelaton.  Front desk and door man very friendly and welcoming.  This was our 2nd stay and would highly recommend

title: Will see me again
text: Stayed there for 4 nights. Very convenient. Internet - great & reliable. Di dnot have a chance to check the bar - next time. Central and easy to get around. Staff supportive. Bed / Sleep quality, excellent.

title: Very nice
text: Bigger than normal room for nyc, clean, great value, makes you think you shouldve paid more because of the service and features. Mini bar was a little pricey, sauna and gym on property were very nice! Would stay again!

title: Molto bene
text: Posizione centralissima a due passi da Times Square, dalla Fifth Avenue e dalla Central Station. Personale del ricevimento disponibile e molto gentile. Barman molto bravo con cocktail veramente buoni. Camera Premium spaziosa, comoda e con il bagno dal pavimento riscaldato.

title: Great place to stay in midtown
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois. I was there for 9 nights attending a training week at a nearby  building. The bar didn't have food yet so I never got to try it out but it looked really nice.  It is a small hotel but great friendly staff, clean, comfortable room, and a truly great remodeled bathroom with waterworks fixtures.  The building is flanked by other buildings on three sides, so my window looked into an odd bricked shaft--if you want a view you would have to be facing the street or at the upper floors.  I didn't really care because I was out and about most of the time but good to know what to expect.  The location is fantastic and compared to other hotels nearby with big fancy lobbies and restaurants, the price was very agreeable as well.  Perfect for my needs and I'd stay there again for a similar trip.

title: Old friends trip/family business
text: The location is perfect for walking to the theatre district, shopping and Rockafeller Center. I highly recommend it if you want a quiet, welcoming and convenient place to stay. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Our executive suite was perfect for 3 old friends. We had fun together without feeling cramped. It was perfect for us!

title: The Best Place Stay in NYC
text: My husband and I surprised our two kids (4 and 6 y/o) with a trip to NYC for Christmas. We arrived at The Iroquois on Christmas Night after a three hour flight delay, desperate for a Peking Duck Dinner. Seth welcomed us to the hotel, got us to our room quickly and had a reservation for us (that we would’ve never been able to get on our own) at The Peking Duck House 45 min later. For the rest of our stay, Seth was our man and his recommendations were spot on. The entire staff was outstanding and we will definitely be back. The accommodations were top-notch and we all slept like babies after exciting days in the city. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Wonderful beginning to the new year
text:
Visited the Manhattan and stayed at the Iroquois for several days for New Years and really enjoyed our hotel. They had just completed renovations and the rooms turned out beautiful.

The Iroquois is 44th in between the Algonquin and Sofitel across the street from the Royalton a couple blocks east of Times Square.

Perfect for theater going, dining out, and touring the town.

title: Great find
text: We did an impromptu trip after the holidays and found this gem. There was phenomenal service, friendly and responsive staff, great value and an incredibly convenient location. We will definitely be back.

title: Natale e capodanno a New York
text:
È la mia seconda volta a NY ma in contesti diversi. La prima volta è stata una delle tappe del mio viaggio di nozze, ora siamo tornati con un bimbo di 7 anni. 
Ho scelto personalmente l’albergo e ne sono rimasta ampiamente soddisfatta. Ovviamente qualche piccolo suggerimento mi sento di darlo ma sono davvero piccole cose.
Partiamo dagli aspetti positivi. Posizione. A piedi si raggiungono le principali attrazioni di NY ed è anche vicino alla fermata della metro che porta ovunque. Il Personale della struttura si merita davvero un bel 9. Tutti sempre gentili sorridenti e disponibili a risolvere qualsiasi dubbio o perplessità. Un super + va al ragazzo che ci stava sempre la mattina che aiutava con i bagagli, chiamava i taxi, insomma un po’ un tutto fare ma che ha conquistato la simpatia di mio figlio. 
Camere piccoline come da standard di Manhattan ma ben curate e pulite. Abbastanza silenziose ( forse isolerei un po’ più le finestre) ed estremamente calde, sopratutto il bagno che aveva il riscaldamento al pavimento a volte anche troppo bollente. Non tantissimo spazio per riporre i vestiti ma alla fine mi sono attrezzata considerando che stavamo una settimana 
Biancheria del bagno cambiata tutti i giorni e molto pulita. Buoni i prodotti del bagno sopratutto la crema corpo davvero molto nutriente. 
Wi-Fi gratuito abbastanza veloce. Ho usufruito del servizio lavanderia e considerando che stiamo a NY i prezzi sono davvero onesti.
Ogni giorno una bottiglia di acqua a testa come omaggio dalla reception e non è male 
I suggerimenti che mi sento di dare sono: la pressione dell’acqua della doccia da aumentare sicuramente. Manca il bollitore the o caffè in camera cosa assurda nel 2020 e per una struttura di qualità come questa. 
Costo della colazione proibitiva ( 40$) a persona. Alla fine ho optato per usufruire a volte del caffè che ti omaggia la reception e andare al market dietro l’angolo e prendere biscotti, frutta e merendine spendendo un terzo. Comunque di fronte e accanto ci sono degli ottimi bar che hanno buone cose a prezzi più onesti rispetto al bistrò con cui è convenzionato l’hotel 
Quindi quando leggete ristorante  tra le cose che ha l’albergo non calcolatelo perché viene tutto da fuori e vi conviene uscire direttamente voi. Tra l’altro l’hotel è davvero circondato di ristoranti di ogni genere e tipo compreso un mc donald dietro l’angolo ( anche se io lo amo poco) 
Detto questo quando tornerò a NY ( perché lo farò sicuramente) tornerò qui perché è stato davvero un bel soggiorno. A presto 🙂

title: Comfortable!
text: Stayed 4 nights over New Year. Clean and comfortable rooms, centrally located within easy walking distance of main sites and great eating places. We were there for NYE and really struggled to get back to the hotel in the afternoon due to road closures around Times Square. It would have been nice if hotel had advised guests how to best access the hotel on NYE, it was very stressful and front desk weren’t really interested which was a shame as the majority of staff were really helpful. Was aware of the refurbishment (after I had booked), which did compromise the stay a bit, as a bar/restaurant would have been nice for a drink after a long day sight seeing. I think the bar did seem to be open one evening but not consistently!

title: Exceeded My Expectations
text:
I’ve stayed in plenty of NY hotels and I will definitely return to the Iroquois. It’s located about a 10-15 minute walk to Broadway, Times Square and Rockefeller Center but since it’s on a side street, it doesn’t feel like you’re in the thick of it. The hotel has been recently renovated and the rooms are well-appointed. We stayed in an executive suite and it was a largest room I’ve stayed in NY. The bedroom had a king-sized bed and the living room had a fold-out sofa bed. The bathroom had a nice-sized shower and bathtub. One of the nice features was the heated floor in the bathroom which was lovely for a cold winter day. The hotel bar was recently renovated and an excellent way to relax after a long day of walking around the city. Another plus was complementary happy hour on Tuesdays and Thursdays which had very nice wine and cheese. 

The hotel is small and boutique and such a huge improvement to the large sprawling hotels in NY with masses of people and questionable service. As for service at the Iroquois, it was extremely polite, professional and timely. No complaints whatsoever.

title: Great Stay!
text: I really enjoyed location along with service! The staff was helpful. It was very clean, kinda small room but perfect for me! Everything about my stay was great! If I come back to NYC this is where I would stay.

title: A memorable stay and experience!
text: Superior room queen bed on the 9th floor and it’s amenities were excellent; dry sauna and gym facility satisfactory; friendly customer service from staff; knowledgeable bartender; bottle of wine and locally-made chocolate for NYE celebration the cherry on top!

title: Great
text:
Friendly staff, within walking distance to most major things to visit, chic, free water and coffee every morning. A classical and hystorical vibe that we loved. Room could be bigger and the view at the 9th floor could have been great, but it is not in their power.
Conclusion: extraordinary! Totally recommend!

title: Fabulous Location for Top Tourist Attractions
text: The Iroquois is conveniently located and spotless with a lot of historical charm. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. There are many great restaurants and sites so close to the hotel. I would definitely return to this property.

title: Great hotel, great staff!
text:
My wife and I have been visiting New York during Christmas for the past 4 years, this was the first trip with our daughter (8 months old). Being that we now had an infant with us, one of our criteria was a place that was baby friendly and this place ended up on our list during our search. We ended up booking the Iroquois Suite which comes with a separate dining room, separate bedroom, the bathroom consists of a steam shower, tub, two sinks and a heated floor by the shower. It felt more link an apartment instead of a hotel room, it was great. We had contacted the hotel in advance, letting them know we were going to be with an 8 month old, they had a pack and play, baby bath kit, baby toy, and baby bathrobe waiting for us in our room!
The staff is also very friendly, helpful, and professional. Upon arrival there was a bit of traffic in front of the hotel making it a bit difficult for our driver to find a spot. The doorman noticed immediately and was very helpful in helping us unload from the car and get the bags to our room while we focused on checking in (remember we have an 8 month old with us so this could have been much more stressful). Front desk was also very helpful with suggestions for food delivery as we had dinner in the room with some friends a couple nights.
Overall a great experience, we are already talking about coming back.

title: very good choice
text: the location of the hotel is excellent (very close to Times Square and 5th avenue shops), the staff was very welcoming and very helpful, the hotel offers (with other hotels) free walking tours which is an important extra bonus

title: Xmas holiday
text: Wonderful trip love the hotel. Returning for many years. The remodel is beautiful and the staff is welcoming. We love the neighborhood. Convenient location to Grand Central, Bryant Park, and lots of restaurants and cafes.

title: Christmas in Nyc
text: Wife and I regularly stay at the Iroquois hotel during our visits to New York. Hotel staff, front desk to doormen, housekeeping to restaurant all welcome guests upon arrival or when making eye contact during the day. The hotel is confidently located near our areas of interest, generally Broadway show and fine dining. The rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable and quiet.
