We always appreciate how easy (quickly) it is to enter and exit the hotel.

title: Camere piccole, ma pulite.
text:
La mia camera non era spaziosa, così come la lobby. Personale gentile e disponibile. 
La pulizia è buona e l'arredamento è moderno e curato. 
La colazione (alla carta) è servita nel bar adiacente all'hotel.

title: Midtown Gem
text:
I’ve been staying at the Iroquois for the last 7 years.  Great location, comfortable well appointed rooms and the service is excellent!  Several staff have been there for years.
In particular Carlos is wonderful.  He’s friendly, helpful, and remembers us year after year.  I genuinely enjoys what he does.

title: December in Midtown
text: Nice hotel.  Comfortable rooms.  Friendly staff.  Located in the heart of mid-town.  Blocks from Bryant Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building, the theater district, and more.  Just wish the bar / restaurant would have been functional.

title: GREAT IROQOIS!
text:
AMAZING STAFF AND LOCATION! The Iroquois Hotel was very clean and the location on 44th Street is superb!!!!!!! Our room was quiet, clean, and offered everything needed for a pleasant stay.
We would definitely go back. Again, AMAZING STAFF!!!!

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text:
I stay at the Iroquois frequently.  Depending upon rates, I stay sometimes in their smallest rooms and at other times the spacious Executive Suite.  In every stay, I am treated by name at check in and with a smile.  It is a gracious and sincere service, not fake like many "boutique" hotels can be.

The always-spotless rooms themselves are super comfortable.  The heated bathroom floors are marvelous on a cold NY day.  The bed linens are exceptional.  The pillows are clouds of joy.  The beds themselves are amongst the most comfortable I have ever slept in.  The bathroom toiletries are pleasant and there is a full range of them.

The hotel itself is not large and has a cosy feeling and is super quiet at all times of days and night.  The front rooms face 44th Street and can have some road noise like all of NYC, but 44th is not super busy as it terminates at Grand Central just a couple blocks down so I have never had issues.  The interior rooms have no NYC noises at all.

The best word I can use to describe the Iroquois is cosy.  I rarely use that for a hotel.  It is the warmest term I can apply to a space and the Iroquois deserves it.

I highly recommend this hotel.

title: 3rd Time at The Iroquois
text: This is our 3rd stay at the Iroquois.  We love this hotel. The location is perfect and the staff is the best. We found this hotel by accident and it is now our only place we will stay when we visit NYC.

title: Great location
text: Great location, clean and well-appointed room, close to most midtown locations, good diner nearby. Lovely heated floor in the bathroom! Front desk service was consistently excellent and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Still a favourite hotel
text:
Used to stay here a lot - great location & like it's boutiqueness.

A lot of re-modelling going on so no bar or restaurant.  It is pricey but think a few things are missing.  Is there a coffee machine?  Couldn't find one.  Promised bottle of water never arrived so a bit miffed to be stiffed with the cost of one from the minibar.

Had workmen making a lot of noise literally right outside my bathroom window which didn't wake me up but didn't feel particularly private in there.

Apart from water, front desk generally very good & helpful.

title: Holiday Vacation
text: The hotel was centrally located and the rooms were very quiet and clean.  Loved having the large tv and refrigerator in our room.  All the employees made us feel welcome and they were extremely helpful with our needs.  The perfect quant hotel with a family atmosphere which is hard to find in most hotels.  I would definitely recommend the hotel.

title: Nice but pricey
text: This used to be the cutest boutique hotel but since they’ve changed it, it’s just like all the rest except they don’t offer coffee. The location is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable but for the amount you are paying I don’t know if it’s worth the money.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: The Iroquois has a wonderful staff, greeted us with a smile every time. Rooms are very comfortable, slept well each night, no street noise to speak of. Very convenient location. Marble tile and counter tops in bath was a special touch. 2 elevators meant we seldom had to wait. An in-room coffee maker or coffee in the lobby would have been nice. Enjoyable experience. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Quaint Hotel with Superior Service & Staff
text: Great location, super clean, delightful staff. Located in the heart of the theatre district and shopping.  Rooms aren’t big but most aren’t in NYC. The staff is very helpful.  You can’t go wrong by staying here!

title: Perfect location for holiday travels in NYC
text: Great hotel for holiday sites! A few blocks from everything we wanted to see and so close to Grand Central. Staff was so nice and helpful. We were greeted with Proseco for a birthday celebration. This is my new favorite hotel for NYC!

title: Great Service
text:
One day I had difficulties while I was trying to reconnect to internet. but in general service was great!
The attention given by the people at the reception was excellent.
For sure I would stay there again.

title: Great Weekend in NYC
text: Great location to everything,  During holiday season, roads are closed down to allow people to walk to attractions, very confusing to Uber and Taxi drivers, but the staff instructed you to your understanding of how to get there from here, recommendations for dinner(close and delicious) a welcome when you came in from day/night trips with bottled water offers.when you returned exhausted!

title: What happened?!
text: A recent remodel stripped the Iroquois' lobby of all its charm.  It is completely generic, sterile, and a little cheap looking. Nothing inviting or interesting about it.  The rooms are still nice (though very small) with comfy beds and linens and nice showers.  It's such a great location and I like the rooms, so I'll probably stay there again, but I'll always miss the old lobby.  What a shame.

title: Generally, a perfect location.
text: There is a lot of construction in the hotel for new bathrooms, restaurant and bar. These amenities are currently missing and our stay was not up to par as a result. Once this hotel is back on track without construction, I believe it is a five star place to stay in a great location.

title: Iroquois Hotel
text: The Iroquois Hotel is in a perfect location, convenient to shopping and restaurants. The hotel is a boutique style hotel that gives a personal touch to each visitor. The staff went out of their way to help us and make our stay enjoyable. We loved staying there and plan on returning when we visit NYC again!

title: Boutique hotel near Harvard club
text:
We attended a wedding at the Harvard Club and stayed here. When making the reservation the staff was kind of cold- we received the same upon check in. 

The rooms were dark(we didn’t even know it was morning) and quiet. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. We think the bathroom tile was heated? That was a nice touch. 

Overall it was a good hotel to sleep in but we didn’t get the whole boutique welcoming feeling for a hotel we would have chosen on our own .

title: International Traveller
text: Lack of tea and coffee making facilities and room service not suited to someone on a different time zone. At this price your guests should not have to leave the room to get a bite to eat of a hot drink in your night time (which might be their day time)

title: Excellent hotel though disappointing this year.
text:
We stay at this hotel every year for Thanksgiving and love it. 
This year, the bar was closed, the restaurant was closed and there was no coffee in the lobby...no coffee in the rooms either. Not what we expect for a room that costs over $2,000 for 5 nights. The bar and restaurant were being renovated but the room rate should be based on certain amenities and if those amenities are not available, the rates should be adjusted to reflect the lower star level.
We'll stay again but this was a disappointing visit.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: We recently spent three nights at the hotel. It is a great location near  Bryant park and Times Square with about 60 rooms. Rooms are not large but well maintained. Service is what sets the hotel apart- staff are outstanding especially the concierge. The current downside is that there is no bar or restaurant but they are working on it. They will get you complementary coffee in the morning. Suggest the hotel provide coffee machines in the room.

title: Wonderful Experience at Iroquois
text: Found the Iroquois online   I loved the look of larger rooms and the location near Times Square but not right in the middl.  Th Iroquois did not disappoint   Quaint, quiet, clean and nice amenities   We loved the Executive Suite   Nice size for 3 people    Nice shower with rain shower and we loved the heated floors.   There were darkening shades.   Of course, like most in the city you could hear street traffic at some level but not bad or disturbing.    Front Desk Staff and doormen were fantastic and helpful.   The bar and restaurant were under construction but there was coffee available in morning along with a wonderful library to sit and enjoy.   (No worries on food as there is a wonderful dinner literally 3 or 4 doors down.   Also several bars, pubs within minutes.   Highly Recommend.

title: First Posting Ever so I must be impressed !
text: The staff are incredibly helpful,enthusiastic,genuine and just plain nice  ! Vanessa and Carlos are ambassadors deluxe who can never do enough to help. The location is perfect for everything ,with a Daniel Boulud restaurant next door, two blocks from Times Square , Birdland and Theatres.

title: Perfect location, staff and price
text: I have to say I regret not coming here to this hotel in New York City before, why ? First the location is perfect being 3 min walking for Time Square 3 min walking form Bryant Park and almost 15 min walking from Central Park. The rooms are super clean and the staff are very friendly and greeting always with smile, and before I forget the cost compare to what they provide is amazing really affordable cost and I hope they keep it the same. Really great experience  and 5 stars visit.

title: Excellent
text: Everything was perfect from the minute we arrived to once we left. Staff was very accommodating. The location was great, close to everything we planned on visiting. Stayed here previously and Will definitely return.

title: Lovely visit
text: We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was spacious and clean, and the bathroom had a separate tub and shower (which is rare for a city hotel). I personally thought it was a nice touch giving my toddler a present upon check in. It made him feel extra special. Unfortunately the bar was closed, but overall we had a wonderful stay.

title: Thank you for a great New York weekend!!!
text: This is my 4th weekend stay at the Iroquois New York and it just gets better all the time.  Love the location, Staff and can't wait to visit NYC again.  Also, my guests will also be booking in the Future.  A Big Thank You to ALL!!!

title: small but great
text: everything great except the place is small.  our room with 2 beds would be impossible for more than 2 people.  great staff.  fabulous location. hotel was undergoing a lobby remodel and had no art or plants or decor of any kind.  just as we were leaving, the new plants arrived...

title: Not what it once was!
text: Location is the best thing about this hotel. I’ve stayed prior remodel is a disappointment. Elevator broken, restaurant under construction nothing else offered, bar under construction nothing else offered. Room not

title: Buen hotel y céntrico
text:
Buen hotel muy céntrico para visitar la ciudad. Las habitaciones cómodas y funcionales,  a destacar el baño con plato de ducha. 
Los empleados siempre te tratan con una sonrisa y son muy amables y simpáticos

title: IROQUOIS...WHERE IS YOUR HEART AND WHERE IS YOUR SOUL?
text:
This could have been a great stay but with no doorman to help on at least two ccassions which caused a situation that 
made me have a lot of pain  but even when the hotel knew a problem had happened there was a lackadaisical attitude that actually msde the situation worst. They knew i was a nice guy a good tipper and well like by a lot of guests because of my sharing of travel tips in NYC.

title: A personable boutique hotel
text: Great location.  Very attentive and friendly staff.  Comfortable, though small size rooms that are recently updated with nice amenities.  Hotel is currently in the midst of reconstruction so no restaurant or bar on premise; although many in very close proximity.  The location for theaters is Supreme....very close, but not in the melee of people and traffic.  And as stated, the staff is exceptional.  Only downside is the price - it is a "boutique" hotel.

title: New York! Great stay!
text: Excellent stay in New York. Perfect location and fantastic hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean and had everything we needed. Front desk always on hand with helpful information and places to visit

title: I would highly recommend this hotel
text: The location was excellent.  The rooms and bathrooms were spacious for the price and compared to other properties in New York.  The staff was exceptional.  They printed out restaurants and Broadway Show schedules for us.  We will definitely stay there again.

title: Brown Water
text: Room and amenities were great, but bathing and brushing teeth was difficult due to the brown water.  It's a shame because the rest of the experience was good but when you're on business and you can't shower, that's a problem.

title: Excellent Hotel!  Excellent Service!
text: This is a great hotel, with a wonderful staff. Would highly recommend to all my business associates, friends and family. Love the location and the facilities that is why this is my preferred hotel in NY.

title: First time at the Iroquois
text: I have stayed in this area of NYC when travelling here for business before, but this was my first time at the Iroquois.   I chose it because it was convenient to my meetings, reasonably priced (for a major city), but also I was looking to stay at a smaller hotel with a bit more character.   I was not disappointed.  I enjoyed the stay very much.  The staff was great.   Room spacious with a nice desk for getting work done.  The bed was very comfortable.  I left for EWR at 0500, but check out was smooth and the doorman hailed a cab for me and loaded my bags into it.   I would definitely stay here again.

title: A Very good stay!
text:
We had drinks at the Algonquin next door one evening and frankly I
prefer the Iroquois. The lobby is pleasant and quieter, not like Grand Central!
The rooms at the Iroquois are small but that's NY. Clean and comfortable, very pleasant & helpful staff.

title: Lovely Hotel in an excellent location
text:
The staff here is very friendly and helpful, without being over bearing. 

Despite the fact the hotel was under refurbishment, the rooms were very quiet and well appointed. 

Price was very reasonable, and the Location is essentially unbeatable.

title: Nice, friendly, small hotel
text: Hotel is in a great location with an attentive staff.  Rooms are clean and convenient.  The hotel lacks certain amenities, but that was because the restaurant was being renovated at the time of the stay.  Otherwise, the convenient location makes it an ideal choice.

title: Never again
text: Checkin was unreasonable. We arrived very early and were asked to come back later, basically no problem. When we came back later, we were put off because the suite was not ready yet, ok too. Only on demand we were told 12.00 o'clock. When we returned we were told that the suite had only just been cleared. We would be notified by telephone. On the hint that I hadn't brought my German phone to the USA - acceptable - an email notification was offered. We didn't get any notification and didn't come to our suite until late in the evening. Back in Germany it turned out that we probably got an SMS on our German number, a pity ... Why couldn't we be told immediately in the morning that we couldn't get the suite until 3 pm? Other hotels can do that too, offer alternatives and at least a coffee. Here the service was impolite, incompetent and we didn't feel like a guest but only a supplicant. For us it was clear: never again! For April 2020 we have now booked somewhere else.

title: Great boutique hotel!
text: Clean and quiet and located close to T Sq., plays, shopping, Grand Central Metro North and 9 blocks from Penn Station and Amtrak. Fantastic! Recommend-would stay again. Will be glad when their restaurant reopens.

title: Iroquois
text: We could not have had a better stay.  great location, very helpful and friendly staff.  Very clean and nice.  they try and help you in any way possible.  Know all the local place for great meals and can get you and where in the city

title: מיקום מעולה וחדרים מרווחים
text:
מלון מקסים ולא גדול, 12 קומות בלבד.... החדר מרווח, כולל חדר ארונות נוח וחדר רחצה מאובזר ונוח.
מיטה נוחה מאוד, מצעים נעימים ושקט למרות הקרבה המאוד נוחה לשדרה החמישית והשישית.
בזמן ששהיתי הבר והמסעדה היו בשיפוץ, זה לא הפריע אבל חבל שלא יצא לי לסעוד שם.
אבל ליד יש שפע מסעדות מצויינות לארוחת בוקר או ערב.
הביקורת היחידה שלי על המלון שאין ערכת קפה/ תה בחדר, אין קומקום וכך כל ערב כשהגעתי למלון נאלצתי להזמין קנקן מים חמים... זה פתרון זמני כי המים בקנקן מתקררים מהר....

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois, a beautiful boutique hotel located in the heart of the theater district. It is easy walking distance from Time Square, Central Park, MOMA, Carnegie Hall, Bryant Park, countless good restaurants, and much more. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff was polite, welcoming, and very helpful. We will definitely stay here again!
Richard and Sarah

title: Our new first choice for NYC visits!
text: Great location, room was stylish and reasonably sized, great sleep accommodations- excellent diner two doors away and the theater district around the corner. Have stayed in several other hotels in the area and the Iroquois met or surpassed the quality of those rooms at a better price and location.

title: Fantastic New York
text: Fantastic location, one block from theaters. Services extraordinary. Great bed confort.  The Bistro fabolous, every plate were unique and detailled. Definately returning soon. To improve room space in case you are travelling with several suitcases

title: Really Great Place To Stay In New York City
text: The Iroquois Hotel is great hotel in New York City.  Our king deluxe room was very nicely appointed.  It had been completely updated and was very, very clean.  It is in a great location, just two blocks from Times Square.  It is far enough away from Times Square to avoid the noise and the crowds.  It is close to the theaters and lots of great restaurants.  This is where we will stay when we return to New York City.

title: Can not say enough great things about this hotel
text: Super-clean, quiet, luxurious, well-appointed room with heated bathroom floor and staff that was always willing to help or answer questions with a smile.  Great location in midtown.  You can easily walk to Grand Central Station and other subway stations, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and the NY Public Library, the Garment  and Theater Districts.  Close enough to Times Square, but away from the chaos.   I will definitely stay here on my next visit to NYC.

title: The Irresistible Iroquois
text:
Wonderful attentive staff. Spotless boutique hotel in mid town. Old New York feel with contemporary services. The restaurant was closed due to renovations but the staff went out of their way to accommodate us for room service. 
The location is perfect . Minutes from time square , yet private. A beautiful little haven.

title: Vanessa - Chef Concierge
text:
I am writing in regards to my wonderful experience with Ms. Torruellas.  I worked with Vanessa on arranging a birthday amenity for my husband who checked in today (his birthday). Right from the start, Vanessa was pleasant, responsive and very helpful.  I had corresponded with her a few times to update her on Matthew's arrival time, specific likes, etc.  Again, always very responsive.  I had very specific requests for his amenity and it was executed perfectly.  Additionally, being a Convention Services Manager, I really appreciated her follow up. Vanessa even emailed me pictures and made sure it was delivered promptly at 3:00pm.

As someone who has worked in hotels for 10+ years, I truly value genuine customer service and that is what Vanessa provides. It was very refreshing as sometimes, as I am sure you know, it is rare to find. Please make sure she gets the recognition and praise she deserves.

Thank you to Vanessa and to the rest of your team for helping make my husband's birthday special!

title: Perfect Location for this Boutique Hotel
text: A few friends shared a suite and connecting room for our 5 day stay in the City.  This location is perfect as its centrally located to everything, and an easy short walk to theaters.  The staff goes out of their way to greet you and meet your every need.  The rooms were very clean well appointed and the beds extremely comfortable. We were return guests and will return again. Thank you Hotel Iroquois for your excellent hospitality!

title: The best Hotel !
text:
The best Hotel in NYC.

The bed and pellows are to die for. 

Th Hotel Staff are so helpful and always with a smile.

The location is incredible.

The bathroom is in a good size.

I want a bed just like that in my house !!

Is the best choice!!

title: Vintage Midtown
text:
J’étais venu à l’Iroquois il y a 30 ans car c’était la résidence new-yorkaise des Clash . Mon retour récent fut plus que concluant . Les rénovations parviennent à conserver l’âme de l’endroit avec des matériaux modernes . L’élégance fifties est conservée en particulier avec le mobilier et les photos vintages( Irving Penn?). De même pour les salles de bain , la touche rétro opere à merveille. Par ailleurs les chambres sont spacieuses et les lits confortables. L’Iroquois ne possède pas le lobby historique de son frère Algonquin mais l’accueil et le personnel sont charmants
Je recommande sans réserve

title: Girls Trip
text: We had a wonderful time in NYC.    The hotel staff was fantastic.  They helped us with all our questions.  The location is Great.  Very Safe walking to Time Square and 5th Ave.  We walked 24737 steps in one day!!!    We will be back!!

title: Little gem of a hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text:
A perfect location just off Times Square so you're very close to the hustle and bustle but without the noise. We upgraded to a Superior King Room which had an absolutely enormous bed. The room and bathroom were a good size and very well soundproofed, we didn't hear any other guest's TVs, showers, conversations or footsteps unless they walked directly past our door. The internet was strong and we had usb chargers in our bedside tables-a great touch, as was the heated bathroom floor. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we didn't have a view like some people have said but we really only used it to sleep in and prefer peace and quiet so it didn't bother us, neither did the lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room, although the front desk staff did say we were welcome to come to the lobby for complimentary hot drinks and water. We thought this was a really good compromise by the hotel considering their bar and restaurant are still under renovation.
The staff were all very friendly and greeted us with a smile. We both felt we would rather stay in this fantastic little unique hotel than the larger resort style ones, particularly when you spend most of your time out in the city. When we return to the New York this would be our first choice.

title: 60th Birthday Celebration
text: My first visit to the US to celebrate my 60th Birthday, I booked the Iroquois as it looked charming and the reviews were still excellent despite undergoing renovations . I was not disappointed , yes the room was small with two Queen sized beds , but so comfortable and spotlessly clean , very quiet despite being in the centre of the city. Staff very friendly and helpful. Recommend this hotel to everyone planning a New York trip .

title: Great Hotel.  Great location
text: We just returned from a great weekend in NYC.  We stayed two nights at the Iroquois New York and found it a great place to stay and a wonderful location for Broadway, museums, restaurants, and all the other fun things to do in midtown manhattan.  Highly recommended.

title: Concierge Venessa is a jewel.
text: First stay at the Iroquois and would definitely stay there again.  Very clean throughout; very quiet. Friendly staff, especially the concierge Vanessa, who directed us, advised us, answered any questions--truly a godsend for our week. Location on 44th is so close to Theatre District and Times Square..

title: I almost gave them 4 stars until...
text:
The hotel is pleasant. The newly renovated suite was nice and definitely value for money. Also the other rooms we booked were great. But like the suite, the entire hotel was boring in design  and hard it is to understand why you would make such poor choices in color and furniture when you are updating your hotel. 

Amenities as a coffee maker, bottles of water in the room and fresh flowers were missing. Bathroom was tiny for a suite but functional and a had good rain shower.

Staff was friendly and efficient and location is great.  So far so good and a reason to come back.

The hotel is renovating and we knew that, and we tried to be flexible and understanding when elevators were blocked or working crew was irritated and not very friendly when we got back after dinner. I was understanding when they wet vacuumed the hallway on the 12th floor, had noisy heat blowers in front of my suite to dry the carpet and that we were informed that the sauna and fitness was also undergoing maintenance and not accessible.

This review would have been positive regardless that the complimentary wifi is not working very well and sometimes not working at all.

This review turned bad when on the last night I received a letter under the door. This letter was informing all rooms and suites on the 12th floor that someone had been smoking and that management was investigating and that you would be confronted with a $350 fine if you had smoked in your room. They also asked to report if you saw someone smoking.

I am a non smoker , I don’t like it when other people smoke, but I also think it is a huge mistake of management to decide to approach the issue the way they did. You sort of Make everybody a possible suspect. It leaves me with a bad taste and it is a horrible customer experience.

Especially when you consider that the whole day they were wet vacuuming the hallway and then had noisy massive heat blowers in the hallway without any written heads up from management. Apparently the hotel is more busy policing the guests than they are interested to ensure the guests have a flawless experience.

So purely based on this letter I most likely would not choose to stay at Iroquois in the future. I don’t like to be considered a suspect! Solve guest issues in a different way. #unprofessional #1203

title: Great location, clean rooms but...
text: Great central location, nice, clean, small, quiet rooms (no view at all). We travelled as a family and had booked a room for three persons - however we were not told that there would be no room for a roll away bed and that two persons were expected to share one double bed - the lack of a good sleep for those two did impact the whole experience. Also, the hotel currently has no bar or restaurant due to renovation (not expected to finish until January despite claims on their website that it will be done "in the fall". They apparently offer complimentary prosecco at reception but they keep this a secret so if interested, remember to ask as information will not be volunteered. Really missed tea and coffee making facilities in the room and the hotel even charge for bottle water (which is typically complimentary in other hotels).

title: Very nice hotel
text: Great location, clean rooms, felt updated and was still undergoing some renovations. Restaurant was still closed for improvements. Staff were friendly and courteous. I would most likely return on next visit to NY.

title: A hotel so nice, I had to stay there twice! Don't worry about the rennovations.
text:
Cheesy title aside. This is definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed in, the good experience started even before checking in. All the inquiries that I've sent by email were answered in a very courteous and prompt manner. I could sense the friendliness from the simple emails, unlike the usual curt manner that's most common in NYC properties. So, kudos DJ for the great correspondence.

My entire experience at the hotel was very positive, everyone treats you in a friendly and professional manner at the same time. In my second stay at the property, I was pleasantly surprised to find a personal note, a chocolate bar and a bottle of wine as a compliment from the wonderful staff.

The staff alone makes this property a very highly recommended one add to it the great location and nice facilities. The rooms are very clean, everything works the way it's supposed to. Meanwhile, the renovations didn't inconvenience me at all.

Will certainly stay there whenever I'm in the city and I highly recommend the property.

title: Triste
text:
Accueil très triste pas un sourire
Bar fermé pour rénovation sans aucune substitution et surtout sans être prévenu.
Petit déjeuner uniquement entre 7h00 et 8h00.
Chambre très calme et très propre.  A revoir

title: Disappointing stay
text: We had stayed here before and loved this hotel however this time room was dark renovations meant no bar or breakfast area and they still charged same rate. Reception staff were not very helpful and we will not stay here again

title: Five-star luxury and a wonderful renovation
text: We recently stayed at the Iroquois for the second time and loved the new look! We stayed in our usual Premium Queen room so we could wake up and look out at the Chrysler Building each morning. As always, every staff member was kind and courteous, from the front desk to housekeepers and maintenance staff. We can't wait to see the new bar and restaurant on our next visit

title: Efficient and Nice
text: Small room, but very clean and comfortable.  The space is organized in a very efficient manner.  For the price, a window that looked up something other than a concrete wall would have been nice.  Wi-Fi could have been better for work VPN purposes.  I really appreciated the free water bottles upon arrival.  Other than the notes above, very comfortable.

title: Love this place
text: It’s unassuming, low-key luxe. Easily one of the best maintained and clean hotels I’ve stayed at and always consistently friendly and high quality. There is still construction going on, so it can get noisy after 9 during the week depending on your room...but that will pass.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: We stayed overnight for an event in NYC. The room was clean and newly renovated. We had a quiet room on the 9th floor.  The lobby has been updated as well. The bar/lounge was closed as it is undergoing upgrades, but there are plenty of nearby places to grab a cocktail and a bite to eat. Great location for Broadway shows and midtown attractions. The staff was very attentive and made us feel like special guests rather than tourists. Our daughter was meeting us and arrived early. They made her feel welcome and let her stay in the room until we arrived. Traffic in the area is difficult, so  don't drive there if you can avoid it.  Reasonably priced. We would definitely stay there again!

title: Cozy Hotel
text:
Yes, the Iroquois is small, but you’ll probably enjoy it. 

The Pros: “reasonably” priced, quiet, clean, close to everything, a bowl of citrus fruit in the front desk (clementines, I think), complimentary chocolate bar and small bottle of wine, slippers, two robes, and a generally polite staff.

The Cons: a Queen-sized bed, tiny rooms (maybe 200 sq ft including the bathroom), and two windows completely darkened out so you can’t see anything outside. 

Yes, it’s worth the visit.

title: Bday weekend in NY
text: Birthday weekend in NYC. Stayed here many times previously. Like the location as it’s close the theaters.  Disappointed that the bar and restaurant on premises were under construction. Rooms are clean, but small.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for two nights. The rooms have recently been renovated which really shows. We had a lovely modern room and very pleased that the wardrobe was big enough to fit our suitcases which cleared space in the room. The service from the staff was fantastic- everyone was helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Hotel ordered us a car to the airport. Location of the hotel is great for exploring Manhattan. We would definitely return.

title: Family Holiday
text: Lovely hotel in a great area.  Only minutes from Time Square but also a quiet location.  The room had two double beds a little small, but clean.  Lovely staff all very helpful especially Vanessa.  Lovely doormen, very helpful.

title: Great location and very clean and refreshing!
text: We were very pleased with our stay at the Iroquois.  As some has stated, the rooms are small but that's fine with us.  The staff was EXCELLENT!  Anna was extremely helpful during our stay.  We, and our friends, highly recommend the Iroquois.  Great little find in the theater district!

title: Everytime the perfect stay!
text:
Wir waren jetzt das zweite Mal im Iroquis und werden auch sicher nächstes Jahr wieder buchen! Die Stimmung ist so familiär, ganz untypisch für ein 4 Sterne Haus! Dazu sind die Zimmer immer sauber, die Minibar gefüllt. Ich bin schon sehr gespannt, wie die Bar 'The lantern' nach dem laufenden Umbau aussehen wird!
Ein spezielles Danke wieder an die Consierge Vanessa!!

title: Wonderful Hotel with Great Staff
text: We stayed here as part of a birthday celebration.  The staff was amazing and went above and beyond to make it a special night.  They wrote a personalized card and sent us free goodies.  Not to mention the room was perfect and spacious and the location was surrounded by amazing restaurants.  Highly recommend.

title: Good location, comfortable sleep and great service
text: Extremely  comfortable bed and nice size room with everything I needed.  Very large bathroom. Comfortable room and amenities.  Very pleasant and helpful staff with great doormen.  I appreciated the free overnight shoe shine.

title: Christmas in NYC Bachelorette Party
text:
Pros:
Awesome for groups
Large rooms
Updated bathrooms
Friendly staff
Cons:
Slow elevators 
Limited restaurant hours
No pool
Several girls and I stayed in the executive suite with the connection to the premium king room! The two rooms gave us over 1000 square feet of space, basically unheard of for NYC hotel rooms. The rooms & bathrooms have been recently updated, the heated tile floor was a very unique touch.. the girls all loved it! We stayed here for a Christmas in New York Bachelorette Party!

title: Very nice hotel in a great neighborhood
text: Traditional hotel with friendly staff. Our room was nicely furnished and - compared to former experiences in New York hotels- quite spacious. The restaurant and parts of the lobby are maintained in present, so we were having breakfast and dinner elsewhere. The hotel is located very central in close neighborhood to Times Square, but our room was very quiet. Altogether we were very satisfied.

title: Where there is light, there is also shadow
text: very good beds, poor cleanliness, poor internet (wifi), staff willing & very friendly but not able to solve mentioned problems; excellent location. Will not stay there again, if you need a hotel without "the extra mile" good choice

title: Nothing really special about this stay.
text: The room was clean and comfortable, but small, and the hotel had a good central location.  Our room was not made up on the first day, although we left the room at 10:00 am.  The concierge was very helpful and she had good information on places and how to get around the City.  Other than that, there is nothing else to recommend about the hotel.

title: Perfekt beliggenhet og koselig hotell.
text: Stille sidegate til Times Sauare. God service. Kort vei til teater, shopping, mat og parker. Litt mye venting på treig heis. Restauranten var under oppussing, men hyggelig diner like ved. To store gode senger på vårt rom.

title: Comfort in Manhattan
text: Enjoyed a lovely stay at the Iroquois, a small boutique hotel.  The rooms were very clean and well appointed; the bed was very comfortable and noise was at a minimum.  The staff were very professional and courteous and were quick to provide any assistance when needed.  The location was superb - very close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal, and a 20 minute walk to Central Park.  Would definitely re-book. This property in the future.

title: A hotel that loves its guests
text:
This is a really great hotel.  Old-fashioned in all the best ways - no hip trappings and funky lighting, no undisclosed 'facilities charge' (a currently fashionable scam among NYC hotels which I can only hope one day results in a class action lawsuit), just a good honest concern for the welfare of its guests. It feels like a slice of an earlier NYC.
The staff are excellent - friendly, informal, always ready to help and creative in dealing with unforeseen issues.   Seriously, you can ask these people for anything and they'll find a way.
My room was recently refurbished and immaculately appointed in retro 1960s brown and beige, Norman Parkinson 1940s/50s Vogue photographs, enormous and wonderful tiled bathroom (with a tub - hooray), plentiful towels and thick bathrobes.  Much attention has been paid to the bed (it always amazes me that so many hotels skimp on what is, after all, the main point of staying in a hotel) - it is huge and wonderfully comfortable.
NB.  Renovations are currently underway at The Iroquois, and so the hotel is running at half speed - no bar or restaurant.  The desk staff were apologetic but clearly excited about what the place will be like once the work is done - and I share their enthusiasm.  Meanwhile, the sheer charm, value, efficiency and comfort of this place is enough to merit a 5* review even without the bells and whistles.
I visit NYC a lot, and have tried a lot of different hotels.  In its philosophy of care and evocation of an older NYC, the hotel which the Iroquois most recalls for me is the The Mark on 77th/Madison but at ¼ the price.  My only reservation is that the Times Square radius is not my favourite area of NYC, but The Iroquois can't really help that and it's going to be my regular bolt hole in Manhattan from here on.

title: Beware.  This property was being renovated!  N
text: I really was shocked to see the the hotel was being renovated!  I couldn't even get a cup of coffee.  The located was good, but like I said.......they should have been upfront!  Also, they charge you $50.00 a day for "incidentals".  No "incidentals" were used (wet bar etc) and I'm still waiting for this amount to be subtracted from MY BILL!

title: Great location for Mid-Town
text: Nice, well appointed room with a comfortable bed. Staff were helpful and the Doormen were great, even remembering our names to welcome us back to the hotel on the second night. Only slight negative was the lack of tea or coffee in either the room or hotel, as the hotel bar/restaurant is being renovated this Autumn. Location was excellent and the rooms were quiet - a real plus in this part of NYC!

title: Location is great
text: Hotel is small, but acceptable. The elevator was a bit slow.  Room was very clean and was attended to very well everyday.  The street is quiet even though it is only 2 blocks off Times Square.  I would stay there again.

title: Needs to adopt eco-friendly practices
text: Rooms were excellent, as was the staff and location.  Our only issue was lack of a way to re-use clean towels, too many tiny single use plastic bottles of soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc, and no recycle bin.  We had to use the "do not disturb" sign to avoid having clean towels laundered and reduce the large number of tiny plastic bottles in the bathroom. (even though we would have liked to have the room cleaned)  Many quality hotels have already adopted these eco-friendly practices.

title: Misleading website info
text: Great location, great staff, but NO amenities - NO bar, NO resto, NO coffee, only one working but very SLOW elevator, and NONE of this is ever mentioned on the website or by the hotel when you are making the reservation - really not acceptable for the price paid for this hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: We were extremely impressed with this heritage boutique hotel. Excellent location close to Times Square and the theatre district. The room was small but very comfortable. The standout was the staff, their attention to detail and excellent communication skills made our stay delightful.

title: Ladies' Nioght Out
text: Lovely old NY hotel on a historical street.  Very convenient to the theater we went to, but so much nicer to be off of Times Square., which most NYer's don't much like.  Room was small, clean and the bed was sooo comfortable. Everyone made us feel special, andthe upgrade was the best of all. Could have been a headache if Vanessa hadn't helped out.

title: Ótimo Hotel e localização maravilhosa
text: Estive no Iroquois esse mês. A localização do Hotel é maravilhosa, a poucos passos da 5a Avenida. O staff é muito atencioso e solícito. Cama muito confortável!  Fiquei num quarto bastante silencioso, coisa rara em Nova York... Recomendo bastante!

title: Excellent Hotel with World Class Customer Service
text: The hotel is outstanding (recently renovated), great location and world class customer service, Vanessa and her team made our stay a memorable one. Will definitely stay at The Iroquois when we visit NYC.

title: Great midtown location
text:
On this trip we planned to see two Broadway plays and take a walking tour in the area. Previously we’ve stayed farther out and when the theaters let out its a long, crowded haul back. Hence the decision to stay here: quick walk to and fro.  We like a smaller hotel with old world charm and enjoyed our stay. As other people have noted, the renovation work makes the lobby look like an apartment building and there’s no restaurant or even drinks available (as was stated on the website). We missed having a coffee maker/tea kettle in the room. (The fridge is full of costly things we don’t drink.) A few times we had hot water brought to our room so we could make our own tea~adequate but hardly luxurious.

The room itself was of good size, comfortable and quiet with a generous closet with shelving and a safe. Bathroom was exceptionally nice: very roomy with useful shelves and extra long towel bars. A make up mirror and windows that open also a bonus. Staff we encountered seemed friendly although some were new and not that knowledgeable. I wanted to try the sauna but it was closed. To print boarding passes I had to email the front desk so they could print them.

Location was great. Easy to walk or take the bus and/or subway to places of interest. Found nice (but expensive) restaurants close by to eat. I look forward to seeing the renovation of this lovely place completed to provide a more comprehensive hotel experience.

title: Short stay
text:
It was our second visit to New York after our Cruise in August. We wanted to stay in a different location a few blocks way than our first hotel. 
A couple of days before we arrived we checked trip advisor for location & nearby restaurants.  We discovered there was building work. 
Upon arrival met by the doorman who accommodated our luggage. Checkin smooth.
The lobby was very small due to the construction and only one elevator. 
There was no water or coffee facilities reception. 
Our room on the third floor was two queen beds. Very tastefully decorated and a nice compact bathroom. However we did have a lot of luggage this proved tricky as the room was quiet small.   
There was a stocked mini bar & on top a tray with snacks. However no coffee machine or free water. 
I feel that a hotel of this standard could take away the snack tray & provide a krups coffee machine and water. 
The room was at the end of a corridor and therefore relatively quiet.
We were not notified at all by our third party booking agent Hotels.com that this hotel was under renovation. 
I would recommend this hotel when the building work is complete.

title: Wait until renovations are done
text: This is a very convenient hotel and I have stayed here before.  This time it was under renovation, so there was only one small elevator and no restaurant.  Check  before you book.  I am sure it will be very nice again when the renovations are finished.  The location is wonderful.

title: Wonderful location
text: The Iroquois hotel is close by the famous Algonquin.  It is a smaller boutique hotel with small but stylish rooms and great front desk service, Unfortunately, when I stayed there in early September, the lobby area was quite cramped, and the restaurant/bar was closed to remodeling.  I would enjoy staying there again as it is very centrally located to other places I wanted to visit.

title: BE AWARE OF RENOVATION WORK
text: This is a lovely hotel in a fabulous location with lovely staff. However, there is extensive renovation work going on to improve bar/restaurant area with a stud wall cutting off the entrance. A bit of a shock when we arrived as it looks disappointing and dated. Tom the lovely manager told me they keep asking booking.com to let people know and nothing has been done to alert visitors. I had booked this hotel months ago and would not have done so if i had known this ... plus no tea or coffee making facilites in room. There is an excellent diner three doors down but expectations need to be managed. Ask Vanessa for advice as she is brill, Tom is excellent manager and Carlos the door man is also lovely.

title: Better than Ever Boutique
text: We stay here whenever we are in midtown but hadn’t been about 2years.  We were surprised to see the lobby in the midst of remodeling but you’d never know it from its pristine condition.  Construction is being kept out of sight.  Rooms look great with new everything including the bathrooms. Luxurious details throughout.  Staff is always great and eager to help. Iroquois is a great place close to everything!  Walk to shows, world class 5th Avenue shopping, fabulous NY Public library, and Rock Ctr to name a few.

title: Under construction
text: Under construction, the hotel is limited with only one elevator, and no food or coffee service.  Good thing there was a Gregory's Coffee across the street.  Still, great service and well appointed and very clean rooms

title: Perfect location, great rooms
text: Three of us were in town for a broadway show and I booked at the Iroquois. The location is ideal if you are coming in at Grand Central. It’s just far enough from Times Square to have a quiet night but a short walk to the theater district. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were clean. The beds were very comfortable. I will stay here again.

title: Great location, service and staff
text: We spent 5 nights here visiting the city. We wanted to be close to Times Square and the theaters. It was a short walk to these places and to the subway stations that could get us to other parts of Manhattan and to Brooklyn so the location is quite convenient. All of the hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a smile by the desk staff and Vanessa the concierge daily. The rooms were on the small side but a good size for NYC. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The restaurant/bar are currently being remodeled but there are so many restaurants nearby. We will stay here again on our next visit.

title: Very nice hotel, great staff!
text:
Excellent location, very nice hotel, clean and nice smelling, with a great staff - welcoming, smiling, helping with any request (especially Mrs. Vanessa, the Chef Concierge). 
Looking forward to see the new look of the hotel after the current transformation that is happening now.

title: Just perfect
text: Have been staying here over the years and although the rooms are small, the hospitality just gets larger all the time. All of the staff we encountered in the most recent visit were just so low-keyed and unpretentious, but caring and professional. Miss the bar and dining room, can't wait for them to re-open (the bar was great for meetings at cocktail hour) but in the meantime, a great home in NY.

title: best location in the city away from the crowds at Time Square and yet in the heart of the theatre district.
text: Location location location. Theatre, shopping and restaurants are right out your door. Staff makes for a warm and inviting stay, the beds and pillows are divine and the rooms are immaculate. The name small luxury hotel nails it!

title: NYC Getaway
text: The Iroquois was recommended to us by my sister-in-law. We were headed to NYC for a show and a visit to the 9/11 memorial. The location was convenient to the theater district and Time Square and was an easy cab ride to the memorial. Our first experience with the hotel began with our doorman, John, who assisted us with our bags and vehicle. The hotel desk staff were friendly and helpful with our couple of questions. We found our room to be very clean and spacious enough for our stay. Close by the hotel is a coffee shop and newly renovated diner. Our visit ended with our doorman, Carlos, who was helpful in retrieving our vehicle and very personable. Great visit and highly recommended.

title: The Best Kept Secret in a Big City
text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.  While the room itself was small, it was perfect for 2 people.  It looks as though rooms were renovated not too long ago.  Very clean & very comfortable beds.  The location of the hotel was perfect. It was on 44th between 5th & 6th with close proximity to the Broadway theatre district.  The staff was very friendly & helpful.

title: Great Stay!!
text: I love staying at The Iroquois. Location and convenience are not always one and the same in a large city, especially when on business. The Iroquois is centrally located to shopping, restaurants and the Javits Center. The quality of service and accommodations is exceptional and I stay there whenever I come to NYC whether for business or pleasure!!

title: Nice hotel
text: Nice, efficient, clean hotel very close to Times Square.  Doors closing in hallway were a bit on the noisy side.  Bathroom was extremely clean, as was the room.  Particularly liked the radiant heat in the bathroom floor.  Would stay here again.

title: The Wedding Dress Trip
text: We all came in to go wedding dress shopping for my daughter. We needed a hotel that could accomodate us and be comfortable! The hotel was very central. Every staff member was courteous. The rooms were clean! Beds comfortable.Our stay was overnight. Great experience! I would highly recommend it!

title: Anniversary Celebration
text: Premium King was perfect. Request a view of 44th street. Champagne in the room to help us celebrate was a nice touch. Use the concierge. Vanessa was very helpful. Our location was perfect for walking to theaters, Times Square, and fine restaurants. Pack an umbrella just in case of rain.

title: Terrible!
text: Have stayed in NYC many many times and yes we are all used to the fact Hotel rooms are smaller in NY. Arrived 830pm for what should have been a 7 night stay. The room was so bad that the next morning at 5am I had to call my company travel team to move me out. The door opened onto the bed and  what was meant to be a window was a brick wall. What they called a room was little more then a closet/box! Not even a dog would be expected to stay in such a room. Once I shows the travel team the pictures they could my believe the “prison cell”. When I checked out I was not even asked why I was leaving and cancelling my stay! Says it all! And have made sure our corporate travel company are aware no one should be booked in such a place!

title: Return stay
text:
Have stayed in this hotel a few times before , but not for some time
First of all the hotel is undergoing renovations ( not mentioned anywhere)
Only one elevator working, make one wait a long time both up and down
The hotel in the past offered free coffee in the lobby in the morning.unfortunatly-this has been stoped
Otherwise, a very nice stay, rooms clean and we’ll equipped

title: Anniversary
text: We had a wonderful time and all of the employees were extremely nice. Vanessa the concierge was the best concierge we have ever had and we have traveled all over the world.  it is perfectly located to see shows.

title: 5 star for everything
text: Our first time to New York from New Zealand. We arrived from San Francisco at 9am in the morning and I was sick and we didn't think we would be able to check in so early but I was too sick to do anything else. The staff quickly made a room ready for us and had a manager check the room first before we checked in and I was able to spend the day in bed. This boutique hotel is 5 star. Beautiful rooms, Super King Bed, luxurious bedding and pillows and the cleanest Hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in hundreds of hotels. The location is incredible. Walk left to 5th Ave for shopping or turn right for Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is quiet, just far enough from Times Square that you don't get the noise. We will definitely be staying here next time we come to New York. Thank you to the staff that acted quickly to check us in early. Your service and Hotel is impeccable.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The hotel is lovely and in a great location. Not a far walk to the theater district or time square.  The room was very comfortable and clean and the beds were very comfortable.  We loved the house slippers provided and the soaps were great and smelled good.  The tangerines in the lobby were a nice snack.  The staff was very nice and friendly.  This is a beautiful little hotel in a very nice location.  I have nothing negative to say about it.

title: A wonderful hotel close to the theater district
text: I have stayed at the Algonquin several times when visiting New York for theater. This time I decided to try something different but in the same neighborhood. I chose the Iroquois and I was so pleased with my choice. The room was well appointed and spotlessly clean each day of my visit. The hotel is quiet and not noisy and has a ;peaceful feel to it and I slept very well. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful as well. In short, it was a great hotel I would recommend to anyone and one that I will stay in the next time I am in New York

title: Best Hotel in Midtown!
text: Awesome, Amazing, the best!! Great hotel in this location, super clean rooms, friendly staff, an amazing experience. I highly recommend it for your next trip to the Big Apple without the slightest hesitation!!

title: This Place Was Super!
text:
We checked into the Iroquois early on Saturday, August 31 for 4 nights and had stayed next door at the Algonquin the night before due to a mix up on a flight change.  The staff here were very accommodating and held our bags for the day before our room was ready.  We were off to see the sites of NYC.  We received a call around 2:00 pm advising us that our room was ready.  We stayed in Suite 370.  The suite we were in was huge and everything in the room and central air conditioning worked as it should.  There was a mini-bar fridge stocked with items in the room with a small area for guest use.  Also noted, if you needed a fridge in your room for other items to store, guests would be accommodated.  We ordered one and a small fridge was delivered to the room and turned on.

Other comments about the room include shades and drapes that kept the room quite dark out when it was light outside.  This was very nice.  The beds were very comfortable with 4 large pillows on our king bed.  The only small inconvenience was ice needed to be ordered each time vs. having a machine located somewhere in the hotel for self-serve.  Also, there was a lobby / restaurant renovation going on while we were there which only allowed for one elevator to be in service.  This made wait times for the only elevator serving the building to be well over 3-4 minutes at times.

Overall, the room and hotel were excellent.  Vanessa, Tom and John were also very nice and had the perfect customer service skills.  Thank you all, we’ll be back.

title: Great hotel near to Times Square
text:
We chose the Iroquois because of its location and weren’t disappointed. An easy walk from Penn Station to the hotel and an easy walk from it to the sights. 

On check in we went directly to our room and were delighted to find some chocolates and wine to celebrate our wedding anniversary. A lovely and thoughtful touch. 

Our room was excellent and we weren’t affected by the building work at all. There was a short wait for the lift but not too bad. 

Definitely recommend and if we come back to New York will look to book again.

title: Hotel confortável e de localização privilegiada
text:
Hotel boutique localizado no coração de Manhattan, na Rua 44, entre a 5 e a 6 Avenidas. Muito próximo a Broadway. Super confortável e com um atendimento de primeira. Quarto com espaço maior do que a média dos hotéis nova-iorquinos.
Facilidade de estar ao lado da lanchonete Red Flame, farmácia e da loja Best Buy.
Enfim, uma mão na roda!!

title: Needs works completing
text: Despite reception, bar and restaurant being refurbished, still charging top dollar. Disappointed at speed of refurbishment, website at time of booking said it would be complete late summer, now says it will be in fall

title: Fantastic hotel
text: We stayed here for 5 nights and received excellent service. The location was also amazing. We cannot say a bad word about this hotel. It was clean, quiet, and the staff could not do enough for us. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York.

title: Part of the Trifecta
text: Staying at The Iroquois was part of an anniversary trip to see Dear Evan Hansen and dinner at Daniella’s. The Iroquois was everything we hoped it would be : upscale, with attention to detail, welcoming, impeccably clean and comfortable ! The staff was on top of their game as well. We’ll return!

title: Finish renovating asap please.
text: Only 1 elevator and no use of stairs.We had to always wait and constantly have full elevator pass us.No restaurant or bar.No business centre to print boarding passes.Staff was very helpful but couldn't help with lack of space.

title: Quiet hotel, close to everything
text:
Quiet, small hotel. Stay very pleasant.
Cute, small hotel- all accessories/necessities needed are available.
Great area- just a block away from the hustle and bustle.
Location was ideal- not far from Grand Central, also across from parking garage. So either which was is perfect in accommodating your travel preference. Hotel room was small but manageable- good size bathroom which I prefer to compromise some room space for.
Hotel also very clean.
Only complaint is there is just 1 elevator which runs slow when trying to accommodate 12 floors of guests.

title: Great boutique accommodations!
text: Hotel is in midtown and close to shopping and theater. The staff was very helpful and always pleasant. The rooms are small but well appointed with robes and slippers, safe, iron and ironing board in closet. Honor bar with refrigerator in room. Fruit at front desk. Very nice!

title: Great location, great service.
text: Check in was easy. Small lobby due to restaurant under construction. Down to one small elevator during this reno. Rooms were very clean, comfortable pillows and bed, classic robes and toiletries, great wifi, housekeeping responded quickly, friendly staff, reasonably quiet. All the basics done well, no extra luxury.

title: Ideal NYC hotel
text: Location, service, decor, etc. is all top notch! Although the restaurant/lobby is currently being renovated, the staff still did a great job making sure the inconveniences were minimal. Looking forward to returning after the renovations are completed this fall.

title: Class and Kindness
text: The Iroquois New York is a beautifully appointed hotel with equal helpings of class and charm. Like all properties going through renovations, there are some growing pains, but the kindness and helpfulness of the staff outweighs any issues you might encounter. We will definitely be back!

title: Staff friendly and helpful, rooms great
text: Stayed here two days in August. Staff went out of their way after they found out I was celebrating a birthday, but overall were all friendly and helpful (even cleaning staff). Room was very clean and well-kept. Location great. Single elevator for 12 floors not so great (LONG waits at times), and voucher for "breakfast" next door was nothing more than pastry and coffee -- chintzy for an expensive hotel. I'd definitely stay there again, but expect to pay a premium. Kudos to management for staff training, though -- best I've seen in NYC so far.

title: Disappointed by the management
text: There was a festival taking place the day I checked in. The roads around the hotel were closed to vehicles and even pedestrians. It literally took me an hour just to get into the hotel. Yet I had called the hotel twice that day before I arrived and they never said a word. When I told the manager that when I called they should have told me where to park and how to enter, but he just shrugged. His “so what” attitude was disappointing. I have stayed here before, and like the location, but I probably will stay somewhere else next time. Just a reminder Mr. Manager: there are other hotels in NYC.

title: OASIS DE CALME A MIIDTOWN
text:
Petit hotel idéalement placé, très calme et reposant, avec une literie extrêmement confortable et un personnel au top.
On s'est senti tellement bien dans cette petite chambre d'une propreté extreme.
Petite bouteille de vin et chocolats à l'arrivée avec une carte de bien venue. Séjour de rêve. Merci.

title: Comfortable & Good Value
text: This was only a one night stay but the room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. I had a good night's sleep and was ready for my business meetings the next day. I particularly appreciated the desk and power supplies accessible.

title: Great night sleep!
text:
Overall Great Experience... Only thing I could say is that an Additional elevator is needed, but we managed.
Honestly one of the best Sleeps we had in a while; Nice Size Bed,comfortable Mattress, & soft Bedding... Thank You!

title: Nice stay
text: Very good position just inside Times Sq., room standard size, my has small window without daylight (3rd floor), excellent bed, good service. Slow elevator. only 1 for all guests. For short trip very good

title: Quaint and Comfy!
text: Adorable 1900’s feel. Rooms are smaller, but beautifully decorated. Staff is super friendly and helpful with anything. Great for a couple to retreat from the world. Location is excellent, Just minutes from Times Square.

title: A great value in the perfect location
text: We have stayed at the Iroquois many times and enjoy the great location and good value.  The check in was slow this trip because there was only one person to assist guest.  VERY unusual based on past trips.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: The location is perfect.  The hotel is luxurious and I just love the staff.  They are the best. The hotel is right at Times Square and the theatre district. I always stay at the Iroquois when I'm in New York, because you get the intimate feel along with luxury.

title: Amazing Gem!
text: This is one of the nicest places I’ve stayed in NY. It has old world charm with modern conveniences. It’s bigger than most places I’ve stayed with a full closet and desk. The bathroom was lovely- beautiful tiles and great touches like a magnifying mirror. There were robes and slippers in the room and the bathroom floor was heated! All the front desk staff were upbeat and pleasant. My only regret is that I couldn’t stay longer!

title: Not really as advertised on Trip Advisor and not clear on the web site
text:
Ok so I should say upfront that we got a great deal on our stay there so if I were to balance what we paid with what was experienced then I’ve no complaints. 

My wonderful wife and I had a short break in NYC. This was following on from some US business trips we’d had. On arrival the staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming, so no complaints whatsoever with the staff. 

The hotel itself was not at all as was expected. The details here on TA suggest that the hotel has two bars and a restaurant. Well it might have had a while ago, they’re currently under refurb. Not just one of them. All of them. So if you want breakfast then you need to book with their ‘partner’ hotel next door, remember to chat to your mortgage advisor before leaving home though as you’re going to need the cash. 

Also, when you get back late at night from enjoying a show on broadway or the best Italian meal ever in Greenwich Village, don’t expect to grab a night cap, there’s NO bar, except the mini one in your room of course (don’t forget to consult that mortgage advisor). 

So never mind, there may not be a restaurant for breakfast, at least you can make yourself a coffee or tea in the morning with the ubiquitous tea and coffee making facilities in the room......oh hold on...... there’s none of those either..... really? ..... really? Yep sorry sir, need to order coffee from the hotel next door (did I mention the mortgage advisor?).

That said, the room was great, clean tidy, well maintained as you’d expect. But this is a hotel, in central New York, sorry but I expected better..

title: Fantastic 4 night stay!
text: We stayed at the Iroquois for 4 nights and loved it. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel was close to Times Square and fifth avenue but still very quiet in the room. The rooms were lovely and very clean. This was just what we needed for our stay in New York and would highly recommend it!

title: Boutique and delightful
text: Excellent service in all regards, especially concierge! Restaurant advice was impeccable. The boutique size of hotel allowed for greater personal treatment including map & directions and even choice of umbrellas!

title: Treat Yourself to a Wonderful Hotel and Staff
text:
We have always been pleased with our stays at any Triumph Hotel. It is a hotel group that you can rely on for comfort and extra-special attention. 

Our overnight experience at the Iroquois Hotel was lovely and went beyond our expectations. Each member of the staff was pleasant and accommodating; the rooms we booked were spotless and we had two very comfortable, quiet rooms. The hotel is in a fine location and will soon include a renovated bar/restaurant. 

Throughout our stay the staff was friendly and professional. We were even surprised with a kind note and birthday cupcakes and wine. It was such a special treat and surprise. 

P.S: Our only suggestion would be to offer complimentary coffee and a hook on the bathroom door for robes.

title: Lovely Midtown Hotel
text: I don't normally like to stay in midtown but I was very pleased with the quiet location.  The staff couldn't have been any nicer.  The room and bathroom were also nice but very small (especially the bathroom).   However, I did get the least expensive room available.  I would have given the room a higher rating if it and the bathroom had not been so small.

title: Very positive experience
text: You hardly can beat the price/quality of this location. Clean rooms, friendly staff, efficient service. The location at a walking distance of Tomes Square, Grand Central Station, and to Metro stations is particularly convenient.

title: The Wonderful Weekend at the Iroquois
text: I will stay at this hotel again. It was fantastic! The beds were super comfortable, the service was impeccable, it was super clean, and the location was great. We were able to walk to Broadway shows, great restaurants, and Central Park.

title: Recent Stay at Iroquois NY Aug 13-15 2019
text: The hotel is currently undergoing renovations so for regular visitors, the Library is no longer there nor is the  complimentary morning coffee and the restaurant is being re done. . Only one elevator is working and there seemed to be slight problems with the room keys not working. Aside from these issues, the hotel's location and atmosphere is excellent and the staff - especially Vanessa- is courteous, helpful and very obliging.We celebrated a special event and the hotel went outta their way to be extra nice and generously provided a complimentary bottle of bubbly. I would absolutist recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, friendly place
text: This hotel was perfect for us.  Perfect location, people were nice, convenient parking.  Rooms were small but bathroom was roomy.  I think this location is the best.  Close to Bryant Park, Grand Central and Broadway.

title: Great Mid-Town Place to Stay
text: Great Mid-Town Place to Stay. Close to the theaters, subway stops, and Grand Central. Very nice rooms that have been recently refreshed, quiet and cool environment. Staff is friendly and always helpful. Internet works great.

title: Excellent accommodations & service
text: Excellent accommodations & service. conveniently located. Close to Madison Ave and Time Square. Nice quite street on 44th. Staff is amazing and always welcoming. I have stayed there for work and pleasure. Free Coffee in the lobby in the morning and happy hour in the evening.

title: Quick trip to the city
text: Rooms were beautifully decorated and very clean. The bed was so comfortable, I never wanted to leave it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location, easy walking distance to Broadway theaters.

title: Great location but small rooms
text:
Great location, clean but only drawback was the size of the rooms. 
Very small and struggled to unpack two open cases at the same time 
Staff very helpful and friendly and knowledgeable of the New York area

title: A top notch stay
text: Stayed for 3 nights while on business.  Staff was very professional and courteous.  Rooms clean and comfortable. Great big bathrooms.  Close to it all but in a neighborhood setting. Good restaurants and bars very close. Quite nights and comfortable rooms. Would stay again.

title: dissapointed
text: i was disappointed with the lack of dining and bar and no where else to gather there, the total lack of coffee anywhere, a variety of other complaints. staff and cleanliness were good. I would not stay there again give the above and various other issues

title: Business and Pleasure Trip
text: The Iroquois Hotel is very close to Times Square and Bryant Park---only a few minutes walk---yet it is located on a street that is quiet and safe.  If you can get a good deal, like us, it is a perfect hub location to plan your day trips around the city.  The rooms are impeccable.  Clean, well decorated, with a fridge to put your water bottles.  All the employees are welcoming, friendly, and professional.  Do not hesitate to stay here for either business or pleasure or both.

title: Séjour à Manhattan
text:
Super personnel avenant situé tout près de time square et la rue de l’hotel N’est pas bruyante 
C’est ultra propre les chambres sont impeccables 
Les lits sont ultra confortables je recommande cet hotel sans reserve

title: Excellent hotel choice
text: We have stayed here multiple times and will continue doing so. The recent renovations make it even better and we look forward to their completion. Even with renovations underway, the hotel was very comfortable, clean, friendly, and the renovations did not disrupt anything.

title: Welcoming oasis in a city that never sleeps
text: From the doorman to the desk staff a ready smile and positive comments were expressed. The room was comfortable and offered a good nights sleep. I recommend bringing your own beverage of choice if you like to imbibe in the comfort of your hotel as the lounge is currently closed for renovation.

title: Dawn
text: My husband and I wanted a weekend in the city.  A friend recommended the Iroquois Hotel.  We could not have been more pleased!  The Iroquois is a charming boutique hotel that was centrally located to all the things we wanted to enjoy.   The rooms were chic, clean and fresh. We loved the retro city photographs that hung around the halls and the room.  The beds were firm and the bedding was crisp and very comfortable.  The staff was attentive and had great knowledge of the area.  They were helpful in pointing us in the right direction when it came to dinner reservations and special events going on in the city that weekend.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  Besides the comfort and quality of the rooms, the location was just steps away from the theaters, great shops, cafes, bars, and restaurants.

title: 3rd time a charm ( July 5th,6th,7th)
text: This is my 3rd time staying here in the last year. (The 1st time and 2nd time were also a charm) A wonderful boutique hotel with personalized service (kudos to Christoph), spotless rooms, and excellent location near Time Square, Broadway, Bryant Park,5th Avenue, Grand Central and subways. The hotel is currently undergoing a renovation ( no restaurant on premise) and one elevator. However do not let this stop you from staying here. Highly recommended.

title: Hotel Iroquios
text: We absolutely loved the Hotel and its location.  It was within walking distance (for us) of everything and place that we wanted to go do and see.  we were very happy!  We would recommend this property to everyone!

title: Exceptional Location!
text:
We appreciated the location of the Iroquois Hotel... it is in a quiet location but close to Times Square.
The staff was helpful and personable.
I booked the property through Hotels.com and was not aware of the Bar/ Restaurant closure, due to renovations. That was a bit of a letdown.

title: An oasis near Broadway and Times Square
text: Would recommend to anyone who likes small, quite hotels in the city. A real treat compared to the loud, noisy, tourist megaliths that seem to proliferate in the City. A very welcome and much appreciated respite from constant flow of the city!

title: Great value and quality renovations
text: The Iroquois is still going through renovations, but the only inconvenience was the lobby. There was no early morning coffee and newspaper to greet guests, which seems like such an inexpensive yet much appreciated touch. Inconsistent doorman availability.  Room was beautiful and well appointed. And a really clean and friendly diner is just steps away!

title: Eats and Shows
text: Second time at the Iroquois, and was not disappointed. Ideal location and friendly staff. Was hoping for completed remodeling, but will just have to return to see it! The hotel even offered a free 90 minute walking tour of Bryant Park, the library, and Grand Central Station.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: Having stayed at other small luxury hotels in NYC, The Iroquois was a breath of fresh air.  Rooms were clean, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Walking distance to the theater district and many restaurants.

title: Trip to NYC from Canadians
text: The hotel was excellent and the staff we're very friendly and attentive. The room's are fairly large considering this is NYC and we had a great time. Would not hesitate to comeback and stay @ this hotel.

title: Annie Kay
text: Wonderful!! Loved the location and the employees were wonderful!! also they always had water and fruit available in the lobby!!  They could use a nice restaurant/bar in the hotel.  However, I heard that is in the making!!

title: Exceptional staff, comfy, cozy, spacious rooms!
text: We had a wonderful stay. The hotel was undergoing renovations but we barely noticed the inconvenience  due to the fantastic staff. I was at some eyes and smiles on their faces from Dorman to check in to the concierge. I think given great information from Vanessa and everything was seamless and comfortable. Rooms are spacious by New York City standards and clean and quiet. Everyone was so lovely and we hope to come back on reservations are complete. Stay here he will not be disappointed. Location was excellent as well convenient dining and Broadway.

title: Good spot when working late in the city
text:
Clean. Great bed. Dark rooms. Quite. Perfect when working late and have early morning meetings. 
Rooms are small, but more than fill the bill. Construction is taking place, so there is a wait for the elevator, but that isn't something to gripe about. Just plan accordingly.

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: The Iroquois hotel is in a great location, convenient to Rockefeller Center and other midtown locations.  It doesn't have the fancy lobby that other motels may have, but I found the rooms to be very nice and up to date.  If you normally stay at a Four Season, Ritz Carlton, etc., this is a nice alternative.

title: Great hotel - friendly staff!!!
text: This hotel is great! Good location- close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The best part was how amazing the staff is! I would book here again  just because of how great they are! If you will be staying in the area check this place out!

title: Perfect location
text: Respectfully workers. The only thing that surprised me was how small our room was. Main entrance or lobby was small but l was told that it was under construction. Room cleaning was good. Location was perfect. Serving coffee/tea, ice water in the morning was perfect

title: Happy, Happy at the Iroquois
text: Terrific hotel!  The rooms have very comfortable beds with nice linens.  The rooms are appointed with all new items; LG flat screen TV, refrigerator, hair dryer, iron.  It's like being at home or much nicer!  The staff is exceptional.  They all have been there quite a long time.

title: Nice hotel
text: My wife and I stayed for 4 days/3 nights at the Iroquois recently and enjoyed our stay. We had a queen room on the 5th floor which had zero view, but was nice and quiet. Good working A/C and comfy bed. The bathroom is painfully small...we could never both be in it. But the shower was fine with good water pressure. The heated bathroom tiles were a nice touch. Each afternoon they'd put out a free alcoholic beverage...bottle of wine or a rum punch. My main gripe is I'm a big coffee guy. No coffee maker in the room and they only put coffee out in the morning (which wasn't very good). Free coffee all day is always a nice perk I like at a hotel, but not a deal breaker. Front desk and door staff were very kind. The Iroquois didn't blow me away by any stretch but we weren't disappointed at all and enjoyed our stay.

title: Beautiful Hotel and Great Staff
